text.Skelly: I am. And funny you should put it like that. Boyo, I am asking you to get me out of here. Permanently, if you catch my drift. This standing around stuff... just kind of wears on you, after a while, you know?

text.Zagreus: ...I know. I can only imagine. Tell me what I can do.

text.Skelly: That blade of yours back there. It's got a special power. Your Aspect, now that it's maxed out. You got to let me have it with that thing... and then I'm out of here.

text.Zagreus: Then you'd be dead... forever? You're asking me to kill you.

text.Skelly: I know it's a lot to dump on you, but I got my reasons. I don't exactly have a lot of options, here, so... give it some thought. Till then, we'll act like nothing's changed, all right?

text.Zagreus: Sure looks that way.

text.Skelly: Huzzah!
So, uh, pal? My sources tell me that you made it pretty far. Which means... my usefulness is coming to an end.

text.Zagreus: Your usefulness, what, you just mean the standing around, letting me lay into you with whatever vicious attack sequence I fancy at the time?

text.Skelly: Yeah! Once you achieve your goal... my contract's up. You won't need me anymore.

text.Zagreus: But only if I leave for good, isn't that right? So if I stuck around... you'd stay here, too?

text.Skelly: Probably, but... wait, you're really going to stay?

text.Zagreus: It better be.

text.Skelly: So Mama's back in town from what I hear, boyo! It's awful nice knowing I trained you well.

text.Zagreus: Erm, you must mean the Queen, and evidently you're aware of our relationship. You keep that quiet, understand, Skelly?

text.Skelly: Ahh, and thus the pupil trains the master, for a change! I hear you, pal. Your secret's safe with me.

text.Zagreus: Same here.

text.Skelly: You must have had yourself a real bash, with all those fancy gods and stuff! Could hear all the festivity from all the way out here. How was it, pal?

text.Zagreus: It... went better than expected, all in all. I hope you didn't feel left out! It was a pretty limited guest list. Kind of a diplomatic mission, I would say. Not quite as good a time as it might have sounded from the outside.

text.Skelly: Ohh, don't you even worry about me, there, pal! I much prefer the solitary life, and besides! When things are good for you, they're good for me. Glad everything worked out.
Less yakking, more smacking, boyo, now come on!
Less chatter, more batter, boyo, hit me already!
Less talking, more socking, here, pal!
Come on, boyo, less gabbing, more stabbing over here!
Less prattle, more battle, boyo, give me all you got!
Can't break these bones, pal, what you just try it!
You want another a piece of this, or what?
Enough with the small talk, boyo, hit me, go on!
Trying to bore me to death with all this chit-chat, pal?
This look like a shoulder to cry on to you, boyo?
Let me have it already, boyo, no holding back!
Let's see what you can do in terms of hitting me, pal!
You could be hitting me right now, boyo!
Sure could go for somebody just whaling away on me right now.
What's the matter, you gone soft or something, pal?
You going to hit me over here, or what?
Go on, boyo, give me your best shot, it's my job!
Sure could use a good smack in the jaw from you right about now!
You want to fight me, boyo, well hop to it, stat!
What do I look like, pal, some kind of conversationalist?
Our relationship, boyo, requires no exchange of words!

text.Zagreus: For you, mate! Thought you might get a kick out of this.

text.Skelly: For me, pal? Awful nice of you, just awful nice, but guess what, I got this for you! Tit for tat, you understand, a deal's a deal!
Whoa-hoh, you being serious here, pal? You brought that all this way, for little old me?! That's real nice of you!

text.Zagreus: You're not so bad yourself, mate. Thanks for always being here for me to savagely attack without a second thought.

text.Skelly: Whoaaaa, now get a load of what you got there, boyo! Wait, really, that's for me? Or you just pulling my leg?

text.Zagreus: I'm really giving this to you, mate. Now go enjoy it, will you? Once I've finished pummeling you some more just for the sake of it.

text.Skelly: Heeey now that's what I'm talking about, thanks, boyo! Won't forget you doing me a solid like this, cross my heart!!

text.Zagreus: No need to thank me, mate. But don't you dare forget it or I'll attack you repeatedly and without mercy.

text.Skelly: Oh look here, pal, I can't just keep accepting these from you! Not when they're paying me already, I got standards to uphold, you know?

text.Zagreus: I will look the other way if you do, mate. Now, here! Or else!

text.Skelly: Haaah, you're kidding, what? Sometimes, boyo, you make me feel alive again, you know that? Being honest with you here, I'm grateful, really.

text.Zagreus: If not for you, my friend, I'd have no one to viciously attack with no fear of reprisal whatsoever.
Skelly, while I know your services have already been paid in full, your sources ought to know you've been doing an excellent job. So much so, I wanted to give you this.

text.Skelly: Whaaa, is that a vintage bottle of Ambrosia, pal?! I never even thought I'd get to try a thing like that, I mean, what am I, here? Know what, I want you to have this. To symbolize our friendship, and in case you ever need a hand out there.
Hah!! Nope!

text.Zagreus: Drat.
Hope you enjoyed that vintage bottle of Ambrosia last time, Skelly, because I got you another. Here!

text.Skelly: Aww, no way, boyo, you kidding me right now? Why are you even, I... look, I, I just stand around and let you beat me up, you don't have to do this. You don't even know who I am. Who I was.

text.Zagreus: You're my friend, mate. That's all that matters. Although... I don't suppose you're willing to divulge those types of details? Just out of curiosity.
Well great, I guess!
You know, Skelly, I still cannot entirely get over that whole permanently-kill-you stunt you pulled on me. You had me deeply worried for a while, all for just a laugh?

text.Skelly: Yeah, that's right! Not exactly much to do here, case you hadn't noticed recently! Good thing I'm able to stay occupied with intellectual pursuits.

text.Zagreus: That's what you call it, then? In any case, I did want to make sure: You sure that you're all right, having to stand around like this?

text.Skelly: You kidding, pal? This is the life! Imagine getting paid to stand around! And being pals with you!

CHOICE.Skelly: Hahaha, got you pretty good, again, didn't I, boyo?! I am asking you to get me out of here. Hahahaha! All that stuff about your blade, and your Aspect, I mean, you ate all of it right up! Woo, hoo-hoo!

CHOICE.Zagreus: It appears I've been the victim of an elaborate prank. Not sure that I appreciate it, Skelly. What if I were to never hit you again, how would you like that?

CHOICE.Skelly: Whoa, whoa whoa whoa whoa, whoa! Now come on, boyo, it was just a joke, I figured things could lighten up a little here. Don't need to do anything rash!

CHOICE.DROPPED_Zagreus: Skelly, mate... this what I think it is?

CHOICE.Zagreus: Skelly, mate! You really shouldn't have. Do you have any idea how hard-to-find this is?!

CHOICE.Skelly: What'd you get, what'd you get?
Look at this guy over here.
Time for a break there, pal?
So you want to give it a rest, or what?
All right, pal, you can stop!
Anytime you want to stop, there, boyo.
How am I supposed to get back?
Don't think I'm supposed to be here.
Uh kind of stuck here, pal.
Never felt a cut like that before!
Love what you've done to your sword!
That bow's got a different sting to it!
New arrows or something there pal?
Your shield's looking pretty handsome pal!
I get the feeling I am being watched...?
Never been stabbed quite like that!
Felt all three points on that spear, pal!
Hey that shot felt different somehow!
You been messing with that shooty thing pal?
More of a slicing feel there rather than a stabbing!
Yeoow that's got a nice little kick of heat to it!
Hooh now that's what I call getting shot by arrows!
Ooh, nice burning sensation from that!
Oof, I felt that deep down in my jaw!

CHOICE.DROPPED_Skelly: What if I beg for mercy, huh?

CHOICE.Skelly: Pssh I coud hit harder than that!
What'd you get, what'd you get?
Want a piece of me boyo?
Think you can take me boyo?
Hah, haha, bet I got you pretty good!
All that damage, that was nothing, pal!
Oh, have I got something for you, boyo!

CHOICE.Zagreus: Finally did it, what do I get?
Another Skelly statue. Why am I not surprised.

CHOICE.Skelly: Because, pal, you are a discerning individual!

CHOICE.Zagreus: I have a feeling I know what this is...
It's another statue of you, Skelly.

CHOICE.Skelly: Go fill out that form you got.
I don't make the rules, pal.
Got to sign up for this contest.
Come on, pal, live a little!
Think you got what it takes?!
Come on, pal, live a little!
Nuh-uh, you gotta work for it!
I don't make the rules, pal.
Whoa don't you touch that thing!
That is a priceless work of art there pal!
Hey, don't you scratch that thing, boyo!
You keep that whip away from my pal!
So, what's going on between you two?
Look at the size of that thing!
Hey you big lug, over here!
Hey Big-Bones, want some of this?!
Why'd you drag me into this one, pal?!
Nice bone structure on that thing over there!
Hey, bull boy, what's the matter?
Ooh, help, he's got a double bladed axe!
The king of Athens, I'm so scared, boyo!
This one's for you guys out in the cheap seats!
Looks like I made it for the big event!
Hey Thanatos, big fan right here!
Hey Thanatos, big fan right here!
Uh, must have taken a wrong turn somewhere!
Hey, what you doing all the way up here?
Whoa it's Papa, you're in trouble, pal!
Think this one's between you and Papa, pal!
Whoever kills me gets a big promotion!
Ah boyo this place is a mess!
Whoa nice place to stand around!
Got here just as soon as I was able, pal!
Hah what a bunch of bozos!!
Whoa it is hot in here!
Hey look at all that magma!
Whoa, look at all of this!
Whoa this place is a dump!
The air feels weird up here!
You haven't seen the last of me!!

CHOICE.Megaera: You've got a lot of nerve.
Think you can keep this up?
Wretches of the Underworld, to me!
Wretches of Tartarus, I summon you!
Hear me, Wretches, and come fight with me!
Back me up, Wretches of Tartarus, right now!
All right, you wretched shades, appear!
Hope you don't mind if I invited a few friends?
You're going to pay for this.
I will not let you win.
I'm not through with you yet.
I'm not through with you yet.
I'm not finished with you yet.
You used to be a total pushover.
How did you get this tough.
Get the hell out of here.
I'll hurt you worse than that.
I know Nyx is helping you.
You're running out of chances, Zagreus.
You'll need more help than that.
What is the meaning of this?
You're going to be sorry, Sisyphus!
Get back to your post, Shade!
I told you to get out!
I said stay out of this!
You are not authorized to be here!
Don't you have someplace else to be?
He had no chance against us.
You're mine and always will be, Zagreus.
You're mine, Zag. Don't forget it.
We'll have to finish this back home.
It's all part of the job.
You could do better than that, Zagreus.
Don't get so careless with me next time, Zag.
Thanks for the little workout there.
I guess I'll see you back here before long.
About damn time I finally got you, Zag.
Did you go easy on me, Zagreus?
Did you just let me win...?
You must have let me win.
Your heart just wasn't in it... why?
I'll take what vengeance I can get.
The Fates were on my side for once.
You better not have given me this one.
Still got it in me after all this time.
Don't you know when to quit?
I'll kill you next time, too.
You just can't take a hint.
I'll kill you again, and again, and again.
Your shining relatives can't help you here.
Next time will pan out just like this.
I'll send you back as often as it takes.
Got you again like in the old days, Zag.
Beginning to see a pattern, Zagreus?
I'll never hold back, for you or anyone.
There! Now get out of my hall.
Get the hell out of here.
Do say hello to Nyx for me.
What did you do to me....
Am I supposed to be impressed?
You can do better than that.

text.Megaera: Damn it!
Damn you!
Curse you!
Blood and darkness!
Not again!
My sisters and I. We've had a chance to talk, and we have come to an agreement, Zagreus. As you can see.

text.Alecto: Megaera, Tis, you ready?

text.Zagreus: Three against one. Doesn't seem all that sporting, now, does it?

text.Megaera: We're each well past the need for any sport. We'll kill you, whatever it takes. Erinyes! Now.
What's the matter, Zagreus? You look a bit uncomfortable. Something you want to say to me? Or any one of us?

text.Zagreus: Well, it's just... there's something that I wanted to discuss with you, at some point, Meg, but after more consideration, I am thinking maybe now is not the time.

text.Megaera: I understand entirely. Though you should know my sisters and I keep no secrets from each other, anymore. Isn't that right, Sisters?
Eugh, I almost want to thank you, Zagreus. I thought you'd never change that blasted Pact, and leave me here, in peace.

text.Zagreus: What, you mean you aren't lonelier without Alecto's or Tisiphone's companionship? They seem so wonderful to have around.

text.Megaera: They're tolerable each to some extent. About as much as I can say for you. Now let's the two of us begin.
See, Alecto? He is right on time, just as I said.

text.Alecto: Megaera, bleed him!

text.Megaera: Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.
I have to level with you, Zagreus. For all we've been through... never once have I wanted you to meet my sisters.

text.Zagreus: I can't imagine why not! We had a lovely time getting to know each other. We laughed, we cried! My only regret was that you couldn't be there, yourself.

text.Megaera: You don't know what you're saying. There's a reason that they're not permitted in the House. Though, come on. One of us is going back there, now.
You've really done it, Zagreus. My sisters have returned. All three of us now share the same assignment.

text.Zagreus: Is it wrong of me that I am somewhat honored to have garnered the attention of the Erinyes?

text.Megaera: Oh I would say it's very wrong of you, indeed.
I sense something different about you, Zagreus. Your old weakness. Ah... the Mirror. I thought you said you weren't trying to compete with me?

text.Zagreus: I wasn't. But then you gave me a good idea to try. I'm not as weak as I once was. With or without the Mirror's help.

text.Megaera: Is that so? Well then let's see if you're correct. Come on.
I heard that you escaped. Then, what are you still doing here? Forget something along the way?

text.Zagreus: You know... I think I'd rather fight you to the death again than try to answer either of those questions, right now.

text.Megaera: I don't know what you're up to, Zagreus. But I guess it doesn't matter, either way. All that matters is you're not getting past me.
Your mother has returned to us, already, Zagreus. And still you're going to keep battling your way out, past me and everything up there? Why?

text.Zagreus: Father says there's no escape from here, and I like to repeatedly show him he's wrong. Besides, I think getting out there a bit from time to time does me some good.

text.Megaera: Sounds like you've found yourself a steady line of work. Most jobs just need doing. If this one gives you some fulfillment, stick to it. Now, come on.
What is it that you're up to now, Zagreus? The Queen is back. But still you're making me show up like this?

text.Zagreus: Got some unfinished business with the Olympians to take care of, was in the area, figured I'd say hi. Hi, Meg!

text.Megaera: Don't start with me. You show up here, we fight, somebody dies. That's it. Now, who's it going to be?
Been seeing an awful lot of each other lately, haven't we. You had enough of me, yet, Zag?

text.Zagreus: Never enough, Meg. You ready for another go at it, too, I take it?

text.Megaera: Always. Although I do like to keep things fresh, so... surprise me.
Listen to me, Zagreus. Your mother is long gone. You're never getting out of here, and even if you did, what hope could you possibly have in finding her up in the world out there?

text.Zagreus: I've hope enough. Not that it's any of your business anymore.

text.Megaera: Your family is here. And so is your responsibility. You're running from yourself. Though, I can slow you down a bit I think.
What... where did you get the Rail? Do you know what you have? Where are your customary weapons?

text.Zagreus: I left them at home. And, I sort of know what I have, inasmuch as it's largely responsible for getting me this far. Would you like to see a demonstration?

text.Megaera: Yes, I would. I always have, as a matter of fact.
What's that you're holding, Zagreus? Please tell me that you didn't steal the most dangerous, unstable artifacts sealed shut within your father's vault.

text.Zagreus: Erm, it wasn't I who stole them, if that's any reassurance to you, Meg!

text.Megaera: You are a hopeless fool. You cannot possibly know what you're doing with those things. You put them back exactly where you found them.
...Nyx really let Dusa go?

text.Zagreus: She did... so you heard. I don't know what happened. You didn't even get a chance to say goodbye?

text.Megaera: No. Damn it. If you had anything to do with this...! Even if you didn't, come on and die!
What have you done with the Pact, Zagreus? This isn't even Asphodel, and I can barely tolerate the heat. Do you really want to die this terribly?

text.Zagreus: Appreciate all the concern, but I just thought I'd live a little, Meg. You ought to try it for yourself, sometime!

text.Megaera: You ought to try watching your mouth. You want a swift and painful death, you'll have one momentarily.
Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.

text.Zagreus: Come on, Meg. Haven't we had more than enough of each other by now? Besides, don't you have someplace else to be?

text.Megaera: You know exactly why I'm here. Now shut your mouth, and come die like a man.
Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.

text.Zagreus: Come on, Meg. Haven't we had more than enough of each other by now? Besides, don't you have someplace else to be?

text.Megaera: Your father sent me. All in all, I'd rather be on your bad side than his. Now you can turn back like a good little man, or I can send you home the painful way. What'll it be?

text.Zagreus: ...I'll have to go with the painful way.

text.Megaera: A man after my own heart.
Tell me something, Zag, because I'm curious. Do your Olympian relatives know the real reason you've been trying to escape?

text.Zagreus: I'll get around to that in due time. They're family. They'll understand no doubt.

text.Megaera: You're in over your head, you idiot. You'll fray what bonds are left between Lord Hades and those ingrates on Olympus.
Things can't entirely be different between you and me. You know that, don't you, Zag? Not when it comes to this, at least.

text.Zagreus: I do. We wouldn't both be consummate professionals if it were any other way. You won't be going easy on me, will you?

text.Megaera: I'm going to pretend you didn't ask me that. Now give me everything you've got!
What is it, Zagreus? You've got that pleased-with-yourself look, which can only mean you have something obnoxious to tell me.

text.Zagreus: I never! Look, I'm simply pleased to see you, Meg. Hence the insuppressible smile. Could have been one of your lovely sisters here instead...

text.Megaera: You're not going to throw me off my guard that easily. My sisters wouldn't let me hear the end of it.
And where, exactly, do you think you're going, Zagreus?

text.Zagreus: I think I'm going all the way to the top again, Meg. To find my mother. You won't stop me. Get out of my way.

text.Megaera: We both know that's not going to happen. Getting out of your way, I mean.
Your mother, Zagreus. You really think you'll find her once again, out there? Even if you make it out... maybe she's found another hiding place.

text.Zagreus: It isn't us she's hiding from up there. Father let her go. He never wanted to go after her. So I appreciate your concern, but I'll find her again.

text.Megaera: That sounds like information neither one of them would want for me to know. You know the punishment for spilling secrets, don't you?
What are you doing, Zagreus? The Underworld is sealed off. What you're attempting is impossible. You've seen what happens when you go too far.

text.Zagreus: This place can't stay sealed shut forever, Meg. In the meantime, I thought I'd get some practice in, you know?

text.Megaera: I'm not your practice partner, fool.
May I help you with something, Zagreus?

text.Zagreus: Now that you mention it, you can, Meg. I was wondering what was Father carrying on with you about back home?

text.Megaera: Eavesdropping again? If you must know, my job performance is under review. Though, I'm sure this job's about to go just fine.
I sincerely hope that you enjoy these meetings with me while you can. I know I will.

text.Zagreus: Now that's a rather ominous thing to say to someone, Meg. Care to explain in terms an idiot like me could understand?

text.Megaera: Lord Hades is exploring other options. He has no confidence in my ability to stop you anymore. Though, maybe it isn't too late for me to change his mind.
It's been a while, Zagreus. You must have made it pretty far last time. Let's see. Outer reaches of Asphodel?

text.Zagreus: Outer reaches of Asphodel. And I have to say, Meg, you are positively a sight compared with that blasted Bone Hydra stewing away up there.

text.Megaera: How very flattering, to have compared me to the remains of some mindless outsized lizard. Come, maybe I'll kill you just as easily as your new Hydra friend.
How many times have we been going at it like this, Zagreus? You tired of me, yet?

text.Zagreus: We're both immortals, Meg. We'll be seeing plenty of each other for a while yet. I've come to welcome these occasions.

text.Megaera: Then, good. Lashing you across the face beats waiting for the opportunity to do so. Come.
I heard what happened. You crossed the River of Flame. You really did it.

text.Zagreus: That Hydra was a total bastard, though. Bastards. But, you sound practically impressed with me, there, Meg! I feel so flattered!

text.Megaera: You'll soon feel something else. I don't know how you did it. But it changes nothing.
How utterly disgusting... I was just counting, Zagreus, and as it happens, I have lost to you fifty times, already! If not more. Can you believe this? Ugh, how I've fallen.

text.Zagreus: Oh, don't take it so hard, Meg! Once you die several dozen times, you start to get accustomed to the emotional pain, as well as the physical! Up for some more of either?

text.Megaera: Of course! Who do you think I am? Although I guess there's no use keeping score with you.
You know how many times you've beaten me, here, Zagreus? Can you even guess?

text.Zagreus: Erm... feels like a lot, admittedly, I mean, we've been going at this for a while, now. Four hundred and twelve times...?

text.Megaera: ...Five hundred times, exactly. Though I figure, you haven't been keeping track of how many times I've killed you. Ugh, maybe that's my problem. Well, plenty of time to work it out after this.
You beat Alecto, Zag. Could hear her screaming her head off about it all the way through Tartarus... I almost want to thank you.

text.Zagreus: I almost want to say you're very welcome. Have you and she always been on bad terms like this?

text.Megaera: We have long-standing differences. It's worse with family. You know what it's like.
Huh. Not even Tisiphone could stop you. Your father must be sorely disappointed.

text.Zagreus: He's difficult to please, that much is true. What happened to Tisiphone, anyway? She isn't much for conversation.

text.Megaera: It runs in the family. Tis only knows her work. And, professional distance is important.
If there's anyone in all the Underworld who owes you, Zagreus, it's your friend, Sisyphus. He would be much worse off if not for you.

text.Zagreus: What, because I've been distracting you from administering lashings like before? I hate to think you prefer to whip with no fear of reprisal whatsoever, Meg.

text.Megaera: Dereliction of duty and fear of reprisal are not one and the same. Though you don't seem to be concerned with either one.
Your weapon's looking rather dull, there, Zagreus. Great Daedalus decided not to grace you with his gifts this time around?

text.Zagreus: Now that you mention it, he hasn't, no. Though I'm prepared to say I don't need special augmentations to get past you.

text.Megaera: Oh, we can put that to the test right now. Just remember, you need all the help you can get.
That Mirror's made you stronger, Zagreus. You're fortunate to have Nyx helping you.

text.Zagreus: No hard feelings. I think she feels partly responsible for all of this.

text.Megaera: She shouldn't. The only one responsible for all of this is you. And I thought even you would have understood that by now.
Tsch. I can't believe it. You signed the Pact of Punishment. Have you completely lost your mind? Or just trying to insult me?

text.Zagreus: Well if you're going to be so rude about it, maybe a little of each? Though, what do you even care which pacts I sign or don't?

text.Megaera: I'm not an idiot. I see what you're doing. You want to be punished? Then, come on.
Tsch. You really volunteered into a Pact of Punishment? You can't back out of it, now. You're even more of a fool than I already thought.

text.Zagreus: Maybe I just like a challenge, ever thought of that? Besides, what do you even care which pacts I sign or don't?

text.Megaera: You're right. I don't care. You want to be punished? Then, come on.
I have been longing for a fairer fight with you. Maybe that's why you signed the Pact? To pity me?

text.Zagreus: I have my reasons. Pitying you isn't one of them. Although I guess you don't believe me, do you?

text.Megaera: If it's punishment you want, how am I to say no?
You know I can hit even harder than usual with the Pact of Punishment working against you. Maybe that's why you signed it? To pity me?

text.Zagreus: I have my reasons. Pitying you isn't one of them. Although I guess you don't believe me, do you?

text.Megaera: No, I don't think I do. Come on, then, and let's see where all your pity gets you.
This should be over pretty quickly, I think, Zag. Never took you for the Forced Overtime type. That's not a Pact condition for the faint of heart.

text.Zagreus: You wound me, Meg! You know I like to barge into situations thoughtlessly and recklessly, and sort everything out later. Forced Overtime's the perfect fit!

text.Megaera: Ahh, well, when you put it that way. Look, don't go saying I didn't warn you.
Hold it, Zagreus. I sense something, is that... ah. You've been in contact with Chaos. So even they are now involved with this.

text.Zagreus: Just because Chaos is giving me the power to crush you doesn't mean they're getting involved with this, does it?

text.Megaera: You don't know who or what you're dealing with. Ask Nyx about them for me sometime. Here, I'll give you a chance to ask her very soon.
I know that Thanatos assisted you in getting to this point. I don't appreciate his interference.

text.Zagreus: I'm sure you'll have a chance to tell him back at home.

text.Megaera: He has domain over the wretched shades, but his power has no sway with me. And neither does your own.
I still cannot believe that Thanatos is helping you. I mistook him for someone with integrity.

text.Zagreus: You mistook him for someone who blindly follows orders without considering the implications.

text.Megaera: How dare you...! If you like death so much, then here, let me indulge you. Thanatos will welcome you with open arms.
Prince Zagreus, you are trespassing beyond the limits of your authority. I am under orders to stop you.

text.Zagreus: Come on, Meg, why so formal all of a sudden? We've been through this countless times. Wait, is it because...?

text.Megaera: Oh, come on, Zag. Will you just learn to play along, for once? Come on and fight me like you mean it.
What is it, Zagreus? You look a little hesitant to go another round with me. Or is it my imagination?

text.Zagreus: Well, it's just... can we really keep the personal and the professional completely separate like this, Meg? It's with mixed emotions that I fight you to the death, only to be happy to see you back at the House.

text.Megaera: Then learn to keep your emotions in check. You keep them bottled up a while, they'll be that much stronger when it's time to let them out.
Nice gloves, there, Zagreus. Think you can take me up close with those things? Well within striking distance of my whip.

text.Zagreus: Not wearing them for fashion's sake, here, Meg. You won't mind if I give you my best shot with Malphon here, will you?

text.Megaera: I'd mind if you didn't. Want to get your hands dirty, fine. Let's see it.
What happened to your weapon, Zagreus? I sensed its power long before you turned up. That isn't just some Daedalus enchantment on it.

text.Zagreus: Oh, Stygius and I have been getting much more closely acquainted lately, Meg. Would you care to see the fruits of our healthy symbiotic relationship?

text.Megaera: You, in a healthy relationship? Why yes, then this I have to see.
Nice earring, Zagreus. Maybe I should have thought twice before giving you a thing like that.

text.Zagreus: Why, because the gift you generously gave me may end up being instrumental in your own demise? Sounds straight out of one of those tales the mortals like to go spreading around.

text.Megaera: They like it when best-laid plans fall completely to pieces, don't they? You better grow to like it, too.
I sense something of death upon you, Zagreus. What's that you have, something from Thanatos is it?

text.Zagreus: Oh, this old thing? It's just a listless butterfly Than gave me, which happens to fill me with even more supernatural strength than usual. Don't pay it any mind.

text.Megaera: Not even Thanatos can help you here. But if I ever start a bug collection, I'll know who to call.
You know Battie's not going to work here, don't you? I'm definitely not going to help you out of this one.

text.Zagreus: Come on, Meg, you can do anything if you set your mind to it! Though, don't worry, Battie's just here for the show.

text.Megaera: Then, let's make it a good one. Come on.
Your little bat companion not too much to handle, is she, Zagreus? I trust you're taking excellent care of her. Not that she needs your help.

text.Zagreus: Oh she's been positively perfect, thank you, Meg. Especially in how she puts us into contact when I need a hand. I hope it's not too much hassle, helping out from time to time?

text.Megaera: If you were hoping to avoid a hassle, you've definitely come to the wrong place.
Look at yourself, Zagreus, you are a total mess. Halfway to death or worse. You're making this too easy.

text.Zagreus: Hit a few snags on my way to meet you, Meg. So, if you wouldn't mind going easy on me this one?

text.Megaera: Not on your life or death. But I will kill you quickly, how's that?
You're wounded, Zagreus. How unbecoming of a god. Not to mention that I have the upper hand.

text.Zagreus: I figured I'd give you a head start this time, so I let the wretched shades bludgeon me repeatedly along the way.

text.Megaera: Fool. If you're half-dead already by the time you get to me, what hope can you possibly have for what lies ahead?
You look like you had trouble getting to me, Zagreus. Did you try asking for directions on the way?

text.Zagreus: You sound like Hypnos. He's getting to you, isn't he. Isn't he!

text.Megaera: You shut your mouth right now, with that. Come die.
You're not escaping death this time, here, Zagreus. You ready to go home?

text.Zagreus: No, not just yet, though thanks for asking, Meg. If you intend to force me, know that I am going to resist, with all my might.

text.Megaera: Well I appreciate the warning. Now prepare to die.
Ever stubborn, aren't you. Maybe my whip might make you reconsider whatever it is that you're attempting here.

text.Zagreus: Your whip's not been all that persuasive in the past.

text.Megaera: Maybe persistence will pay off for both of us. Come, then.
And there you are again. Lord Hades ought to lock you up rather than let you run amok in his domain like this.

text.Zagreus: I'm sure he'd welcome all this feedback from you, Meg. Or maybe you're just pining for my father's job?

text.Megaera: I have no envy for your father's position. Besides, I happen to enjoy my own responsibilities.
Oh, there you are. Just as I was beginning to think it's been too long since last I killed you, Zag.

text.Zagreus: Admit it, Meg. You can't stop thinking about me.

text.Megaera: Don't flatter yourself. I think of you in pain. And now there's no more need for the imagination.
Well, Zag? Any last requests this time before I send you home?

text.Zagreus: Let's see, how about a swift and painful death, would that be possible?

text.Megaera: Be cheeky all you like. You'll get exactly what you asked, and nothing more.
Pff. And here you are again. You're slow to learn the way of things I see.

text.Zagreus: I may be slow to learn, but... least I'm rather patient!

text.Megaera: This talk about your patience is beginning to test mine. Enough! Come on and die.
Give up already, Zag. Or I'll keep killing you each time you come this far.

text.Zagreus: I have some bad news for you, Meg. Little by little, I'm getting stronger.

text.Megaera: That may be so. But you will never be my equal. Ever. You'd do well to remember that.
You're never getting past me, Zagreus.

text.Zagreus: While that's probably the case... maybe I will this time.

text.Megaera: Keep telling yourself that. Maybe it'll help take your mind off the pain that is to come.
Even if you manage to get past me, there's no getting out of Asphodel. You saw what it was like. You really want to go back there?

text.Zagreus: It's not a matter of want. The way out is there in that direction, past the river of flame.

text.Megaera: You're more stubborn than your father. I never thought that such a thing was possible.
Finally, you're back. You won't get past me like you did last time. Though, I would like to see you try.
Well, Zag? May I have this dance for old time's sake?
You ready for me this time, Zagreus? Come on and fight. No holding back.
I guess we know the drill by now, don't we. Not that I don't enjoy our little arguments, in my own way.
He's here, Alecto. Tis. Let's get him, now.
Prepare yourselves, Sisters. And you, too, Zag.
Together this time, Sisters. Go!
Alecto. Tisiphone. Our guest is here.
He's here. Let's get to work, Sisters.
Well, Sisters? We have a reputation to uphold.
You ready, Sisters? There he is. Now, on my mark.
All right, Sisters, let's show him what we've got.
Alecto, Tis, he's mine. Just back me up.
No time for further talk, now, Sisters. Take him, now.
No quarter now or ever, Erinyes. Attack!
Are you ready, Sister? Let's take care of him.
Come, Sister, it's time to get to work.
He's here, Sister. Let's go.
It's him. Prepare yourself, Sister.
Alecto and I were just wondering when you'd arrive.
See, Alecto? He is right on time, just as I said.
You see, Tisiphone? He's here, just as I said.
Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.
Let's go, Sister. Together, we can take him.
...Well, Sister, we'll have to finish catching up some other time.
I wish it didn't have to be this way.
Why must we always have to fight.
It's time we had one of our little fights.
I so was hoping you'd show up just now.
Now that you're here, how about a little dance?
How about we go once more for old time's sake?
You ready for me, Zagreus?
And here I was just wondering when you'd show up.
And there he is at last, the Prince himself.
You've come to die to me again?
I killed you last time, I'll kill you again.
I guess you want to die again?
It seems you haven't learned your lesson yet.
I hope you'll pose more of a threat this time.
You don't seem to learn. Then, come and die.
You aren't getting past me, Zagreus.
I'll never stand aside for you.
I'm back again, and I'll keep coming back.
You'll get past me over my dead body.
I'm never going to back down from you.
I guess we know how this is going to go.
I'm pledged to stand against you, Zagreus.
I will keep coming back, the same as you.
I will not stand aside for you, Zagreus.
Don't know if I can stop you anymore, but I can slow you down.
I'll get you back for what you did last time.
One of these encounters, you'll let your guard down, and I'll kill you again for old time's sake.
Even if I can't stop you... I can get a few good hits in, I'm sure.
I've got a lot of payback to administer here, let me tell you, Zag.
Ungh, I've practically lost count how many times you beat me in a row here, Zag...
I thought you might show up.
You're right on schedule.
No need for small talk, Zag.
Up for another fight I see?
What say we get things started.
You ready for me, Zagreus?
Come on and show me what you've got.
Let's go, then, Zagreus.
I'm ready for you, Zag.
Not one step further, Zag.
I can't just let you off without a fight.
It's you again, is it.
Come all this way again, just to see me.
Get on your guard, Zagreus.
You're prompt sometimes, I have to give you that.
Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.
Come for another round with me, Zagreus?
Let's see if you can make it past me, Zag.
No hard feelings, Zagreus. And don't you dare hold back.
One thing I like about you, Zag? You're always right on time.
I hope you're ready for me this time, Zagreus.
Don't think I'm going to go easy on you, Zagreus.
You know it's strictly business here between us, don't you, Zag?
I expect you to give me the best you've got, Zagreus.
If you so much as think of going easy on me, Zagreus, I'll kill you.
No holding back against me, Zagreus. Certainly not here.
You'll find I don't grow weary of these run-ins with you, Zag.
You know I can't just let you walk away without a fight.
You won't be getting out of here without a dance.
There's nothing you can do to hurt me, Zag. Though I would like to see you try.
I'm starting to enjoy these little outings with you, Zag.
Come on, Zag. Come at me with everything you've got.
Do you want me, Zagreus? Then come and get me.
I'll give you one thing, Zag. You never keep me waiting very long.
You're looking pretty good, there, Zag. Though let me see what I can do.
No pleasure without pain, right, Zagreus?

CHOICE.Alecto: Get out of here, death god!
Do I know you, dead man?!
What in the hell was that?!
The hell did that come from?!
Stay out of this, I said!
Oh don't you mess with me!
You know, I can get used to this!
You don't have what it takes, redblood.
Try not to waste my time again, hm?
Was just a matter of time I guess.
We fury sisters do like our revenge.
About damn time I got my way with you.
You better not be going easy on me, redblood.
That was a sloppy fight even for you, redblood.
See you next time, you trash.
I told you what was going to happen.
Go on now back to daddy.
Bye now, see you next time!
Aw, we were just getting started.

CHOICE.DROPPED_Alecto: Right down the drain with you.

CHOICE.Alecto: Another piece of trash goes down the drain.
All right, all right, that's enough.
I'll hurt you worse than that.

text.Alecto: You ready, Megaera? Tisiphone? Let's go.
Check it out, Sis! The god of trash is here. Let's get to work.
Ugh, would you just look at him! That smug look, that posture, everything! Please tell me you're not going soft for this trash-god, Sister.

text.Megaera: Come on, Alecto. When was the last time that we looked to one another for approval? Besides, as long as we kill him, what do you even care?

text.Alecto: You know, fair point, there, Sister! Very nicely said. Let's kill him, now!
Look at this awful piece of trash, come here again to bleed all over our nice shiny floor. Ready to fight my lovely sister, there, redblood?

text.Megaera: He's not so awful once you get to know him, Sis. Not that it matters for what we're about to do.

text.Alecto: The both of you disgust me, Meg, you know that? Get it together and kill him this time, damn you!
You must have gone and signed a Pact! Isn't that right, redblood? Tell me right now.

text.Zagreus: Well, as a matter of fact, I have. Though I don't see how that's any business of yours, Alecto.

text.Alecto: I like working alone! And you don't see me doing that, right now, do you? So I would say it's my business, all right. Along with killing you!
Whew, I thought I'd never get some quiet time again, you know, redblood? That damned Pact you stupidly agreed to, making me work with my sisters again. I'll get you for that!

text.Zagreus: I'm sensing a pattern that it really doesn't take much for you to have something to get me for, does it?

text.Alecto: Oh, that's rich! How smart of you, you're smart! Know what? I'll get you for that, too.
Ah, hah hah, hohohohohhh. Finally. I've been waiting for this! Really.

text.Zagreus: You must be one of Megaera's lovely sisters, I don't believe we've had the pleasure. Waiting for what, exactly?

text.Alecto: ...So sick of, you know, doing my regular job, uninterrupted. Not having to clean up Meg's messes!

text.Zagreus: I get the feeling we're starting off on the wrong foot.

text.Alecto: Anyway. I always wanted to kill a god. You'll have to do.
Heard rumblings about some news back at your daddy's House, redblood. So his illustrious abducted Queen, she's come back home?!

text.Zagreus: Wait, how do you even know all that? And should you really be talking about the Queen that way?

text.Alecto: I don't answer to her! She can come and go as she wants for all I care. But you want to know who can't?! Yeah, you.
I got to ask, how come you keep on showing up, redblood? I thought you would have had enough beatings by now.

text.Zagreus: Well, you know, I've come to enjoy these visits with you so much, Alecto, that I've made it something of a regular routine. Form good habits, and then stick to them, I say!

text.Alecto: You call this a good habit, huh? Maybe for me, it is. Well, come here all you like, and I will be here waiting, every single time! About once every three times, anyway.
Heard you had a real bash down in your daddy's House, redblood. So sorry I couldn't make it. Next time, though, all right?

text.Zagreus: Next time, definitely, Alecto. We missed you for sure and wish you could have made it!

text.Alecto: Hohoho, I'm sure you did. But, you know, work comes first! So let's get busy.
Hey, redblood. I have done a lot of thinking, and I've come to the conclusion that I want you never to speak to me again. Ever. Got that?

text.Zagreus: ...Erm, I don't know how to respond to what you said without directly disobeying your request, Alecto. But for future reference, fine, I'll bite.

text.Alecto: You'll die! There's no use standing here flapping our gums when we could cut to killing one another right away. Come on!
Ahh, look at you, redblood. You're practically already dead! Now that's no fun at all.

text.Zagreus: Sorry to disappoint you, Alecto. I know you enjoy being responsible for a hundred percent of my bloodshed.

text.Alecto: Oh, that's all right, no hard feelings at all! You just be sure to get in better health before next I get to kill you, hm?
You know I smelled your blood from three chambers away? Hope you saved some of it for me.

text.Zagreus: I've saved some of my blood, yes! Though I was thinking I'd hang onto it for now, if you don't mind.

text.Alecto: Do I look like someone who doesn't mind, trash god? I'll take your blood, however much you've got.
What's the matter, redblood? You look a little paler than usual. Been bleeding much, having to get this far?

text.Zagreus: I ran into some setbacks, if you have to know. But don't worry, I'm sure I've plenty left to bleed.

text.Alecto: Oh whew, that's a relief all right! I was so worried that I wasn't going to be the one to kill you this time.
You're looking pretty beat already, there, redblood. So let's finish you off.
Next time, don't you go losing so much blood before you get here, trash! I like to take it out of you myself.
You're no god! You're nothing but a piece of trash. Born into all of this. And you don't even want it!

text.Zagreus: You seem to have me all figured out. And here I thought we were still getting to know each other.

text.Alecto: Tsch. Well. You want to know what I want? Here, I'll show you.
You know what I like about you? The way you bleed. Mmm.

text.Zagreus: That... is not the type of flattery I'm used to. You're making me a bit uncomfortable, I'll have you know.

text.Alecto: Never met a god that bleeds like you. Red. Like a worthless mortal. Come on! Let's bleed you dry.
Let's get to work, redblood, what do you say? Me, I say you've kept this girl waiting long enough.

text.Zagreus: Well, I say I don't appreciate you calling me redblood. You're making me rather self-conscious about it, you know.

text.Alecto: Oh, hoho, you're funny. But you'll break. They always do.
I have got to admit, you are really frustrating, you know, redblood? What is it going to take to make you scream, hm?

text.Zagreus: What, you mean to say Meg never told you? And here I thought you two were close.

text.Alecto: Ehh, we'll find out. I've got plenty of ideas left I've been meaning to try.
You know something, redblood? In retrospect, I should have known this wasn't going to be a quick job.

text.Zagreus: They say both gods and mortals are notoriously poor at estimating how long it takes to get anything done.

text.Alecto: Normally when I'm on the job, they grovel, then they scream. They shut up eventually, but not you. At least, not yet.
Huh! You really must like pain an awful lot, redblood. Or maybe it's just me.

text.Zagreus: You see, Alecto? Turns out we do have a common interest after all.

text.Alecto: Did you just? Don't you ever compare yourself to me again, you trash. You want more pain, I'm happy to oblige.
I've got a lot to be thankful for, you know, redblood? Your daddy could have shut you in the lowest pits, and then we never would have met!

text.Zagreus: Perish the thought, Alecto. What would you have done with yourself if not for all our fated encounters?

text.Alecto: I don't know! I mean, before we met, I flayed all sorts of other trash down here! But lately I've been keeping them waiting, because of you.
Good job, redblood! You made it all this way! But, I have got to send you back to daddy, now. Nothing personal!

text.Zagreus: Wish you could join me, Alecto. Want me to put in a good word with Father next time, so you can come visit us at the House yourself?

text.Alecto: Oh, you know, I'd rather have my eyes put out, but thanks for offering! Now, time to head on home.
You know, redblood, my appointments usually don't come to me, much less again and again! Think I'm here to show you a good time, huh?!

text.Zagreus: Alecto, I just like to see you menacingly smile. And, hey, having to deal with you now and again beats having to fight Meg all the time.

text.Alecto: Whaa?! You think dealing with me beats dealing with that weakling? Graaaah!
How many times is it going to take, redblood? How many?! Tell me! How can you stand running into me like this, over and over?

text.Zagreus: Well, habits can be hard to break. As for how many times, I've really no idea. Though I guess there's one way to find out.

text.Alecto: I'll give you one thing... I like it when my prey bites back. Come on, let's see some blood again.
Tisiphone's started to say the strangest things, lately, redblood. You wouldn't happen to know anything about that, would you?

text.Zagreus: Oh, don't fret. I was just trying to help her expand her somewhat limited vocabulary.

text.Alecto: Stay out of her head!! You really think she's got something to learn from you? Learn to shut up from her!
Eugh, still can't believe Megaera got mixed up with you, redblood. For all her weakness, I always thought at least she took her job here seriously. Eh, live and learn!

text.Zagreus: Not interested in your nasty remarks about her, Alecto. Though if you keep them up, I'm warning you, I might get mad.

text.Alecto: Ohh, you might get mad? Defend Megaera's honor, since she's far too weak to do it her damn self? You think she's so pure! Hahaha! You're disgusting! Both of you.
Oh hey, redblood! You're back for more. I like that stubborn stupidness about you, honestly. If only I could keep you alive even longer this time.

text.Zagreus: What, you planning to kill me with insults this time?

text.Alecto: Haven't decided how just yet. This girl likes a little spontaneity.
Huh! Normally my marks don't make a habit of seeking me out again after I'm through with them.

text.Zagreus: I can imagine that, it's just, I've really come to appreciate these little back-and-forth exchanges that we have.

text.Alecto: Ugh, I do so hate to let you down like this, redblood. But you're just not my type. Maybe I'll finally get it through your head this time.
Know something, redblood? Try as I might, I still have not forgiven you for beating me last time. Call it a crippling character flaw, I don't know...

text.Zagreus: Forgiveness can take time. Though self-reflection is a healthy step. We're making progress!

text.Alecto: You think we're making progress? Here? Ah, hah, ha-hah, ha-hah, ha-hah, why you piece of trash! I'll show you progress.
Redblood, I'm getting awful sick of seeing your smug face, time, after time, after time.

text.Zagreus: Have you given any thought to just... leaving me alone, and going back to wherever it is you came from?

text.Alecto: You see? That is exactly what I mean. To think that Megaera had to put up with you for, I don't know how long.
Damn you for this, redblood. You're making me look bad, you know? Making me feel bad.

text.Zagreus: Alecto, I didn't ask you to repeatedly attempt to kill me. How did you expect me to respond?

text.Alecto: Ah-hahah-hahaha, hahah, you do know what happens when you make me feel bad, don't you...?
Huh, it's the god of trash, come once again to filthy up this place! You're getting real predictable, you know.

text.Zagreus: Considering I beat you last we met, I'd be much more concerned with your predictability than mine.

text.Alecto: Don't want to hear it from you, trash! Just want to see you bleed. Now you come here!
Ohh, there he is, sisters. It's time to get to work.
You ready, Megaera? Tisiphone? Let's go.
Let's tear him into shreds, sisters, come on!
Hey, check it out, sisters, he's back. You ready?
He's come crawling back again, sisters. Let's get him, then.
All right, sisters! Don't screw this up for me!
I'm taking point against this trash, sisters. You back me up.
All three of us against this trash, sisters? All right!
The three Furies up against the trash god! What a fight!
Oh, hohohohoho, look at him, sisters! Don't you just want to whip him all to shreds?!
Much as I love chatting with you, Meg, Tisiphone... our prey is here.
You ready, Sis? This redblood's nothing to the both of us.
Check it out, Sis! The god of trash is here. Let's get to work.
Well, Sis, what do you say we get started on him?
There he is, Sis! I'm ready if you're ready.
All right, Sister! Let's rip him all to shreds!
You ready for him, Sister? I most definitely am!
You're never getting through the both of us without losing a lot of blood, trash god.
My sis and I, we're going to tear you limb from limb, redblood!
Think you can scoot right past the both of us, trash god?!
All right, Sis! You just back me up against this trash!
I'll just keep killing you, redblood. Not that I mind!
What are we going to do with you this time, now, hm?
I'm impressed, redblood. You really never learn.
Turns out, killing the god of trash never gets old.
How would you like to die this time, redblood? Here, let me guess.
You just don't get it, do you? Though I bet I can make you learn.
I'm getting real sick of you, trash god. Come on!
Bad news for you, redblood. I like dying.
Come on, redblood, let's see you kill me again!
You're stuck with me forever, trash. Remember that.
I'm really starting to hate you. You know that, redblood?
Why if it isn't the god of trash himself. I'm so honored.
Good news for you, I'm in a real bad mood right now.
Been looking forward to this chance to get you back, redblood.
Heard you were in the area, and thought I'd take another stab at killing you.
Redblood, I really don't appreciate what happened here last time.
You might get through me, trash god, but I'm going to spill your blood before you do!
Long as I slow you down, redblood, I've done my job.
You think just 'cause you got through Megaera, you'll get through me?
Your daddy never should have given Megaera this job.
Megaera couldn't make it, redblood, so it's me and you.
Hah! It's Megaera's hot mess. Let's clean you up.
You got Tisiphone, so what. Now I'll get you.
You mess with Tis, redblood, you mess with me, get it?
Tisiphone's been having problems with you, huh. Let's see if I can help.
Nobody messes with Tisiphone but me, redblood.
I'm going to enjoy this, redblood.
Just when I was beginning to feel bored.
I'm going to tear you limb from limb, redblood.
The Fates must want to spill your blood as much as I do.
Time to die, again, redblood. Let's get to killing you.
This job never gets old, redblood, I can assure you that.
Well if it isn't the god of trash himself. Come die.
Good, I was getting real tired waiting around to kill you.
Aww, you came back all this way! I'm flattered, redblood.
Got some kind of deathwish, don't you. Fine.
Oh, thank the Fates I get to deal with you this time.
Let's see what you can do, redblood. Come on!
Well! Look who's back. The god of trash, himself.
Get ready for a bunch of pain and suffering, trash god.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, hold it right there, redblood.
Been waiting here to beat you to a bloody pulp, redblood!
Don't even open that damn mouth of yours, redblood. Except to scream.
You must like pain, or something, don't you, there, redblood?
Somebody's dying soon, redblood! Ohh, I can't wait.
Come give me everything you've got, trash god!
Let's see what you're made of, trash god! Come on!
Looks like my prayers to the god of trash have finally been answered, huh?!
What's the matter, there, redblood? Gone awful quiet! Did I hurt your feelings, huh?
Ohh, I'm going to bleed you till you're dry.
You want to mess with me again, redblood?! Well then, come on!
How is it possible I am so sick of you, but never sick of killing you, redblood?
Step on it, redblood! I've got lots of other trash to whip, you know!
You want through that door back there, it's going to cost you blood!
Megaera's not just weak, she's got bad taste to match.
Oh good, I was just itching for a live one, here, trash god.
Live or die, your daddy doesn't care, redblood!
Good thing your daddy hates you, or I wouldn't have the pleasure here, redblood!
I'm real sick of waiting here, so how about we make this real quick, redblood!
Nothing like nice, fresh blood to warm things up in here, I always say!
When I heard you were coming through, redblood, I told my sisters I would see you here.
Ohh, we are going to enjoy this, here, redblood!
Heard you were in the area and volunteered for this, trash god.
Time to spill it for me once again, redblood.
I'll send you screaming home to daddy, now come on!!

CHOICE.Skelly: Hey who turned out the lights?!

text.Alecto: You mess with Tis, redblood, you mess with me, get it?

text.Megaera: Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.

text.Zagreus: Hey, you must be one of Meg's sisters! Nice to finally meet you. My name's Zagreus. Not Murderer. Definitely not.
Erm... look, I've done some things that maybe aren't great, but I am very, very sure I haven't murdered anyone.
Well then, let's get to work!
I'm here on official business this time, Tisiphone, so, uh... stand aside! Although, I guess the whole point of this job is that you're meant to try and stop me anyway, isn't that right?
Oh, sorry that you couldn't make the feast back at the House, Tisiphone. Though, I don't really think it was your kind of scene. Although, Ares was there, he's probably done some murders, right?
Erm... how about, no? No murder. No murder!
I was really hoping we could change the subject. Please?
Let me guess. Murder? Murderer, perhaps? One of those two.
Please, I'm not a murderer, you don't have to do this.
We're not getting through to one another, are we. I'm sorry that it has to be this way.
I don't understand. But I'm not who you think I am. My father sent you to stop me, that's all.
Murderzer?!
No, murder. Zagreus. My name is Zagreus! Can you say that, Tisiphone? No murder. Zagreus!
You really did say murderzer, didn't you! That's progress! Zagreus! I'm Zagreus, I'm not a murderer! Can you say Zagreus?
Almost!
Do you remember me, Tisiphone? My name is Zagreus. Prince of the Underworld? Pretty close with Megaera, I guess. Try saying Zagreus again for me?
That's it!

text.Megaera: You did it, Zag.

text.Zagreus: Oh, you're so close, Tisiphone! Remember, Zagreus? That's me. I'm not your enemy, you know, don't you know that? I'm only Zagreus!
That's not happy...
No. Wait. Just the first part. No murderer. Just Zagreus. Or... let's see, how about... happy? Can you say happy?
Great.
Erm, well... let's try again with happy, how about that? Happy? No murder, only happy. Come on, now!
Eugh, I guess the happy thing just isn't doing it for you. Though, maybe trying to kill me like this is as close as you can get. You learned my name at least, that's something, right?
Friends!

...Then we're back to square one. Look, I was just trying to get through to you with all the Zagreus and happy stuff. But, if you can understand any of this, Tisiphone, I think you're all right, just the way you are. Friends?
Ah, didn't think so.
Hey, uhh, any second thoughts, by any chance, about the whole happy thing? Just making sure.

CHOICE.Zagreus: You and me, Severed Hydra Head!

CHOICE.Theseus: I shall scour you from this place.
Lord Zeus, what have I done?!
Lord Poseidon, was I not your favored?
Lord Poseidon, is this all because...?!
Dionysus, is this all because of Ariadne?!
But Goddess Demeter, what did I do?!
Why is Death on his side?!
You took me once already, Thanatos!
Get out of here, you skeleton!!
My noble warriors, you would side with him?
What is the meaning of this?
Out of the way, my friend!
He'd make a mockery of us!
Out of the way, my friend!
He'd make a mockery of us!
Such a spectacle is it not?
Nothing like battling before an audience!
They know our victory is certain here!
That cheering's not for you, monster!
We shall prevail for you in the stands!
Are you enjoying yourselves in the stands?!
Such fervor coming from this crowd!
To all who came to see us fight, thank you!
We owe everything to our audience!
Keep cheering, as we battle to the last!
The roaring of the crowd fills me with strength!
Just listen to that, friend Asterius!
You shall have what you came to see!
To all our fans, we dedicate this fight to you!
That was for last time, fiend!
Thus I reassert my status as the Champion!
Your foolish attempts shall get you nowhere!
I shall send you to hell however many times it takes!
You are forever doomed to fail.
We make a formidable duo, don't we, Asterius?
You were a fool to stand against our might.
Back to the hell that spawned you.
I send you to the depths of hell.
Begone from here and don't return, you fiend.
You had no chance against the Champion.
When next we meet, it shall go even worse.
Elysium is for the great, not for the likes of you!
You should have stayed down in the depths of hell.
You failed, as was surely fated.
Asterius, my friend, you are avenged.
You destroy my chariot, I destroy you, end of tale.
Chariots can be repaired, rebuilt! Honor cannot.
That was for my beautiful chariot, foul daemon.
Your foul deeds shall go unsung, mark you my words.
There. I shall await when next you clamber to these heights.
If only you could hear the roaring crowd.

CHOICE.Zagreus: That ought to shut him up.
They say to never meet your heroes.
That ought to make Theseus shut it for a bit.

CHOICE.Theseus: It shall take more than that!
We can take more than that!

text.Theseus: Blast!
Blast you.
Curse you!
Nrghh.
You...!
Gah, you.
Rngh, you fiend!
Khh, you monster!
Dah!
Augh!
Guh, I shall not lose to you again!

CHOICE.Theseus: Khh, I am not finished yet!

text.Theseus: Ah, hahaha, it's finally time, Asterius. He's here! Aren't you, now, you vile, insignificant hellspawn? Prepare now to be overrun!!

text.Zagreus: Oh, this is unfair... that's a bronze-plated Macedonian Tau-Lambda! What's an obnoxious bellyacher like you doing with the most durable chariot created, to date?

text.Theseus: Pah! You don't deserve to know. Suffice it that Asterius and I were handsomely rewarded once again. And we shall not hesitate to exploit our hard-fought spoils against you!

He would pit you against me, Asterius. I can see it in his mis-matched eyes! I cannot shake the terrible vision that, someday or night, it shall be me, standing alone here, whilst you...? Whilst you take sides against me! With that fiend!

text.Zagreus: Asterius, about that, please consider it a standing offer, if you like. I'd rather have you as a friend than as a foe. Not sure that I can say the same for Theseus, of course.

text.Theseus: You poisonous worm! I knew you had a more sinister trick at play, because your fighting style certainly is of no concern just on its own! Are there truly no depths to which you would not stoop?!
...I'm telling you, you're wrong, Asterius! He is no royalty, most certainly not any I would recognize! He's but a nameless, long-forgotten minor god born of the depths, and bound to stay in them!

text.Asterius: I, too, once was berated by such words, king. We've faced this enemy how many times? And in my estimation, he's fought bravely, here.

text.Theseus: Bravely?! Hiding behind those pillars is what you call bravely, Asterius? We shall have to discuss this strange lapse of judgment after we achieve our victory!
RequiredMaxActiveMetaUpgradeLevel  { Name  BossDifficultyShrineUpgrade, Count  2

text.Asterius: I, too, once was berated by such words, king. We've faced this enemy how many times? And in my estimation, he's fought bravely, here.

text.Theseus: Bravely?! Hiding behind those pillars is what you call bravely, Asterius? We shall have to discuss this strange lapse of judgment after we achieve our victory!
I hope you're perfectly pleased with yourself, hellspawn. Because Asterius has been quite cross with me! Such as he is. He says I have misjudged the likes of you! Outrageousness.

text.Asterius: You don't hear me, king. We still have a lot to learn about this foe. Each time, he's differently equipped. Weapons, god-given abilities, and such. Despite our efforts... it's been difficult to read his strategies.

text.Theseus: And now, you're saying I can't fight, Asterius? Even though I had no difficulty besting you within that maze of yours?! Come on, let's do this fight!
RequiredMaxActiveMetaUpgradeLevel  { Name  BossDifficultyShrineUpgrade, Count  2

text.Asterius: You don't hear me, king. We still have a lot to learn about this foe. Each time, he's differently equipped. Weapons, god-given abilities, and such. Despite our efforts... it's been difficult to read his strategies.

text.Theseus: And now, you're saying I can't fight, Asterius? Even though I had no difficulty besting you within that maze of yours?! Come on, let's do this fight!
Well, worm! Come fight us, I suppose. And take fullest advantage of the havoc that you sowed! We are no team! We're merely two combatants, simultaneously booked to be here, now.

text.Asterius: King, I think you are over-reacting, here. Try to be reasonable. And be more considerate about my point of view. Don't think I am asking for too much.

text.Theseus: You're asking the impossible of me! But, let us fight. And let us lose, I'm sure, because if we are not a team, what are we, then, Asterius...?
RequiredMaxActiveMetaUpgradeLevel  { Name  BossDifficultyShrineUpgrade, Count  2

text.Asterius: King, I think you are over-reacting, here. Try to be reasonable. And be more considerate about my point of view. Don't think I am asking for too much.

text.Theseus: You're asking the impossible of me! But, let us fight. And let us lose, I'm sure, because if we are not a team, what are we, then, Asterius...?

text.Asterius: You'll have to excuse the Champion, there, short one. He hasn't been himself. Though he'll still fight you to the death, I'm sure.

text.Zagreus: That's good, because you had me worried for a moment, there. Hey maybe I can knock some sense back into him, what do you think?

text.Asterius: I'm not so sure. I've tried. But I know better than to underestimate you. Fight us, then.
You'll have to excuse the Champion, there, short one. He hasn't been himself. Though he'll still fight you to the death, I'm sure.

text.Zagreus: That's good, because you had me worried for a moment, there. Hey maybe I can knock some sense back into him, what do you think?

text.Asterius: I'm not so sure. I've tried. But I know better than to underestimate you. Fight us, then.

text.Zagreus: Well, glad that's settled, then!

text.Theseus: Please fight with me, again, Asterius. I mean, just like before! You must forgive me my indecencies of late. This blasted fiend! His lies and treachery get right under my skin. Or the phantasmagorical equivalent!

text.Asterius: Swear something to me, king. That you'll discard your fears about our bond. The short one here is never going to break it. He doesn't even understand it. The only one who can break it is you, yourself.

text.Theseus: I... oh, my dear friend, Asterius. I see, of course, you're right, you're right. You're right! And I solemnly do swear to you, indeed, that I shall never again doubt our brotherhood! Nor shall I ever listen to this fiend! Together, now and always!!

text.Zagreus: Well, glad that's settled, then!

text.Theseus: Please fight with me, again, Asterius. I mean, just like before! You must forgive me my indecencies of late. This blasted fiend... his lies and treachery get right under my skin. Or the phantasmagorical equivalent!

text.Asterius: Swear something to me, king. That you'll discard your fears about our bond. The short one here is never going to break it. He doesn't even understand it. The only one who can break it is you, yourself.

text.Theseus: I... oh, my dear friend, Asterius. I see, of course, you're right, you're right. You're right! And I solemnly do swear to you, indeed, that I shall never again doubt our brotherhood! Nor shall I ever listen to this fiend! Together, now and always!!
Come forth, blackguard, and you shall soon be crushed under the massive wheels of the finest chariot the world has ever known!

text.Zagreus: You only have that chariot because of me, you know. It's all because of a condition of the Pact of Punishment! Nothing you did or earned. So drop the act!

text.Theseus: Hahahahah, what?! You claim to be my benefactor, when in truth, you are my figuratively mortal enemy?! I'll do the chariot-equivalent of trample you!
Come, blackguard! And be crushed beneath the raging wheelwork of the Macedonian Tau-Lambda, once again!

text.Zagreus: Theseus, you do know you look even more ridiculous than normal wearing that mask? I get the chariot and the unsporting weaponry, but why wear that thing?

text.Theseus: Bah! This blessed mask was crafted by great Daedalus, himself! A work of art, and my entitled claim as champion! What has he ever done for you?!
Well now, Asterius, he's returned! And this time, we shall have to vanquish him without the aid of our divine armor! A worthy challenge, no?

text.Asterius: Be cautious not to underestimate him, king. He has proved troublesome before.

text.Theseus: Nonsense, my friend! For how can one underestimate that which deserves no esteem whatsoever?! Together, now, attack!
Well, you senseless monster, I suspect you're not so pleased with yourself, now! Behold!! For my glorious chariot has been restored!

text.Zagreus: Oh, indeed, nice work! Though must have cost a fortune in gemstones and diamonds, restoring an old Macedonian. I thought it was totaled after last time.

text.Theseus: The only thing which shall be totaled here, you heartless property-destroying scourge, is you yourself! Asterius!! Together, let us break him!
My chariot and I stand ready for you, daemon! And I assume Asterius, as well! I feel it in my phantom heart, we shall not fall to you this time!

text.Zagreus: You know, my opinion of the Macedonian Tau-Lambda has fallen precipitously of late. Though perhaps it's not the chariot but the driver.

text.Theseus: Silence!! Show me a finer chariot-driver anywhere within Elysium, why, you cannot! I'll run you down for such an insult to my pride!
Ready yourself and your fine armor, friend Asterius! I shall drive circles around him, whilst you dispatch him with your mighty axe!

text.Zagreus: Your strategy might work a little better if you didn't shout it loud enough for me to hear. Though I have to say I'm impressed you can drive, fight, and shout all at the same time.

text.Theseus: And I, fiend, am impressed that you yet live and breathe! A temporary state Asterius and I shall soon alleviate! To war!!

text.Asterius: He's here, king. Activating armor. It's fortunate repairs on your chariot were completed in time.

text.Theseus: Nonsense, my friend! We could defeat this vile hellspawn with or without the additional divine protection we've been granted here! Get him!
Avert your eyes, fiend, lest the shining bronzework of the Macedonian should strike you blind! We are prepared to face your devilry!

text.Zagreus: Prepared for me, really? I've dismantled your ridiculous chariot before. Even Poseidon knows you're just a blowhard with a fancy ride.

text.Theseus: How dare you to invoke my Lord Poseidon's name?! And, to besmirch our complicated past! No god shall ever favor you as he has favored both Asterius and me!
Hold, fiend! You'll walk not one more step toward the light of day, so long as I am here.

text.Asterius: Two against one. Seems hardly fair.... Ah, well! <Snort> Let's kill him and be done, king.

text.Zagreus: Theseus?! The Bull of Minos?! You two are legends! I'd be honored if we had a sporting contest here!

text.Theseus: Ahh, a naked attempt to sway me from my convictions. Defend yourself, you blackguard! And may the gods show you some mercy, for I shall not!

text.Asterius: I warned you, short one. Now you face a foe more terrible even than I. The only other foe whom I have ever faced, who bested me.

text.Theseus: Hold, fiend! You'll walk not one more step toward the light of day, so long as I am here.

text.Zagreus: Theseus?! No way! You two are legends! I'd be honored if we had a sporting contest here!

text.Theseus: Ahh, a naked attempt to sway me from my convictions. Defend yourself, you blackguard! And may the gods show you some mercy, for I shall not!

text.Asterius: Beware, short one. Now you face a foe more terrible even than I. The only foe whom I have ever faced, who bested me.

text.Theseus: Hold, fiend! You'll walk not one more step toward the light of day, so long as I am here.

text.Zagreus: Theseus?! No way! You two are legends! I'd be honored if we had a sporting contest here!

text.Theseus: Ahh, a naked attempt to sway me from my convictions. Defend yourself, you blackguard! And may the gods show you some mercy, for I shall not!
So! The fiend returns to challenge us again, Asterius! Despite having experienced such a thorough thrashing by us last time!

text.Zagreus: You know full well that wasn't a fair fight. Face me yourself and we'll see how you fare.

text.Theseus: Silence, you monster! I'll hear no more such wicked lies, half-truths, or quarter-truths! You, however, soon shall hear my blessed spear! Specifically, the sound it makes whilst sliding into your exposed midsection! Defend yourself!
So! The fiend returns to challenge us again, Asterius! Or, rather, to besmirch the honor of this competition!

text.Zagreus: Besmirch what honor? You're just complaining that you lost. Even though I was outnumbered!

text.Theseus: Silence, you monster!! I'll hear no more such wicked lies, half-truths, or quarter-truths! You, however, soon shall hear my blessed spear! Specifically, the sound it makes whilst sliding into your exposed midsection! Defend yourself!
What are those bestial gloves of yours, blackguard? Beginning to show more of your true and savage nature, here perhaps?

text.Asterius: No. He bears the Twin Fists in the aspect of a king called Gilgamesh. That king, he, too, wrestled a beastlike man, who then became a friend. Maybe that's why I knew this fight would come.

text.Theseus: What are you telling me, Asterius? Now is certainly not a good time for waxing philosophical, I think! And, surely this King Gilgamesh of whom you speak is much more competent a fighter than this filth!
What are those bestial gloves of yours, blackguard? Beginning to show more of your true and savage nature, here perhaps?

text.Asterius: No. He bears the Twin Fists in the aspect of a king called Gilgamesh. That king, he, too, wrestled a beastlike man, who then became a friend. Maybe that's why I knew this fight would come.

text.Theseus: What are you telling me, Asterius? Now is certainly not a good time for waxing philosophical, I think! And, surely this King Gilgamesh of whom you speak is much more competent a fighter than this filth!
So, hellspawn! You seek to break through to the surface of the world. But you shall not achieve your goal, whilst I yet live and breathe! Or the equivalent of it, here in the splendors of Elysium!

text.Zagreus: Then you leave me with little choice but to make you shut up, already. And your bull-headed manservant there.

text.Theseus: That Minotaur whom you address is my dear friend, you preconceiving stain upon the earth! Asterius and I are brothers here in death as we were enemies in life. Not that you could ever understand fraternal bonds as strong as ours!
Ah-hah, the fiend comes crawling back once more, drawn as he is much like the unassuming moth unto the flame of righteousness!

text.Zagreus: Oh no! Not the flame of righteousness! Are you finished? Let's get this started, I've come a long way.

text.Theseus: Hear that, Asterius? Our fiendish visitor is begging us for mercy. Begging us, no doubt, to drop our guard!! Together now, my friend, let's vanquish him, and may the glory of Olympus guide us!!
And where do you think you're going, fiend?! Thought you might scoot right past Asterius and myself without a fight?

text.Zagreus: No, on quite the contrary I've been under no impression that avoiding conflict is an option here. So say your piece, and let's get on with it.

text.Theseus: You, hellspawn, shall not traverse that gate behind me whilst my compatriot and I equivalently live and breathe! Prepare for death!
Ah, hahaha, you are just in time, Fiend from Lowest Depths! Asterius and I have trained extensively since our last skirmish here!

text.Zagreus: So all you do here in Elysium is train for martial competition? You're constantly awaiting your next fight to the death?

text.Theseus: And who are you to judge, you misbegotten, shameful, unfilial maggot? It is an honor to have the opportunity to spend my afterlife perpetually standing in your ruinous path!
See here, Asterius! The god-hated fiend is back once more to be destroyed by our joint, righteous fury!

text.Zagreus: God-hated? You'll have to be more specific. I have the gods on my side. Though I suppose you do, too. Why can't they make up their minds?

text.Theseus: They have made up their minds! They stand united against darkness, as do I! With the exception of Asterius, here, who serves the light! Let's serve it now, my friend! To battle!
Upon my word, the fiend again darkens these halls! Alas, Asterius, it seems I was mistaken and he hasn't learned his lesson after all!

text.Zagreus: And what's this lesson that I ought have learned? Is it to always slay you first since you're so damn insufferable all the time?

text.Theseus: Your lesson, monster, is to never, ever take up arms against those favored by the gods themselves! You shall never see the light of day as I once did! Uh, no offense, Asterius.
Well, hellspawn, you stained my honor last we battled here. But as you plainly see, I have returned! As has Asterius! And we've no shortage of honor left to spare!

text.Zagreus: Shouldn't I  be the Champion of Elysium, now that I've beaten you? Isn't there someone else around to challenge me, say, Heracles? Someone less chatty?

text.Theseus: Ah, hahaha, very clever, fiend. Invoking Heracles' name, in an attempt to drive me to a jealous rage. It shall not work! But you shall dearly pay nevertheless!
The monster has returned, in a vainglorious attempt to wrest the title Champion from me!

text.Zagreus: I couldn't care less about your title. Though, shouldn't you share it with the Minotaur? He's more than half the reason you've been any trouble.

text.Theseus: You'll not drive a wedge between us, fiend. Asterius and I share a fraternal bond forged from the strongest bronze! Nay, adamant! But you have caused us both offense, so, die!
I have recovered, as you can plainly see, monster! As has Asterius! And this time we are filled with renewed vigor, to destroy you utterly!

text.Zagreus: So we're locked in an endless cycle of violence, basically. I guess that's one way for you to pass the time here in this stodgy place.

text.Theseus: You take that back about Elysium! Or, better: I shall make you eat those careless, inappropriate remarks! Come, Asterius, to war!

text.Asterius: We're well-equipped to deal with you, short one. Though I know better than to disregard your might.

text.Theseus: Speak for yourself, Asterius! I, for one, know only pure contempt for this foul daemon and his underhanded fighting style! A style we shall easily dismantle, now!

text.Asterius: We're well-equipped to deal with you, short one. Though I know better than to disregard your might.

text.Theseus: Speak for yourself, Asterius! I, for one, know only pure contempt for this foul daemon and his underhanded fighting style! A style we shall easily dismantle, now!
What hope have you, monster, versus the blessed bonds of brotherhood?

text.Asterius: Best not belittle him, king. He is more powerful than he appears. We must remain alert, this time.

text.Theseus: Oh, I am perfectly alert right now, Asterius! And were I still alive, I would be positively salivating at the thought of running through this pustule with my spear, or whichever means I had available! Now, let's go!
What hope have you, monster, versus the blessed bonds of brotherhood?

text.Asterius: Best not belittle him, king. He is more powerful than he appears. We must remain alert, this time.

text.Theseus: Oh, I am perfectly alert right now, Asterius! And were I still alive, I would be positively salivating at the thought of running through this pustule with my spear, or whichever means I had available! Now, let's go!

text.Zagreus: Theseus, before you flap your ghostly gums at me again, I'd like to hear from good Asterius this time! He almost never gets a word in, thanks to you.

text.Asterius: The king speaks for the both of us, short one. Though if you wish to hear me say something to you, I will oblige.

text.Theseus: And I, too, shall oblige! That is, oblige my trusty spear, which yearns to penetrate your soft and vulnerable, altogether pallid flesh! Now, die!
