CHOICE.Artemis: I never felt like I could be myself with everybody on this mountaintop, you know? So much posturing, and bickering, and... I just head out to the woods most of the time. Maybe you understand me better than the rest, I've no idea still. But I appreciate you've made attempts to try.
I have them in my sights!
They are as good as dead!
What is the matter with you.
Is this some sort of joke?
Sure, I don't see why not!
Oh let me get right on it, Zagreus!
Pray I don't accidentally miss my mark!
You may be good at running, Zagreus, but you're bad at hiding.
You make me mad, I'll hunt you like a stag. You heard of those?
Don't anger me next time, won't shoot you dead, is it a deal?
Glad you're still in one piece.

text.Aphrodite: Dearest, your lord uncle wishes to address you from our mountaintop, although I had assured him that the two of us, we had everything well under control!

text.Zeus: Come now, Zagreus, the only thing Lady Aphrodite has under control is her long list of salivating suitors, am I right? Aphrodite, how about you bestow your blessing and be off, and I'll take it from here.

text.Aphrodite: The thing to know about this family, dearest, is that, each of us, we have our little quirks. Although, we always stick together and our love for one another perseveres!

text.Poseidon: Oh, hoh! What do we have here, little Hades? Seems to me that you have company! Well, I'll just leave the two of you alone. My lips are sealed tighter than a warship hull!

text.Aphrodite: Oh, feel free to stay, Poseidon! I was just explaining what an idiot you are, though you're able to articulate this best! Anyway, dearest, what was I on about...?
You must forgive us, little godling, meaning our extended family here upon Olympus! Some of us are terribly stuck up, and must be making matters much more complicated than they have to be.

text.Athena: I wonder, dearest Aphrodite, whether you'd be willing to repeat such things directly to my countenance?

text.Aphrodite: Oh, you must know full well that I would do much more than that directly to your countenance, Athena dear! Quite frankly, you could use a lot of work!
Dearest, you must know, Goddess Athena and myself, we don't always share a common view, perhaps because she overthinks things constantly, while my heart leads me on!

text.Athena: I'm glad we understand each other, then. It would be most embarrassing to be caught bickering amongst ourselves in front of Zagreus.

text.Aphrodite: I think for many of us, dearest, it can come as a surprise to learn that love and war often go hand in hand. Opposite forces, yet this connects them, doesn't it. The fiercest passions of gods and mortals! Isn't that right, Lord Ares?

text.Ares: Mortals are so bent on clinging to their lives, that many among them would gladly kill for it. The surge of emotion which they feel... one passion is no different from another, Lady Aphrodite, dear.

text.Aphrodite: Oh dearest! I have brought you keen-eyed Artemis, who, in her focus on the hunt, has not developed social graces suitable enough to come to you herself!

text.Artemis: Social graces, she says! Going about like that! I'm sure you know that I can find you when it's necessary, Zagreus. Though, how to get away from Aphrodite, I have no idea.

text.Aphrodite: My powers, dearest, oft go hand-in-hand with those of Dionysus, with his power to persuade the mind to find such beauty where it isn't, really!

text.Dionysus: Ah, haha, no need to flatter me like that, there, Lady Aphrodite! Beauty's almost entirely within the mind, I'm sure! And in the muscles and the jawline and the winning smile and, well, who am I to tell you, yeah?

text.Aphrodite: The venerable goddess of the seasons, Demeter, chooses to look as stately as can be, can you believe it, dearest? Although, why one would mark so many fine lines upon their face, I wouldn't know.

text.Demeter: Oh, Aphrodite, dear... you wouldn't know a thing of substance if it offered you a cloak. Your chosen countenance makes plain the full extent of your intentions, and your interests alike.

text.Zagreus: OK, I think I'm ready. In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! And I hope it finds you well, Lady Aphrodite!

text.Aphrodite: Why, this is something, dearest! Such an enigmatic message you have sent. How positively captivating; I must know what it says. It bears the marks of others on Olympus, so... perhaps we ought to share some common knowledge on the subject, hm?

Oh, dearest, you've no idea what a delightful time I had while visiting you recently! So many new sights and sounds and smells, why, it was wonderful! And you are burdened with a big responsibility, aren't you? Mind if I lend my graces to you still from time to time...?
Lord Zeus has made acquaintances with you? Oh I sometimes forget that he's your uncle! His favor's well worth having, I assure you.
That oaf Poseidon spoke to you already, didn't he? All bluster, muscles, and bravado, that one. I'm glad you're not the type.
You've met Athena, dearest, so you know not all the ladies on Olympus are alike. And I, for one, am grateful to our forebears for that!
I sense the mark of my Lord Ares on you, love. He's poorly understood among the gods, yet surely you can see fair qualities in him, and me?
The sullen Artemis reached out to you, did she? Oh, that's adorable, dearest! Just don't make any sudden movements with her, hm?
You are so fortunate to have received the Boon of Dionysus prior to my own! He, the most noble and important of us all, the god of wine, himself!
Why, did sorrowful old Demeter get all the way to you before I did? She stubbornly refuses me when I offer to help! Unlike you, little godling!
How I love to have these unexpected little run-ins with you, love! You are just so spontaneous, and I've a liking for that sort of thing!
Keep following that heart of yours, dearest! It's good enough a guide, believe you me. Mine tells me you are going to succeed!
You do know that I'm married, don't you, love...? I'd forgive you if you didn't, for my husband, he's always... busy with his work. I'm grateful that you're there for me to talk to.

You're going to love it on Olympus, little godling. The air is beautiful and brisk, the gardens lush, the feasting plentiful...! Why, it must be the opposite of everything to which you are accustomed!
What shall we do here once you finally arrive? Perhaps we could go out and meet some mortals! I know all too many maidens and/or noble gentlemen who'd absolutely love to get to know you.
A little bird once told me that the shade of the great hero called Achilles now resides within your father's residence, dearest? I always wished to meet with him someday...
You met Achilles after all, godling. He was quite instrumental in a war of my design. Still, he resisted my attempts to sway his actions. You tell him, simply, I admire him.

The great hero Achilles, he continues to ignore my polite outreach, doesn't he? Why, I've attempted to reach out at least several times! Your father's realm is really quite a lot. How terribly frustrating it must be!

You've had a brush with Megaera, the Fury, haven't you? Oh I know a thing or two about that one. Though, lately we Olympians no longer mingle with those living in the Underworld. You're the only exception!
A little birdy told me recently that you and Megaera the Fury, why, you've grown quite close! Now do be careful around her, and, try not to get attached, there, hm?
Why, you have my Eternal Rose, don't you? I am so very touched that you'd think first of me among my mighty kin. It pleases me to know I'm in your thoughts!
Oh what is going on down there, dearest? I thought for certain you would make it out, but seems that nasty place has kept you grounded, hasn't it. But don't despair, and you take heart, won't you?
Something has stirred within your heart, dearest! Oh, I can always tell! A certain kind of love, for family? Yes, that must be it, I think! What could have transpired with you, hm?

To think your father and that sweet Persephone, they were together down there, all along! I was so certain that your father's heart was cold. That's just the thing with love, dearest! That, sometimes, it surprises even me!
My dearest little godling, how fares everything with you of late? I love to have these little interactions with you, simple as they are, for they have brightened many of my evenings here.

Little godling, you must know the seven types of love by now, don't you? It's quite a complicated field, though several types intrigue me most of all. In fact, why, I have several types of love for you, right here!

Dearest, why... I sense your heart is very full, indeed! You positively emanate with love. You must have grown quite close to many dear to you. Perhaps so you may do the same with me...? I'm so delighted to have seen your spirit shine.

Oh, my, dearest! I have to say, your heart is positively bursting with such love for so many you have come to care about! Your dearest friends, your burning passions, family, everyone! Why, you're like a living testament to my entire body of work!

I cannot help but wonder, dearest, why Lord Hades would have kept your mere existence hidden from us all this time. Perhaps he knew that, once you met us, you would stop at nothing to come seek us out!
I sense you finally acted on your pent-up passion for the Fury Megaera, yes, little godling? These types of things, they don't escape my notice, and they're always so enjoyable to see!
How's fearsome Megaera the Fury treating you of late, hmm, dearest? I know her type so very well, indeed. She acts as though there's nothing that can get under her skin, isn't that right?
Mmm, so my heart tells me that you've developed quite the bond with moody Thanatos, haven't you, there? I always figured that his brooding quality was just an act!

Little godling, would that I knew every last detail of how you and Thanatos are getting on of late! The notorious incarnate of death, and the newly discovered son of Hades, fraternizing? It's positively scandalous I think!
Erm, dearest? If my perfectly developed senses are correct, then you appear to be quite smitten with a little gorgon that you've met down there...? Why that must be adorable, if rather strange!

Why, something's changed about the beating of your heart, dearest! Oh, it's the little gorgon, isn't it. You Underworld dwellers and your complicated feelings! I can never get enough. My blessings to the both of you, then, hm?
Oh, look at you, you poor, poor thing, you're hurt! Though, let me see if I can make it better.
Tsk, you're in no condition for an outing with me, dearest. Though, perhaps you might recover from your hardships with my aid?
Dearest, why, your heart rate's fluctuating wildly! Has it really been that bad up to this point? I'll try to help however much I can.
Oh, you're just in an awful situation, aren't you. Yet, I can tell your proud heart keeps on beating, for the moment anyway! Don't die just yet!
Ah, little godling, you're about to die! Why, none of us want that, because if so, you won't get to enjoy my blessings here!
I have been waiting for a special moment to confess my great appreciation for your deeds... this moment's special enough, isn't it?
My loveliest of blessings is reserved only for those who've earned my deepest adoration. So, congratulations, love! And here you go!
Sometimes, our hearts become so full that they could burst! If only you could see how much I care. I would do anything to aid you in your plight! My heartfelt blessings be with you, dearest.
Little godling, you must know that the heart has infinite capacity for empathy. And I so feel for you there, that I have mustered for you some of the most beautiful of blessings I can offer!

text.Zagreus: I must be a mess, let's see here. Hi there! In the name of Hades! Olympus, I accept this message.

text.Aphrodite: Why hello, hello, there, little godling. I have to say you're quite the specimen, and so, I've decided I shall aid you for the moment. You interested?
Did you miss me, little godling, hm? I thought I'd steal away a bit and that together we might make up for lost time.
Hello again, there, little godling, let's get to it, hm? I want what you want; there's no further need for words.
Oh, boo, looks like you've rather got yourself into a bind, there, haven't you. Though, not to worry, dearest. I can pull some strings.
There, there, dearest, you'll tell me all your troubles just as soon as you arrive, so let's just get you out of there for now.
What is it, love, are you still having problems with the dead? I swear, you'd think they had enough of me in life!
What did I miss since last time, anything of interest, hm? You'll have to fill me in once you break free, dearest.
Well, look at you, there, love! So well-prepared to take on any danger that may come! But, I must wonder, are you well-prepared for this?
Ready yourself, dearest, because you and I? We're going to have ourselves a little outing I expect that neither one of us shall soon forget.
Would you by any chance have room, there, in your heart for a most-gentle blessing from a goddess such as me?
Don't lose heart, now, little godling! I won't have you giving up before you get to see me in the flesh among the gardens of Olympus here...!
Dearest, I've known many gods and godlings through the ages. And, I have to say, you're quite intriguing, even for our kind.
Oh, dearest, I suspect we'll have ourselves a most exciting time together, you and I! Just do your best and it'll all be fine!
I am always here, or close enough, to help you through whatever troubles you may face, my little godling. So do not hesitate to call upon me, hm?
I'd ask you show me a good time, there, love, although I almost can't imagine a good time where you reside! So dreary, constantly!
I missed you terribly, my little godling! All that I ask is that you do not die on me again, why, I don't think that I can take it anymore!
How you must yearn to reach the surface, little godling! It likewise stirs in me a yearning to assist you, by all means at my disposal!
No need to worry any longer, dearest! I bring you strength and comfort, and I shall be watching every step of yours most carefully.
Ah, how I long to see you face-to-face! Until such time, however, this old means of keeping touch shall have to do. So you take care, now, hm?
You know I would do anything to have you here among us, don't you, love? Oh, I just hope my blessings are enough...!
Love tends to blossom in the strangest places at the strangest times, you know that, don't you, dearest? All one can do is entertain the chance.
Don't work yourself too hard down there, you promise, little godling? We need you in good shape and spirits on Olympus here.
What do you say we skip the chat and get right to it, hm?
Oh, would you look at whom I found, all by his lonely self.
Let's see what mischief we can make, between the two of us!
You want my blessings, dearest, here they are!
I hope I didn't keep you waiting very long, did I?
Even immortal hearts can break, my little godling.
What do you say we go and make new friends together, hm?
You seem like you could use a helping hand, there, love.
The bond of love is strong enough to suffer any hardship, dearest.
Times of adversity make love grow even stronger, little godling.
I hate to see you struggling, dearest! Please do be careful, hm?
Love conquers everything, you see that, don't you, dearest?
Think of all those you love, and may they spur your courage, little godling.
Your passion to achieve your goal is quite inspiring, I have to say!
It's such a pity I can barely see you in that awful darkness, little godling.
Love spurs the heart to greater acts of valor, doesn't it, dearest?
Take heart, now, little godling. And how about you take this from me, as well.
I'd love to help you however best I'm able, my little godling.
I have the loveliest selection of my blessings for you this time, dearest!
I think I'll give you something very special this time, little godling.
Is not the purest act of love to aid somebody in their time of need?
I'm feeling wonderful of late, dearest, so here, enjoy the benefits!
Looks like we meet again, dearest, here among the foul detritus of the boatman's wares! You truly take me to the best of places!
At first I didn't know how to get through to that odd river-boatman, Charon. Turns out he lusts for coin, and now I understand him well!
You spent your hard-earned wealth on my account, dearest? Why if that isn't just the sweetest thing!
One cannot put a price on love, but on my blessings, from the boatman, for my dearest? I'd say we're settled up.
And here I was beginning to think that we had something special going, no...? Look here, little godling, let me save you lots of future suffering: I happen to be the jealous type.
You'd best not take for granted my affection, godling. Yes, I've lots of it to go around; but I can just as easily rescind such privileges.
They say a lot of things about me, dearest; and they'll tell you, in your dealings with me, ample caution is in order. Let me show you why.
Don't ever take me for some thoughtless nymph to be manipulated, dearest. I expect reciprocal devotion from you. Do you understand?
Oh, really? You shall find I don't take such rejections lying down. And you shall find it out the hard way.
If it's your wish to test the limits of the fine relationship we've built, why then... I can confirm you're testing them, all right!
Now, dearest... surely there's no way that could have been one of the wiser choices that you've lately made?
Dearest, just in case it hasn't been made clear as crystal lately, let me tell you: When presented with the opportunity, don't ever reject me.
You'd spurn my love this easily, dearest? You are about to find the consequences are much harder to dismiss without a second thought.
I must admit I'm unaccustomed to rejection, love. But you must be accustomed to swift death! Here comes one for you now.
Oh, but this is such a heartbreak, dearest! Why would you do that? You know that I won't take this lying down.
You dare to play with my heart, little godling? I'll just take yours, and shatter it to pieces, then, I think!
Sometimes I think that you're quite different than most all the others here, darling. And then, you go and do something like this.

CHOICE.Aphrodite: You think you can brush me aside like that? Well, I think I can crush you into tiny, little bits! Let's see who's right, shall we?

text.Aphrodite: Let's say we kissed and made up, dearest. Just, do not anger me again, or I might come down and kill you there myself!
Alas that passion sometimes drives me into vengeance, dearest! Yet, who among us isn't without vices, hm?
Oh, how I hate to fight with you like this! Let's forgive each other and forget, go back to how things used to be?
I'm not angry with you any longer, dearest! Though, might I suggest you take some extra steps to keep it that way, hm?
A loving heart is a forgiving heart, don't you agree? So I shall let this little matter slide, and you've my loving heart to thank for it, hm-hm!
The truth is I'm a lover, not a fighter, dearest. So how about we call this matter put to bed, and get on with our lives?
I'd say this little squabble can be put to bed, for now. I'm better for the moment, but I was very angry with you, love!
I cannot bring myself to stay upset with you forever, little godling, so let's move along from that small misunderstanding there.
There is no common sense with love, godling, so... why don't we pretend your indiscretion there did not occur.
It is through times of difficulty that the love we share is tested and reforged. But you just watch yourself when testing it like that.
Love and jealousy go hand in hand, don't they, dearest? Although the former's much more pleasant, isn't it.
Oh, all this fighting! It's just not like us at all, dearest! Let's say we kissed and then made up, all right?

text.Zagreus: Lady Aphrodite, I am truly blessed simply to have made your acquaintance, so, this is for you.

text.Aphrodite: Lasting relationships are built on reciprocity. So if you lavish me with gifts, why, what am I to do but give you something in return?

text.Zagreus: My lady Aphrodite, if not for our acquaintance, I am certain that my days or nights would be much drearier indeed.

text.Aphrodite: Why, dearest, such a wonderfully thoughtful gift, for me? I love it, and I would be lying if I said you shouldn't have!

text.Zagreus: Lady Aphrodite, I'm afraid there really isn't much here worthy of you, but perhaps this can suffice.

text.Aphrodite: My, but if this isn't such a treasure to behold, and I accept it as a sign of your affection! Of something even more, perhaps...?

text.Zagreus: Dear Aphrodite, surely you have all the offerings you can stand, but I would ask that you accept one more.

text.Aphrodite: Ah, dearest, but it stirs my heart to know you care so deeply for our wonderful relationship! To celebrate it with such princely gifts!

text.Zagreus: Dear Aphrodite, the incomparable beauty of Olympus is less difficult to fathom, having already met you. I am so grateful to have earned your favor.

text.Aphrodite: My, but don't you come on rather strong, there, little godling! Though, I can take much more of your affections, you shall see!

text.Zagreus: Aphrodite, you must have more worshipers and suitors than all your kin upon Olympus combined. I may not fall exactly into either category, though I hope you know my gratitude for all you've done for me is true.

text.Aphrodite: You know, dearest, I am more worshiped than perhaps anybody else upon Olympus! You'd think getting such praise would roll right off my back by now, but no! I love receiving it. Especially from you.

CHOICE.Zagreus: My lady Aphrodite, once more you've graced me with your presence and your favor, which inspire the best from me. Let this modest gift of Ambrosia signify I'm forever in your debt.

CHOICE.Aphrodite: My little godling. I'd say you've honored me more times than I could count, but that would be a lie, now, wouldn't it. I so admire your devotion and your perseverance! If ever you do reach us on Olympus, I should very much enjoy getting to know you even better, then.
Who dares threaten my little godling?
Just leave it to me, dearest!
I like the sound of that.
I'll pierce them through the heart!
Oh it shall be my pleasure!
You don't want to make me angrier.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Lady Aphrodite, how can I say no?

CHOICE.Aphrodite: You break my heart, I break your body, little godling.
You ought to worship me, rather than anger me.
Don't you refuse my good graces like that again.

text.Dionysus: Hey Zag, my Dad, he's here and wants to have a word, be cool man, go along with what he says, OK?

text.Zeus: That Dionysus, always much too kind with introductions, though at least he shows me suitable respect. Perhaps someday he can instruct you in the customs of Olympus here.

text.Dionysus: Uh, Zag, erm... your uncle's passing through. Not Dad, erm, the other one I mean, and he just wanted to check in, see how you're doing, so...

text.Poseidon: Ah-hah, there you are, my little nephew! Dionysus showing you the ropes, or what? You want a real feast, though, you just stick with me! Now take my blessing, go!

text.Dionysus: Oh, anyway we're here, man, waiting up for you! We know you're going to make it, I would say eventually?

Hey, Zag, when you arrive, it's going to be a real scene, I'll tell you now! Even Athena here will cut loose for a bit, let down her hair, you know, put on something more comfy, yeah, it's going to be great!

text.Athena: Perhaps Lord Dionysus here is the true god of strategy, as it appears he is uncannily aware of my next move, Cousin. Although, be that as it may, I shall attempt to remain focused on your situation. Not his feast.

text.Dionysus: You know, Zag, maybe once you get here, you could get old Ares to just lighten up a little, you know, man? Always dragging down the mood, with talk of blood, and nastiness, all sorts of stuff like that!

text.Ares: Why, my Lord Dionysus! I fail to see why such discussion is perceived as unbecoming of a feast. A successfully conducted war is certainly a cause for celebration, is it not?

text.Dionysus: Look, Zag, you should know by now that when it comes to feasting, it's Yours Truly here who puts on the best performance. But I do have Lady Aphrodite's help!

text.Aphrodite: Wine does have a rather special way of making everybody look even more beautiful than ever, Dionysus dear! And from such beauty, why, long-lasting love is born! And also shorter-lasting love, much of the time.

text.Dionysus: Zag, man, I was just attempting here to get our good friend Artemis to finally make an appearance at one of my feasts, it's just... wouldn't you know, she's all preoccupied, something about a hunt?

text.Artemis: That's right, Lord Dionysus, a hunt! Which requires lots and lots of total quiet, and clear-minded focus. So, if you'll excuse me?

text.Dionysus: Hey Zag, got a favor here I mean to ask, could you maybe persuade the Lady Demeter to ease up on the whole 'not let anything grow' thing she's been going on about?

text.Demeter: I daresay, my Lord Dionysus, that partaking of less wine for some amount of time might do you good. Regardless, you'll not coax a better crop from me.

text.Zagreus: Hope this lives up to your expectations, mate. In the name of Hades! Olympus? This is an official message! Should be a good time, Lord Dionysus!

text.Dionysus: Whoa, hold just for a moment, Zag, now, I can recognize an invite when I see one, man! And this is definitely almost certainly some sort of invite, one for me, and... one for everybody else, it looks like, here? Hoh, I'm excited, that is something really special, I can tell!

Look, Zag, I don't entirely recall what happened at that feast you threw for all of us down there, but let me tell you, I am under the impression it went smashingly! It was amazing, man! Let's have another one sometime, all right?
So Zag, you met my dad by now, your uncle Zeus? He's cool and loves a feasting, just... be sure to keep him in your thoughts. OK?
Hoh-ho, no way Zag, looking like you got yourself a gift from old Poseidon there? He's quite the catch, but here, hope you saved some room for more!
Hey man, I heard Athena had a word with you already yeah? She's cool, though, once you get to know her. Here! I got something that ought to suit her style.
Whoa, hey, you must have had a run-in with the lovely Aphrodite, am I right, or am I right, there Zag? But I have just the thing to go with her!
Hey, Zag, got to tell you, I cannot believe that little Artemis is hanging out with you! She doesn't hang with anybody, man! But I digress, take this!
You hanging out with Ares, are you, Zag? He's quite the chap, I'll give him that, I'll give him that, and now, I'll give you this!
Felt a shiver in the air just now, and that can only mean that chilly Demeter decided to give you a little help, there, huh? Or maybe it's just cold, I mean, this is a mountaintop!
Hey, Zag, uh... I may just be losing it or something here, but isn't that your dad's own blessing that you've got? That's something, man, I didn't know that he was helping you!
Now how's my favorite Underworld god surviving, Zag, you holding up or what? Right better momentarily, I bet!
Man oh man, Zag, someday you will be the guest of honor at the biggest feast that you have ever seen! Though I know you have got your hands full for the time, so, first things first!
Sometimes I have to wonder, man, what's going through your head, I mean, I know you hear me and the others but it's so damn dark down there I can't hear you at all!
Let me tell you something, Zag, I know your dad he's got to be a real handful, I relate to that, you understand me, mate? So you get out of there, and you'll be more than welcome here, with us!
I've got a feeling this time, man, like things are really going to take a turn for you, and I mean for the better, almost certainly, I think!
The key to any halfway decent feast is lots and lots of preparation, man. Or maybe just having to improvise, you know?
I got to hand it to you, Zag, you don't back down, you don't ever back down, what is this, like the twentieth time that you've attempted to escape?
You're getting somewhere, getting somewhere, man, I understand you made it up to Asphodel before, now that is progress, keep it up, you keep on going, yeah?

Heard you wrestled with some Satyrs near the surface, Zag! Nice work making it that far, and I just want to let you know that they are definitely not my crew, man! Satyrs I know aren't like that at all!
Ah, Zag, what happened last time, man? It seemed like you were rather close, but then, we couldn't see you anymore from here, and now you're back? Well, give another go!
Want you to know something, here, man. It's been a bit of a long haul, but you are getting closer to the surface, and you'll get there someday, and we're with you, however long it takes, OK?
Hey, back when we had that feast, there, man, I, I hope I didn't, you know, make for any inconveniences or anything down there, did I...?
Zag, I cannot believe your mom's Persephone, that's something else, I got to tell you, man! I never took her for the sort to be all into Underworld stuff!
Say, isn't that the Overflowing Cup I handed down to you, I'm glad you like it, man! I guess it's overflowing still, because I figure otherwise I couldn't tell at all!
You, man, must be mates with just about everybody down there, by now, yeah? Doling out Nectars left and right, just livening the place right up!
Say, let me just point out you've got a lot of Nectar on you, man! Oh, I can tell, I like the stuff a lot, myself, but even I don't pack that much, and I mean, wow!

Say, man, if I'm not mistaken, I think you got yourself a bottle of Ambrosia, there? I'd no idea you could get that stuff downstairs! Do me a solid, though, hang on to any more you find, or better yet, give it away! I'd hate to think even a drop has gone to waste!

Well, would you just look at yourself, Zag! You are like a walking stockpile of Ambrosia, aren't you? Taking the best care of it, at that. I knew I could count on you, but... <Sniff> I didn't know I could be just so proud of you, you know, man?
Zag, turns out I am quite the judge of character, and you, man, have an awful lot of it, I mean, you've given out how much Ambrosia now? To all your mates, and more?!
You got to let me in on something, Zag, how did you gather up so much Ambrosia, there? I mean, sometimes I think the stuff is plentiful up here, but you are positively swimming in it, man!
You are the talk of the mountain, you know that, man? Good on you, getting on just about everybody's good side up here, I mean, that is a feat, all right!

Hey Zag, ever see a fellow by the name of Orpheus down there, you ever heard of him? I bet you have, and I have had a funny thought, a little jest that maybe we could try, if you'd be up to have a little harmless fun?

text.Zagreus: Harmless fun at the expense of Orpheus? You have my full and complete attention, Dionysus mate.

text.Dionysus: ...That chap comes up with the most smashing songs, so I was thinking, maybe we could spin him a tall tale, something like how maybe you and I, like, we're connected or something? He'll buy it, tell him, tell him for me, yeah?!
Hahaha, Zag! I heard you got to Orpheus, he's got this whole entire ballad now, about how you are really me, or maybe it's the other way around, I've no idea, hahahaha! Here!
Zag, I heard that Orpheus, he found his missing bride, why, isn't that the sweetest thing, isn't it, man? I'll drink to that, and I think so should you!
Erm, hey, man, you been having some bad run-ins with that Fury, Megaera, is that her name? Now isn't she a real firebrand! Maybe this'll help you out next time you meet!
Whoa, Zag, heard you're hanging with the Fury Megaera of late, well cheers to that, man, bet she's something else, but you just watch for that whip of hers, OK?
Hey man, I'm hearing up here that you got in good with Megaera, the Fury, is that right, I mean, I hope it is, because, hahaha, yeow, know what I mean? They say she's something else!

Hey, you're in good with Thanatos, isn't that right? A real broody sort, sometimes I think maybe I ought to just invite him to a feast, but then, what if he cools the whole thing down, makes everybody kind of ehhhhh, you know?

Heard that you took care of Theseus down in Elysium of late, there, Zag! Nice work, never liked that one, between us. There's this nice lass helped him out one time, and he just dumped her rotten, I don't like that, man!
RequiredFalseTextLines  { OlympianReunionQuestComplete
Whoaa Zag, man, you look positively knackered, you be sure and take it easy if you can out there, all right? Here, maybe this'll help!
Oof, Zag, look, I know you're not in a good spot right now, you must be really out of sorts! Though maybe this might numb the pain a bit!
Eugh, you're a proper mess right now, got to be candid with you, man, you're bleeding everywhere, get it together, yeah?
Now what's the matter, down there, Zag, it's like you've been up feasting day and night, you're barely standing, everything OK?
Ooh, you're in no shape to be going off, what happened to you, there? Well, here, you know what? Let me see if we can get you back into it, man!
Oh-hoh, Zag, have I got something special here for you, I mean this here is top-notch stuff, even among the top-notch stuff I have to give, just look at this!
Look, man, I am feeling generous right now, know what I mean? And so, here's something extra potent for you, ought to keep you going for a while longer than you're used to, there!

text.Zagreus: That was... revelry? People having a good time? Well, sure, then! In the name of Hades! Olympus, I'll accept this message.

text.Dionysus: Heeey, there, Zag, man, how's it going? Look, you have got to get here with the rest of us already, we've been saving you a spot! Let me see what I can do, make life a little sweeter for you in the meantime!
Looks like this feast is getting started still, am I not right about that, Zag? Come on, let's show everybody a good time.
Just getting warmed up down there, yeah, Zag? Here, I've a fine selection of my blessings, just for you!
Whooaa, Zag, I bet you could use a little pick-me-up right about now, and I am here to offer you whichever one you please!
Hey Zag, how is life, you hanging in there, yeah? I reckoned maybe we could raise a glass here, to your health, but then I thought, 'No, wait! I can do a little more than that!' So, here we go!
Hey, how you living life down there right now, all right I take it, yeah? No, wait, though, I have just the thing!
Why, hello, Zag! Fancy running into you, though there's no need to work yourself so hard, you hear me, yeah? I reckon this should take the edge right off!
How goes it this time, man, everything fine? Though hold that thought, I wager we can make things finer yet!
That Underworld of yours, place is a real pit, isn't it Zag, a shame you're stuck down there. But we are going to get you out of there, together, you and I!
Soon as you get up to Olympus, man... it's going to be a feast like you have never seen, you mark my words! Now take this, and good luck!
You give those musty shades and corpses a fair fighting chance down there, you hear me, Zag? Though just in case you need a hand...
You got this, man! I so believe in you, it's almost like the Greeks believe in me! And they believe in me an awful lot, you know!
Time for another go at getting out of there, eh, Zag? Well not to worry, we'll make something happen, let's hop to it then!
Now listen up here, Zag, 'cause this time I have got something for you that's going to put some extra fire in your step, you ready, man?
You wait for just a moment, Zag, 'cause I got just the thing for this occasion, you are going to love it, get a load of this!
Now, Zagreus, I'm certain everything is going fine for you right now, but just in case, but just in case! I got a little something, just for you!
It's me, Zag, hey, I know you haven't got a lot of time to listen to me prattle on like this, and so, I'm cutting to the chase here, look!
Hey again as ever Zag, now you keep at it like you have been and I bet we'll all be hanging out up here in no time flat! I'm with you all the way!
Oh, hey, let's see, man, I am thinking that this time around this smattering of my concoctions ought to do you right!
Here's to an interesting time, how about that, yeah?
I'd like to make a toast, to you of course my friend! Good luck out there!
All right, man, I have got your back, and you have got this, go!
Hey, hey, have I got just the thing for this particular occasion, man!
Hey, Zag, what is going on, you going to get out of here this time? Why, yes, I think you are!
OK Zag. You and me. We're getting through this, now or never, ready, yeah?
Oh hey, Zag, here's a toast to your success, so... clink! Cheers and all that!
Here's something for you man, grab it and go!
I got you, Zag, got just the thing, right here!
Ah there you are, man, I got what you need!
I know you're busy, man, so here you go, get on with it, all right?
It's good to kind of see you down there man, now here, take this!
Sure is dark there, Zag, I hope you're hanging in there, yeah?
You getting anywhere, yet, man? 'Cause if you're not, it's cool, we've all got time!
Got something that is going to knock you off your feet, here, man!
You ready for this, Zag, now here's a good one, courtesy of me!
It's going to be a real feast here once you make it, man!
Only the best for you, man, now check this out, you'll see!
This here, Zag, is among the best I have to offer, it is good!
I'm feeling really good right now, and thought I'd pass that right along!
Here's something extra special for you, man, now cheers!
Past time we got things going for you there, what do you say, you ready for this, man?
I got to make it to a feast in just a little bit, here, man, but quickly, take this, yeah?
I know it's been tough times of late, but look, you just keep going, and you'll make it, man!
This time for sure, I mean, I know you're going to make it to the top, together with me, man!
Hey I propose a toast to you, there, man, and may you always kill whatever's in your path, and on and on!
A toast, man, to your health! Or to the lack of it, for anybody who gets on your bad side, yeah?
Have I got just the thing for you, here, man, you ready? Here we go!
What do you say we go all out this time, how about it, Zag, you with me, man, or what?
Been saving something for the right occasion, though I figure it's as good a time as any, yeah?
Hey, cheers to you, and everything you do, there, Zag! Only the best from me to you, man!
Heeey, what's, uh, with that Charon, man, he's sort of, I-don't-know, though I am glad he's been of service!
Ah-hah, you found me holing up in Charon's nasty stash there did you man, well good, good, here!
Looks like you are stocked for one hell of a night down there, man! I knew Charon would hook you up with what you need!
Hey, cheers for picking up the tab, there, Zag, now, I cannot exactly pay you back, though I could give you this!
I bet that Charon has to be the life of every feast you have down there, with such a personality, am I not right about that, man?
Oh, come on, Zag, and here I thought that we were cool. You hurt my pride, there, man. I guess I'm going to have to hurt yours....
Ohhh man, that was definitely not a thing to do, I mean, are we best mates, or not...? You think on that, while I do this.
Look Zag, I'm not going to lie, you hurt my feelings here, I thought we had a thing! A close familial bond! I'm really mad now that I think on it!
What, you wouldn't hang with me given the choice? I thought I had you sorted, man, but maybe you just don't appreciate the finer things!
Ah, come on, Zag, now that was not the choice I would have made, you messing with me, man? All right! I'll mess with you.
Ohh, we all make mistakes from time to time, man, and you ought to know! You made one there just now!
Why do it to me like that, Zag, man, I thought we were close as grapes upon the vine, but I was wrong?
Did I do something to deserve this, man, because I thought that we were getting on just fine, better than fine, but this?
It's not that I'm upset or anything, here, Zag, you know I'm not, but truthfully I am a bit annoyed, a little bit, and so, I got to send the message, man.
Really, man? After everything we've been through together, this is the gratitude I get?
Well, way to spoil the feast, there, Zag, I mean come on, I thought I was your mate? Was I mistaken, man?

CHOICE.Dionysus: Zag, I can take a jest, ask anybody, but when it comes to competition here, it's not a laughing matter! Do you understand me, man?

text.Dionysus: All right, all right, all right, we're cool, we're cool, no need to get all hot and bothered any longer, here!
OK, let's say we're settled up now, Zag, and go on being best mates just like before, yeah?
You know, Zag, you are not so bad, just had a little lapse in judgment, happens to me all the time, now let's get on with it!
Hey, now, that was quite a sight, I got to hand it to you, man, and you deserve this, here!
Know what, man, I'm not even angry after that. What was I even going off about, do you recall...?
OK, all right, it's fine already, Zag, you win this time and I am good as grapes.
Appreciate your understanding, there, man, so let's just avoid this type of little shake-up next time, yeah?
Hahahahahah, OK, thanks for a good laugh, there, Zag, what was it I was going on about, before...?
Oh I just can't stay mad about you, Zag, and to be honest, why, I wasn't that mad to begin with, I just thought I'd shake your branches up a bit!
You're all right, man, you're all right, don't even worry about the rough patch we just crossed back there, we're stronger than all that!
I figured this time I'd stay mad at you for sure, man, but you know what, I just couldn't! No matter how hard I tried.
It's like I always say, Zag, you have got to permit yourself a bad time every now and again to really appreciate all the good times, yeah?
Know what, man, just forget about what happened, yeah? 'Cause I already did, I mean, it happens, right?

text.Zagreus: Lord Dionysus, it's been great getting to know you, so, please accept this humble offering.

text.Dionysus: Now that is something, a right princely gift, there, Zag, and just so happens I got something here I have been meaning to give you!

text.Zagreus: A toast in your honor, Lord Dionysus mate. Have I mentioned how pleased I am to have made your acquaintance?

text.Dionysus: Hoh-oh, what, is that for me, really, I mean, cheers man, that is awful generous of you, I'm much obliged!

text.Zagreus: Lord Dionysus mate, you have made the mood down here materially less miserable, and I am much obliged.

text.Dionysus: What, is that for me, why Zag, I mean you really shouldn't have, you know I can't get enough of this stuff, right?

text.Zagreus: Lord Dionysus mate, you must have no shortage of supreme vintage at your disposal, but this one's from me.

text.Dionysus: Why Zag, how positively thoughtful, man, I mean I love it, positively love this stuff, and I am very moved that you would think of me for it!

text.Zagreus: Hey, on no occasion whatsoever, cheers to you again, Lord Dionysus mate! This place is so much less dreary under your influence!

text.Dionysus: Ah, this is the greatest, Zag! This feast I'm headed to? I was getting a little concerned I wasn't going to have quite enough to go around for everyone. Well, you just saved my evening, man! Too bad you couldn't be there, yeah?

text.Zagreus: Dionysus mate, sometimes things weigh heavily on me, but then I hear from you, and it's like I don't have a care in the world! To your health!

text.Dionysus: Oh, you're really too much for me sometimes, you know that, man? Got to tell you, I don't think I ever felt so close to somebody so damn far away. But through the gift of drink? It's like we're with each other in spirit, all the time, you know?

CHOICE.Zagreus: What does one offer to the god of wine? The very best, is what, and down here, this is it, mate! I'm grateful I've got some of your spirit in me. To have such a connection, with you despite all the distance between us...!

CHOICE.Dionysus: Zag, I cannot believe what you are offering to me! Ambrosia, man, for me? And talk about a bottle that has seen some wild days and nights, I mean if it got all the way to you down there, only to come back up! Know what? I'm saving it, till we can share it, here!
You want to tangle with us?!
Here, this one's on me!!
Drink up, mates!!
Positively man!
Oh absolutely!
Have I got just the thing for you!
Time for a real feast!
Something for everyone!
You got it, man!
Come on already man.
You serious right now?
You kidding me with this?
I can't believe this man.
What can I say, man, it's a shame all right.
I'm absolutely gutted man.
Now that's a crying shame.
Didn't have to be like this, man! We were having such a good time!
Hate to sour the occasion like this, Zag. What was I supposed to do?
Eugh, I feel bad all of a sudden, man, I mean, what happened, there?
Oh hey man, what is new?
Hey you hanging in there yeah?
You still in one piece, man?
Hoh yeah I'm into it!
Here this one's for you!

text.Athena: Noble cousin, my lord father has taken keen interest in your journey and your plight, and now seeks to aid you with the thunder of heaven itself. And you've my support, as well, of course.

text.Zeus: I thank you for the generous introduction, fair Athena, and I always rest assured when you are close at hand. I trust with our combined might, our good Zagreus is virtually certain to succeed!

text.Athena: When I first notified Lord Father Zeus and other members of our family of your existence, Zagreus, it was Uncle Poseidon here who first leapt up, and pledged his power over sea and earth to you. Is that not so, Uncle?

text.Poseidon: Exactly so, Athena! You, with that fine memory of yours! For it isn't everyday I learn my doleful brother Hades sired a fine son! He does not know how good he has it, there! And you, Nephew, could have it even better, here!

text.Athena: Your predicament has pulled our family together, united in a desire to assist you, Cousin. Even those who typically do not think much of those other than themselves.

text.Aphrodite: Oh, if only I had wisdom such as yours, Athena dear, so that I was more capable of picking up on subtle jabs and insults such as that! You're not fooling anybody with your feigned benevolence, you know.

text.Athena: The world is not all lies and deceit as you make it out to be, Aphrodite. Sometimes, a lending of assistance is no more than it appears to be. Now either back up Zagreus, or stand aside.
If you've a moment, Zagreus? One of my relatives has claimed that I usurp your time. So I invited her to contact you.

text.Artemis: Um, hello, Zagreus... Athena here is grandstanding or trying to prove a point, or something. I don't know. Anyway, nice talking to you.

text.Athena: Well, I suppose that's settled, then. I am afraid such interactions aren't uncommon here amongst my family; but what's a family without flaws?
Some members of our family do not yet fully understand just how precarious your situation is, Cousin. My Lord Dionysus here, he goes about as though this is a festive matter of some sort!

text.Dionysus: Oh, come on, Athena girl, you really mean to tell me that discovering a long-lost relative isn't a cause for celebrating right away, I mean, you can't be telling me a thing like that? Because if Zag isn't a cause for feasting, I don't know what is!

text.Athena: I bring to you the Lady Demeter, Cousin. I've asked that she please rest assured knowing we have your matter well under control. Though, in her infinite compassion, she has taken up your cause, nevertheless!

text.Demeter: Oh, you needn't lavish me with your faint praise, Athena dear. In all your boundless intellect, I'd have expected you would know I see through your intentions, plain as day.

text.Athena: The biting cold surrounding you must mean the Goddess of Seasons decided to take an interest in your struggle, Zagreus? I did not count on Demeter being a part of this. Take heart, though use discretion around her.

text.Zagreus: This is it, then. In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Lady Athena, I trust you'll quickly figure this one out.

text.Athena: Is this some kind of offering for me? No, hold a moment, this appears to be a message! Part of one. Then, can this mean...? I have to notify the others. I trust they also have received something from you, or shortly shall.

It was my privilege to have visited your father's House, and briefly had a chance to meet you, Zagreus. Nyx and your mother each are very shrewd; perhaps you've taken after both of them. As for your new responsibilities... exposing weak points in defenses is my specialty.
I understand you've been in contact with my father. Your uncle Zeus, I mean. He's taken interest in your plight; you should feel honored!
You've met the master of the seas, Poseidon, haven't you? Our uncle's affable but quick to anger. Be on your guard with him, is my advice.
Cousin, you've met Aphrodite, no? She likes beguiling others with her charms; but her intentions with you I believe are pure. You'll find our strengths are complementary.
My warlike brother Ares reached you, didn't he. I've always found his conduct quite disturbing. At least it seems he's helping you for now.
I'll tell you something, Cousin: If even Artemis is aiding you, it's proof your cause is just. She doesn't often take an interest in family affairs.
Did Dionysus truly visit you before? He tends to seek out revelry, not conflict. I'm pleased to know he's making himself useful here.
You arrived sooner than anticipated, Cousin, and my estimations seldom are inaccurate. All for the best, of course. Perhaps you're simply faster than I thought.

Zagreus, perhaps it is a fancy of imagination, but it seems almost as though, this time, you bear the blessing of... your own father! If Lord Hades is assisting you in any way in this, then I shall hold out hope that your relationship yet has capacity to heal, to some extent at least.

So you've another blessing from Lord Hades, then. Zagreus, I'm under no delusion you and your father shall become the closest friends, from here. Neverthless, I do believe it's possible to move forward even such a relationship as yours. Believe me... I know.
I so look forward to our meeting face to face amongst the gods, dear Cousin. Olympus shall be merrier and wiser once you're here.
Hail and good tidings to you, noble Cousin. May you be swift and thorough vanquishing the dead who dare oppose you.
Remain relentless in your effort to escape, dear Cousin. In spite of all our differences, perseverance is a quality we all possess.
You can always count upon assistance from me, Zagreus. I always shall prioritize the needs of our family above everything else.
Let my voice be a glimmer in the darkness, noble Cousin; though, may the blessing I am about to provide be even more than that.
You've met your distant relatives by now. We don't all share the same demeanor, nor see eye to eye. Though, all of us, I think, wish you the best.
The one called Nyx... she is your mother, as I understand? We Olympians rarely consort with the chthonic gods. Though Nyx herself reached out to me about your plight, and I was spurred to act.
Please send the goddess Nyx my kind regards. That she supports you in your effort to escape her own domain suggests a selflessness I would not have expected.
It's such a cruelty that your father hid the knowledge of your birth and life from us, my cousin. It's unacceptable.
Your father Hades and my father Zeus have not communicated in some time, and Zeus refuses to explain. Something transpired between the two of them. Perhaps you know better than I.

There's something that I've wished to tell you, Zagreus: There is no shame in your upbringing. Many of us on Olympus, we likewise were born and raised under the strangest circumstances. Someday I'll have to tell you about mine.
You're nothing like your father, Zagreus. I mean that as a compliment. He cut himself off from the rest of us. Many times have we attempted peace, to no avail.
It comforts me to see how far you've come, Cousin. And I am confident that you shall make your way, eventually. I shall look forward to our conversations then.
You reached the flames of Asphodel, well done! You may have quite a distance still to go, but having crossed through Tartarus is no small step, Cousin.

I see you've made it all the way to hallowed Elysium, Cousin? A significant way toward the surface, and if you could get there the one time, surely you have what it takes to do it again, and overcome the dangers that await therein.

I understand you nearly reached the surface lately, Zagreus. My confidence remains unshaken that you shall get out of there, eventually. No matter what sorts of unknown horrors lie shrouded beyond the boundary there.
Were you not close to having reached the surface lately, Cousin? Then, this can only mean some unforeseen impediment prevented your escape.

There must be some unconquerable force or foe awaiting you, just at the border of your realm and ours. We cannot even see it through a shroud of darkness, there. I shall make certain that your family knows it may take considerable time to surpass... so fear not, for we are patient, here.

Despite whatever difficulties you've encountered, dear Cousin, again and again, you have never yielded. I must admit, your strength of will is quite inspiring. For, even I have doubts, from time to time. It's all the clearer to me why the goddess Nyx spoke so highly of you.

It's fortunate your troubles with your mother were resolved. Persephone, I mean! To think I led all of my family to believe your mother was the goddess Nyx, instead. It seems I was an unwitting accomplice to a bit of a deception, there. But Nyx, I know she merely tried to help.
You bear my Owl Pendant, noble Cousin! Wherever it should go, I faintly see its shimmer from afar. Even where you reside! For owls see in total darkness, after all.

I have grown closer than expected with the goddess Nyx in all of this, Cousin. It is quite evident to me how much she cares for you. I must admit I envy your relationship, sometimes. For I've made do without a mother's presence in my life.

Lord Ares has suggested he and goddess Nyx have grown much closer to each other, in all this. Nothing untoward, if you must know. Ares and I have often disagreed, about so many things, and yet we share a fondness for the Night herself, it seems.

Sometimes I think about the goddess Nyx, and how I long for her to be the mother that I never had, Cousin. Is it improper that I say such things to you? One would expect I would already have somebody on Olympus, yet... it often feels as though I am the mother, here.

The goddess Nyx has indicated you possess a list of prophecies from the Three Fates. I've such a list upon Olympus, here! It seems to be connected to your own, as several prophecies already are fulfilled. Isn't it such an honor to urge Fate along?
You cannot withstand your father's legions, Zagreus. But if you possess one of my greatest blessings, things may unfold differently, I think.
Dear Cousin, would that I could give to you everlasting, tireless resolve. Though, come to think of it, this may be suited as a counterpart.

Supporting you through your ordeal, Cousin? It's reminiscent of the thrill of doing battle by the side of those whom I hold dear. I may be safe upon our mountaintop, though I am with you there, as well... for every well-earned victory, and bitter loss.
You brandish the Eternal Spear we call Varatha...! So then it wasn't lost during the war. A magnificent weapon, in deserving hands.
Why, you wield Coronacht the Heart-Seeker...! I never took you for an archer, though the power of that bow is undeniable. Use it wisely!
You bear Aegis, the original itself...! My own shield was forged much later, in its image. You'll have to tell me someday how you found it.
You got your hands on Malphon, the Twin Fists, I see. No ordinary weapon. Prone to fits of savagery quite unbecoming of a well-trained warrior. Then watch yourself, and throw not caution to the wind.

The Rail of Adamant, itself, has found its way into your hands, Cousin? A malignant thing, if you were to ask me, and not one I would ever use, myself. Unless, perhaps, I had no other choice. I suppose it must have been that way for you.
You're badly injured aren't you, Cousin? I wish that I could will the pain away, though at the least I can provide you this.
Look at you, Zagreus, you're barely fit to fight from all the injury that you've sustained! I'll try to keep you going for as long as possible.
It seems to me that you've sustained life-draining injuries already, Zagreus. But don't lose hope. We can sustain you in a proper fighting shape.
You may have suffered many wounds but shall not perish imminently, Cousin. Not if I have anything to say about it. Here.
Oh, Zagreus... your recent battles evidently haven't gone as hoped. Nevertheless, always strive onward, while you still draw breath.
For you, my cousin Zagreus, I wish to offer the most potent of the blessings I am able to bestow. Make wise your use of this, and rise toward us!
The circumstances spur me now to offer you the greatest of my powers, Cousin. Take my strength, and strike the darkness down!

text.Zagreus: It's got to be her. Then, here goes nothing... Ahem. In the name of Hades! Olympus, I accept this message.

text.Athena: Hail, noble Cousin. Now, let's get you from that miserable place. I'll see that all of us upon Olympus do our part, beginning here with me.
Keep fighting, Cousin. Fight from out of that eternal gloom. I trust that you'll be joining us upon Olympus shortly.
I have your back, Cousin. Rise now to your rightful station with my blessings!
May the light and fury of Olympus guide you from the dark, Cousin. I've a token of it for you here.
Push forward, noble Cousin. I shall be keen to see you circumvent the perils that the Fates arranged for you this time.
Vanquish all who stand against you, noble Cousin. I and your relatives upon Olympus shall assist you in so doing.
Sometimes I think about what you've endured, to have been living in that loathsome squalor, Cousin. I swear, you'll have your justice.
Do not fear your father's cruel legions, Cousin! Their lives are long since forfeit, and they cannot stand against one of your birthright, nor against my power.
Yours is a brazen plan of action, Zagreus, and I admire it. The boldest strategy often prevails. Especially with my support.
Take heart, Cousin; for you have found me even in the suffocating darkness of the Underworld. May my power be of some assistance.
Your struggles have not gone unnoticed, Cousin, so take heart. Eternity awaits you once you finally break free.
Here on Olympus is the opposite of everything about that lifeless squalor you reside in, Zagreus. Fight on and come to us!
Cousin, I grow angry merely thinking of your situation. May what power I can offer be of service as you struggle towards your fate.
Your father chose to sever ties with all of us, and stew alone within his land beneath the earth. But you are not beholden to his actions. Fight!
Your labors make you stronger, noble Cousin. And, the blessings I now offer ought to make you stronger still.
I've found you once again, dear Cousin, and my strength is yours; so much of it as I can send there to the bowels of the earth.
I'm here again to lend to you my power, noble Cousin. Though your own strength of will is how you'll finally break free of that cruel place.
I'm pleased to see your father's stubbornness is manifest in you as such determination, Zagreus. My blessing be with you.
What wretched fools dare stand against you, Cousin? Punish them, so that they learn something they ought have learned in life.
Hold fast to your resolve, Cousin, and climb on toward the surface. No matter how often your foothold falters, I am here.
I shall not keep you, Zagreus, except to offer you some of my power to improve your chances of escape. Now quickly choose, and go.
May wisdom and good fortune guide you toward the light of day this time, Cousin.
The Underworld's wretched dead shall fear you yet, Cousin.
Strength and wisdom guide you from the darkness, Zagreus.
The low cunning of your lifeless enemies is not a match for your divine might.
Remember I am always watching over you, dear Cousin.
You'll have your justice in due course, Cousin. I promise you.
The might and fury of Olympus courses through you, noble Cousin.
I take it you've a plan in mind this time for how you're going to escape, don't you, Cousin?
I shall not keep you, Zagreus, except to offer you my power to improve your chances of escape.
Remain relentless in your effort, Zagreus. For perseverance is a quality we all possess.
I and your family on Olympus all stand ready to support you in your efforts, noble Cousin.
Remember, doubt and hesitancy are your real enemies, Cousin.
I know that you are more than capable even without my power, Cousin. But just in case...
Envision your success, and choose the means by which you shall achieve it, Zagreus.
I shall not offer empty words, dear Cousin; I shall instead offer you this.
With our ferocity combined, Cousin, what chances do your father's forces even have?
My support alone is not enough to see you through this, Zagreus; but it certainly shall help.
Your foes shall soon find it impossible to overcome your strength, combined with mine.
I've every confidence that you shall imminently put my blessing to good use.
Let not your sense of purpose waver, Zagreus. Visualize the outcome you desire.
Make not the same mistake twice, and you shall always grow wiser, no matter what else.
I shall do everything within my power to defend you from the perils of your journey, Zagreus.
Take heed against your father's legions, Zagreus. And take also my power.
Do not forget that changing strategy can be the key to victory, Cousin.
I cannot glean the details of your predicament right now, Cousin. Though maybe this shall help.
The might and honor of Olympus shield you against the darkness and the dead, Zagreus.
I take it having an impenetrable defense against your enemies may be of some use, Cousin?
I'm not in any mood to trifle with your father's nonsense this time, Zagreus. So, use this.
These are among the mightest defenses I can offer, Zagreus. Choose wisely, then.
I've readied several of my most potent blessings so your victory can be achieved, Cousin.
Observe, dear Cousin, for this time I offer you uncommonly superior protection.
It feels unseemly to make contact from that most-unpleasant boatman's stash of ill-gotten wares. Nonetheless, this was an opportunity.
You're difficult to track there in the depths, Cousin; though, the boatman Charon thankfully is proving of some help.
The river-boatman Charon is beholden to your father's realm, but seems agreeable enough, for a fair price.
A shrewd expenditure of wealth is sometimes all that stands between a victory and sore defeat, isn't that right, Cousin?
We cannot effectively communicate with Charon from Olympus, but he is amenable to certain trades, and seems unfettered by your father's influence.
I thought we were on better terms, Cousin. I ask only for your cooperation, yet still you turn your back...?
I'm disappointed you would spurn me like this, Cousin. Know that I retaliate not out of spite, but by necessity.
You'd choose one of my relatives, instead of me...? Though I myself was first to contact you? Alas, I must respond to you in kind.
Upon Olympus, I'm your closest confidant. You'd best remember this before you spurn me again.
We Olympians, we are a prideful family, Cousin. You cannot simply choose a favorite without spurring one of us to wrath.
I understand you've made your choice, Cousin. And I, in turn, now have my family's reputation to uphold.
If you had given due consideration to this matter, then I doubt you would have chosen this outcome.
No one in our family can avoid taking sides forever, Zagreus. But you can take the more sensible side, at least.
A senseless, punishable choice. But if you wish to face the consequences, so be it.
You could have avoided this outcome any number of ways, yet still you risk incurring my wrath.
Are you testing the limits of my patience with you, Zagreus? Then, I shall test your limits, in turn.
I knew there was a possibility that you would side against me once again, but your doing so never ceases to amaze, Cousin.
If this is your idea of humor, Zagreus, then I shall make it clear to you again that I am unamused.

CHOICE.Athena: I think we understand by now that when you test my patience, I shall test your ability to survive.

CHOICE.Zagreus: I hate to do this, Athena.

text.Athena: Oh, let's continue on, already, Zagreus. There isn't any point in feuding, and there's much to do before your quest is done.
Now then! I hope we can move past this little incident, and keep our focus on the task at hand.
I'm satisfied we understand each other better, now, don't we. What do you say we carry on, and get you from this place?
All is forgiven, Zagreus, and I take no offense. Exacting vengeance is just something we Olympians all do from time to time.
I'd say I've bickered with you quite enough for now, Cousin. Let us continue down a more productive path.
We've better things to do, I think, than fight amongst ourselves over a matter such as this.
I would very much prefer to think we both know better than to let old grudges stew forever, Zagreus.
You see I have my father's temper, Zagreus. I am able to keep it in check, though I expect you to do your part.
Conflict between the members of our family is inevitable, Zagreus. All we can do is learn and grow from it.
I see no benefit to staying angry, Cousin. I promised Nyx that I would help rather than hinder you.
Your father also made some questionable choices, Zagreus. But all of us are family, after all.

text.Zagreus: I'm indebted to you, Goddess, for all that you and your side of the family have done for me.

text.Athena: Well it simply isn't in my nature to allow such offerings to go unanswered, noble Cousin. In turn, I wish for you to have this, with my compliments.

text.Zagreus: For you, Lady Athena, without whom I would assuredly be lost.

text.Athena: This is an unexpected gesture, Cousin! I do appreciate it, though please do not feel obliged. I offer you my friendship, not a loan to be repaid.

text.Zagreus: I have a simple token for you, Goddess. Although it's insufficient thanks for all the aid you've given me.

text.Athena: You are most gracious, Cousin, to extend this offering. You honor me, yet I would ask you think of your well-being for the time, not mine.

text.Zagreus: Goddess Athena, please accept this gift. Your wisdom ever guides me toward the light.

text.Athena: My, how very generous of you, to offer me this gift! I'm very grateful, though I ask that you not go out of your way on my account. Let's please stay focused, here?

text.Zagreus: As I remain committed to my task, Goddess, I'm reminded none of this would have been possible without your aid. And so, I must give thanks, even if through a meager offering.

text.Athena: I know there isn't much that you can do to show your gratitude at present, Zagreus. But I would ask that you save it for when your task is complete. You've more important matters to attend to now!

text.Zagreus: As I remain committed to my task, Goddess, I'm reminded none of this would have been possible without your aid. And so, I must give thanks, even if through a meager offering.

text.Athena: I know there isn't much that you can do to show your gratitude at present, Zagreus. But I would ask that you save it for a better time. You've more important matters to attend to, now!

text.Zagreus: Lady Athena, I know there's more at stake for you in this than just my plight... you care so much about this family. That care and your determination spurs me on. I'm ever grateful.

text.Athena: Perhaps there really is no time quite like the present when it comes to showing thanks to one another, my dear Cousin. You've opened my eyes to the possibility, though I remain steadfast in my resolve to fight for you.

CHOICE.Zagreus: I know this Ambrosia originated on Olympus, Lady Athena. Though through its long voyage to these depths, I trust its savor is more worthy of your grace. No one's ever had a greater cousin. And I'll never forget what you've done for me.

CHOICE.Athena: Zagreus? When Nyx revealed herself to me and I first learned of you, I saw it as an opportunity to bridge the great divide between Olympus and your father's realm. But, having had all these glimpses into who you are, it is an even greater honor to have forged this partnership with you.
You are untouchable for now, Cousin!
Just let them try and stop you!
I ought not help you thus!
You ask me now to aid you, is that so?!
Are you quite serious about this, Zagreus?!
Perhaps next time you shall cooperate with me again.
Wound the pride of an Olympian, and pay the price.
Know that this could have been avoided, Zagreus.
I've come to offer my support.
I commend you for your efforts.

text.Poseidon: Now, little Hades, you have met my brother Zeus! He's sometimes known as king of all the gods! Although, in many ways, he's not as powerful as I! Nor anywhere as dashing. Why, I, oop!

text.Zeus: Now, Brother... you know better than to say such things about me, I should think. I know that tact does not come easily to you, though I'd be careful what you say to our good nephew, there.

text.Poseidon: Buh, erm, anyway, as I was saying, little Hades! Brother Zeus is king of all the gods! And the most dashing, powerful, and hey, let's face it, godliest of all!

As you can see by now, we are a big and clever family, little Hades! My niece Athena here being the cleverest of all. You'd never know that she was childless, the way she looks after and cares for all of us!

text.Athena: Surely my cleverness comes from your brother and yourself, Lord Uncle Poseidon. And I would only add, my feeling is we've more than enough children in this family, thus no further need for more of them, for now.

text.Poseidon: Now, little Hades, you must know by now I've other nephews here, don't you? For instance, Ares comes to mind, the god of war! Some mighty wars have taken place at sea, is that not so?

text.Ares: Indeed, they have, good Uncle Poseidon. Mortals show great ingenuity when war is concerned; it drives their sense of progress, more than anything at all. Perhaps someday they shall wage war even in Father's skies.

text.Poseidon: The thing about me, Nephew, is I get along with everybody, here! A skill apparently that's rather rare! Take my niece Artemis, for instance! Can't ever take a simple jest, at all! You won't easily attract a mate with such a sour look about you, girl!

text.Artemis: Oh, and wouldn't that be such a pity, Uncle Poseidon. I wonder what could be the cause of this sour look that I perpetually have up here? Maybe Zagreus knows.

text.Poseidon: Hahaha! See exactly what I mean, Nephew?
My foster-sister Goddess Demeter, despite her stern approach, she often likes to make good sport of me, Nephew! Why, here she is right now!

text.Demeter: If you're quite finished blathering, Poseidon, our young Zagreus has more important things to do. He needs your blessings, not your point of view. Don't you, young sprout?

text.Poseidon: Ah-haha! I knew that I could count on you, Nephew! So the ungrateful Theseus, the winsome prize he earned was just some chariot, correct? And he was vanquished on it, anyway! That's what he gets! Boasting his prize was greater than any in his mortal days, pah!

Ah-haha-hah, little Hades, I was certain you'd the wherewithal to thin the ranks of the betraying river denizens who fled my surface-seas to your father's domain!! I bid you good fish-hunting forevermore!

text.Zagreus: All right, here goes. In the name of Hades! Olympus! This is an official message! Uncle Poseidon, hope you can make this out.

text.Poseidon: What's this, Nephew? Why, isn't this a note? Or, part of one, addressed to me, but it appears there should be other pieces, for the others here? Ah, it's like a sunken treasure, then! Which means I must seek its mysteries at once!

You know, Nephew, I had a positively raucous time down there, with your old father, and Persephone, was she a sight! I never thought I'd see her again! So then, we're one big happy family, at last! But you've a job to do, and we upon Olympus, we'll do our fair share!
So, Nephew, my honored brother Zeus already has endowed you with his thunderous might? Well you shall soon forget about all that, after a taste of this!
Ahh, you've received a blessing from Athena there already, little Hades! So careful all the time, that one, but here, I'll help you live a little, just in case!
Oh-hoh, so you've already heard from Aphrodite, have you, Nephew? Understandable, but first things first, now let me add a little something to all that!
Hoy, Nephew! It's my understanding you've been blessed already by one of my other nephews, Ares! As you can see, not all of us are cut from the same cloth; and thank the Fates for that!
I sense that you've been marked by the elusive Artemis, correct, Nephew? She shies away from most of us, so if she's taken somewhat of a liking to you, great!
Whenever Dionysus calls a feast, I'm turning up sooner or later, hear me, Nephew? So make room for one more blessing, and, let's go!
Little Hades, it appears that you are moving right along! Almost at an uncanny pace!! I wonder how you got to be so fast! Aquatic exercise?!
Nephew, how is it you're navigating your cruel father's realm at such a blinding speed?! There's only one Olympian who moves that quick! Besides myself! Where is he, anyway?

Why, little Hades, there's a certain chill about you, meaning you received an ice-cold blessing courtesy of Elder Goddess Demeter, correct? Now, personally, I think water's best in liquid form, but who am I to judge?
You've come to know your Uncle Zeus, by now, correct? Just want to let you know, good Zeus gets very busy on the regular, so you just stick with me, I've always time for you, Nephew!
Nephew, your cruel father, Hades, he's my elder brother, you know that? Not exactly the expressive type, and never was. We seldomly saw eye-to-eye on things!
I daresay, little Hades, you've some spunk in you! Why, I think you take after me more than my crusty elder brother! You'll get away from that old codger yet!
My crusty elder brother Hades must have tried to poison you against us lot! I can imagine it as clear as water, Nephew! I'm proud that you've resisted his undoubtedly most-twisted words!
Last time your father and I spoke, he told me I was all washed up, can you believe the nerve of it, Nephew? Why, he took the words right out of my mouth!
It's likely, little Hades, that you currently reside just underneath one of my boundless seas! Normally you'd have to be submerged to use this power, but you know what, close enough!
You know I've many vitally important things to do besides lending my aid to you repeatedly, Nephew? But, all of that can wait! Family comes first!

If you should ever make it here, Nephew, know this! I shall be pleased to stand in for the father figure I can tell you never really had. We can engage in all sorts of aquatic competitions, solve riddles, visit the sea-nymphs! Oh, it would be great, wouldn't you think?
Nephew, why, the seas up here, they're just about as widely feared as your vast Underworld down there! For water can be deadlier than bronze!
My oceans, they are filled with danger, not just water, little Hades! Many of the dead you face, they met their mortal end at sea, and not on land!
Ahh, it seems to me you've had yourself a spot of lady trouble, lately, isn't that correct, Nephew? I mean the Fury down in Tartarus, of course! You going to let her keep on bossing you around?!
Hah! I heard you showed that good-for-nothing Fury after all, I knew you'd handle that old crone, Nephew! And if she troubles you again, you just remind her who's in charge down there!
Good tidings, Nephew! I've learned that you have managed to get all the way to Asphodel, fine work! Now, you just keep on going!

Ohh, Nephew, you've stood against the Bull of Minos, have you? Well I must apologize for any inconvenience there, because, he was a living testament to my revenge! Long story, boring really, rather sordid, too. Stay strong!
Word reaches us that you've come very far, indeed, Nephew! Striking distance from the surface! You just keep at it like that, and with our help, we'll have you out of there for sure!

I wonder what monstrosities await you near the surface, little Hades? There's your father's terrifying hell-hound, for one thing! Ah, well, I'm sure you'll find a way to sail past whatever's in your way!
Now don't lose heart, Nephew! Because in spite of all your efforts, it is probably the case that you still have a long and painful road ahead!
Ah, I thought for certain you were well on your way out of there last time, Nephew! But, no matter, we'll just get you on another voyage to the top!
Little Nephew, why, I could have sworn you made it to the surface recently, and yet, you're all the way back there, again? Must be some sort of terrible monstrosity preventing your way out!

I'll tell you, Nephew, I was quite taken aback to learn Persephone, she was your mother all along! Just disappeared up here, one day! Ran off, I figured, as she's got some mortal blood in her. But she was with your father! That rascal is my brother, after all!

So how is crusty old Hades faring down there of late, Nephew? Fewer worries there upon his brow? That Underworld of yours all running smoothly, and all that? We'll keep on pitching in from over here. Least we can do!

Persephone, she says you're really stuck down there, born of the Underworld, something like that? Well, if you ask me, that's no kind of attitude to have! You can do anything you set your mind to, Nephew! Take it from me!

If you do ever get the opportunity to spend some time up here, Nephew, know I shall take you on a grand tour of the surface! From the depths of my seas to the height of Olympus! Sure, maybe not today, or tomorrow, or even the next aeon! But sometime, we should go!

Been nice to see my brothers getting on again, just like old times! Well, not exactly like old times, and come to think of it, there always was a bit of tension there between those two, but still! It's better than before!
Your good mother Persephone, she's here all safe and sound, thought you should know, there, little Hades! Shame you can't be here with her, too, but ah! Doubtless we'll someday meet again!
Ah-hah! I sense you have in your possession that fine shell I sent to you, a little gift plucked straight out of the sea! You keep it close so I can better track you down!

My, my, little Hades, you brandish Exagryph, the Rail of Adamant! That weapon's power was so terrifying that we sealed it away. Oh well! Surely its mortal-damning secrets shall be safely guarded in your hands!
Huh! Why, if my eyes do not deceive me through those murky depths, you brandish Malphon! Let me tell you, little Hades, those old gloves have done some dirty work before your time!
