Why, little Hades, it is awful murky where you are, but if I'm not mistaken, and I never am, you wield fearsome Stygius! She once belonged to me, you know! Not quite my type, but we sure had our times! You take good care of her for me!
Say, is it me, or do you bear your father's ancient spear, Nephew? I always wanted one a bit like that. And now I have one even better. Hah!
This time, Nephew, let's really show your father what you're made of: Water! For the most part! Mortals, at least, are mostly made of it. Bet you did not know that!
The mortals like to give me thanks for all my generosity, Nephew! But little do they know, I have been saving up a bunch of it for you!

Say, word has reached me that you squared against one known as Theseus, now champion there in Elysium? He was a handful even when he lived! So much so that my honored brother Zeus, he took to calling him my son, can you believe the nerve?

So, little Hades, doubtless you have seen that we upon Olympus also lend our favor to the mighty Theseus, who bars your passage from Elysium! Now, don't you take it personally, there, because our blessings go to all who deserve them. Although, we try to save the best for you!

That scoundrel Theseus! Apparently he earned himself some sort of winsome prize, for all his blustering there in Elysium! Though, I'm quite certain that, no matter what he and his bull friend have at their disposal, you've the power to defeat them, utterly! So go do it, surely I'll get word!

Why, Nephew, you've procured the Rod of Fishing, I detect! Fine handiwork if I say so myself! Its line is nigh-invisible and causes denizens of my domain to flock to it like mortals to temples of mine! Good fortune with that thing!
I'm told a number of the underwater denizens from my domain were captured fair-and-square through your surpassing skill using the Rod of Fishing, little Hades!! They're yours, I've millions more!

All these river denizens you've caught, little Hades... it can only mean we share a deep connection, don't you think? I, with my power over the entire vastness of the seas! And you, with the power to ensnare a hapless fish with but a flick of the wrist!

Say, what exactly is that very mighty-looking spear I think I faintly see in your possession there, it's... why, I've not seen a thing like that except on very distant shores! It's almost as impressive as my trident here! Almost, I say!

You bear some sort of splendid-looking weapon, there, Nephew! Must be another aspect of fair Stygius, my old discarded blade! Never did see that one myself, but, I saw many others that were splendid, too!
Hoh, you look positively in atrocious shape, there, Nephew! What's the matter, one too many run-ins with the wretched dead before I intervened?
Seems to me that you're in dire straits, there, little Hades! Why, you're bleeding everywhere! Here, let me try and do something for that.
Ah, what happened to you, little Hades?! I can tell even from here that you've been beaten like a skiff during a storm!
Now, don't go dying on me, yet, Nephew! You have to live! Or else the Boon I offer you shall go to waste!
Your hated enemies, they almost got the best of you, I fear! But you can still turn it around, especially now that you have my aid!
Ohh, have I got something for you this time, little Hades! Something special I have saved for when you really proved yourself!
There's nothing stronger than the sea, Nephew, neither above it nor below!! And, if you are in need of further proof, behold: The greatest of my blessings, just for you!

text.Zagreus: It's uncle number two, it's got to be. Then, in the name of Hades! Olympus, I accept this message.

text.Poseidon: Hoy there, little Hades! You recognize your uncle, do you not? We've a lot of catching up to do, but first things first, you get yourself out of that dour Underworld! As for me, I'll see if I can stir things up a bit to cover your advance!
Hoy, Nephew, it's excellent to see you once again, and in good spirits, still? Then, come, let's make some waves!
Ahoy, little Hades, it is I! The greatest of your uncles! Here to aid you in your daringest escape attempt! And I do admire your persistence!
Good tidings once again, there, little Nephew!! It is I, returned as ever here to make a splash against your many, many foolish enemies!
Ahoy, Nephew! I bet you have your hands full dealing with your enemies down there, so let me see what I can do. And I can do a lot!
It seems you're getting somewhere, little Nephew! Good, but here, allow your favorite Uncle to bestow a little boost!
Ah, hahaha! Found you down there, Nephew! Now let's overwhelm your enemies in a typhoon of godly might, what do you say?
Little Hades, have I ever told you I detest the dead? Well, I admit it, I just cannot stand a mortal past his due. So how about we get you far away from all such filth, agreed?
What do you say, there, Nephew, ready to get wet, or no? Oh I suspect you are, so let's get to it, and dispense some liquid justice!
How fares your feud against my crusty elder brother lately, good? Big Hades, he is disagreeable with all of us, not just with you, so, don't you take it personal, and stick with me!
Looks like you could use the power of the sea, wouldn't you say so, little Hades? Good thing I'm here, so that together, we might wash your enemies away!
Enough kidding around without me, Nephew! I am here, so let's go bust you out, much like a raging river through a frail little dam!
You're looking somewhat stronger than before, there, little Nephew, but you're much too scrawny still, to be quite blunt. So, here! Let's fatten you right up!
Hoy, my nephew! I think I have kept you waiting long enough, so then, let's go! And break our enemies to pieces, like so many ships upon the shoals!
I'll have you know, the power of the seas themselves is yours once more, Nephew! So how about you put it to its rightful purpose, and go smash some stuff!
Are you perchance in need of godlike aid, Nephew? Well, excellent! Because I happen to command the sea, and I shall hereby let you take it for a whirl!
Who dares to mess with little Hades? You simply point me at them, Nephew, and we'll leave them shivering and sopping wet, you'll see!
At last I found you once again, Nephew! You eating well and getting strong, correct? I'll help you with the latter category in a moment. Here!
The awesome bounty of the sea is yours to do with as you please, Nephew! I've mustered forth a sample, anyway!
Hoh, little Hades! I'd heard you were preparing to rain terrible destruction on your enemies! So I got here as quickly as I could! I'm not too late, am I?
All of us must sail through troubled waters now and then, correct, Nephew? Fortunately, navigation is my speciality, so let's be on our way!
Your victory's most certainly at hand now that I'm here, Nephew! So long as you make sure to take advantage of the absolutely awesome power I bequeath!
Why, if it isn't the most favored of my nephews, stuck as ever though you may yet be! We'll get you from there, little Hades, don't despair, Uncle Poseidon's here!!
Good tidings, my most favored nephew! All is relatively well, I hope? But hope alone is worthless without action, is it not? So here, let's act together!

Just wait until you see the seas, Nephew! My underwater realm is the most glorious of the world's habitats. It positively teems with life, and it's much cooler there than in that sweaty Underworld of yours!
Well, Nephew, supposing it's high time for the high seas to lend their might once more?
Your uncle's offering to shake things up once more, what say you, little Hades?
No more dallying about, now, little Nephew! Time instead we really got somewhere!
Good tidings, little Hades! It is I! And I am always here to help!
Fear not, Nephew, it is I, your uncle! Come to wash away your troubles, here and now!
Just point me toward your enemies, Nephew, and they'll become sworn enemies of mine!
Let's get you out from underneath the sea, there, little Nephew!
Ahoy, my godly Nephew, I've arrived, so set aside your worries and let's drench the dead!
How about we set you up here with some real water-power, little Hades?
I take it you could use some liquid courage at this time, no, little Hades?
How about a swim, there, little Hades? A swim, that is, within the Pool of Blessings! Now, dive in!
I'm here, Nephew, to aid you in your time of need, with this!
I heard that you could use the awesome power of the sea, Nephew!
Go on and make a splash for me, why don't you, little Hades!
The treasures of the sea are limitless, so here! You take your pick!
What do you say we make some waves, right, little Hades?
Don't let the wretched dead dampen your spirits, little Hades! Dampen theirs!
Here comes another cool, refreshing blessing for you, Nephew!
Water can even cut through solid stone, with enough time! So you keep at it, there!
I know that you can do it, little Hades! Whatever it may be!
It's darker than the bottom of the sea in there! Are you alive, Nephew?!
The secrets of the sea can all be yours! Eventually at least, I have just three for now!
You still alive down there, Nephew? Because if so, why, this ought to keep it that way!
Must get so stuffy in that dreary place, Nephew! So why don't you cool off a bit, with this!
You have a dirty job down there, Nephew, but I can help you to clean up a bit!
All that I ask, here, little Nephew, is for you to do your best! As I would do!
Ahoy, and now prepare yourself! For I've a rare treat here, especially for you!
I am ever impressed with your will to succeed, Nephew, so here! Great blessings be with you!
You've earned only the very finest of my blessings, little Hades! Why? Why not!
If you are ever going to get out of there, only the mightiest of all my blessings will suffice!
My favorite Nephew ought have access to my greatest blessings, should he not?
Ah-hah! You found me, little Nephew! Strewn among the inventories of that most disturbing river-boatman! That means you win my blessing!
Well, well, my plan to get ahold of you via the boatman worked out flawlessly! Harness the might of the sea, then, why don't you?
Well, Nephew, I know that salty Charon can be difficult. But I am certain that whatever price you paid, you got a deal!
Nothing comes freely for the mortals on the surface, Nephew! And from the sound of things, it isn't any different with that Charon character!
Let me just say, Nephew, that money-hoarding boatman best be fair with you! Because I'd hate to see anything happen to that little boat of his!
Whaaaa, you think that you've a chance in hell without my help, am I to understand?! You made a big mistake there, little Hades, just you watch.
How bold of you to throw your lot in with my relatives instead of me, given the choice, there, little Hades. But don't you ever bet against this horse!
Oh, now, it seems to me your strength outweighs your smarts, there, Nephew, if you're prone to picking other sides than mine!
A word of caution, little Nephew: Never turn your back against the sea. And, while you're at it, never take up sides against your greatest uncle!
Augh! I'm absolutely flabbergasted, Nephew!! I offer you the finest blessings of the earth and sea, and they're not good enough?
Apparently my crusty elder brother failed to teach you any manners, if you deign to thusly spurn my offerings! But I can teach you yet!
Betrayal, little Hades!! Of all my nephews, you should know better than this! Or perhaps I should. One of us, at least!
That's definitely not the choice I would have made, Nephew! Because, for me to side against myself, why, that would make no sense at all!
Nephew, what you have just done is tantamount to spitting in my face! Let me remind you, then, the ocean can spit back!
You wound me, little Hades, with your callous choice! It's fortunate I'm quite impervious to harm. But I don't think the same is true for you!
You know the saying not to play with fire, don't you, Nephew? You'll find the same is very much the case with water, too!
Again, you would defy me, little Hades? I'm beginning to see why your father might be very frustrated, indeed, having to deal with you!
It seems that you require yet one more gentle reminder not to scoff at chances to accept my blessings, little Hades! Now remember this!
Sometimes I think, surely my nephew takes to heart my strongly worded threats about my distaste for his little acts of treachery, but no!

CHOICE.Poseidon: I could have sworn I told you never to take the power of the sea for granted, little Hades? It seems the time for words is over, then!

text.Poseidon: Oh, very well then, little Hades! Uncle's going to let you off the hook this time. Just mind your manners next we meet!
I must hand it to you, little Hades! I did not expect that you would weather such a storm! I'm mightily impressed!
Ah, I can't stay angry! Let us call all that unpleasantness back there water under the bridge, what say you, Nephew?
My, a show of strength like that deserves a commendation I should think! Although, for next time, know my favor's not a thing to trifle with!
All right, that's quite enough, I take it you have had about enough of that, correct? You're pretty good! So here, why don't you run along!
Oh, hoh-hoh, you've got some fire in you, don't you, little Hades? Here! I've just the thing to cool you down, fresh from my own domain!
Ah-haha, my fits of anger come and go just like the tides, Nephew! Now take this from me, and get out of here!
Now that was truly finely fought, indeed, Nephew! And I've a suitable reward here, just for you! Don't even know what I was mad about!
What can I say, Nephew? Sometimes our tempers get the best of all of us. You're fortunate mine didn't get the best of you back there!
You weathered the storm, there, little Hades, and the sea is once again at peace. And you'll make every attempt to keep it that way, correct?
All right, no need to fight about this any longer, don't you think, Nephew? Here, take my blessing, like you should have in the first place!
Now let's not set a bad example for the family, Nephew! We're better than all that. Besides! They've many bad examples as it is.

text.Zagreus: Uncle Poseidon, it's been excellent to know you, sir, so, please, this is for you.

text.Poseidon: Oh I am positively moved by your affection, little Nephew! Though, I think I have just the thing for you, in turn! Here, I shall transfer it to you!!

text.Zagreus: Uncle Poseidon, this here is for you. Would that my father were as easygoing as yourself.

text.Poseidon: Ah-hah! A show of generosity from my most favored nephew! Your gift is mightily appreciated!! I'll just go ahead and add it to the pile.

text.Zagreus: Mighty Poseidon, greatest of my uncles, arguably, please accept this gift!

text.Poseidon: For all the times I'm offered gifts or sacrifices, little Nephew, I still always very much appreciate it! I mean, look! I'm grinning ear to ear!

text.Zagreus: Uncle Poseidon, I have a special catch for you! Although it pales next to your sheer awesomeness.

text.Poseidon: Whaaa, now would you look at that! Is that an offering to your most favored uncle, me? You know what, Nephew? I've decided I shall take it! Thanks!!

text.Zagreus: I salute you, Uncle Poseidon! Your strength and confidence inspire me, and you accepted me as part of the family without question. It means a lot.

text.Poseidon: Ahh, Nephew, but you needn't shower me with offerings and praise, you know! Why, I've no need of showering at all! Not when I've the sea itself, to do with as I please!

text.Zagreus: Whenever I encounter you, Uncle Poseidon, my spirits lift, and I feel there must not be anything that can stop me. I only wish we met sooner, though I'm grateful to have met you at all.

text.Poseidon: I thought I told you, Nephew, not to make such offerings to me? Ah, probably forgot! Or getting you mixed up, perhaps, for I have many other nephews, thanks to Zeus! Though, between us, I don't like any one of them as much as you!

CHOICE.Zagreus: Uncle Poseidon, sometimes I wonder what my life would have been like had you been a part of it sooner. Your encouragement, your enthusiasm... it means a lot. To you! This Ambrosia's been to hell and back!

CHOICE.Poseidon: Hohhh, but isn't this a kingly offering, indeed, my little Hades! I know how difficult it must have been to get, so distant from Olympus as you are! I'll never understand how come your father's cruel to you, for if you were my son, I would be proud! Proud anyway, but you get the idea.
You can do this, little Hades!!
It's time to make a splash!
My tolerance has limits, little Hades.
Who do you think you are!
You cannot treat your uncle like THIS!
You call for my aid, now?!
Oh, now you want my help?!

CHOICE.Zagreus: You drive a hard bargain, Uncle.

CHOICE.Poseidon: I warn you not to trifle with me, Nephew!
Oh you shouldn't have done that.
Next time, Nephew, best not be such a fool!
You disrespect the sea, and it is liable to swallow you!
Do not forget yourself with me next time, Nephew!
Ahoy, my nephew, it is I!
Think you're going to like this!

CHOICE.Zagreus: Wait... Persephone... Mother... is Demeter's daughter?
Winter... that's when it's cold, or something, right?
Wait... Persephone... Mother... is Demeter's daughter?

text.Demeter: Well, now, young sprout, you've met the so-called King of the Olympians, and I. Whom do you now suppose is genuinely ruler of this snow-encrusted mountaintop of ours?

text.Zeus: Oh, hah-hah-hah, Lady Demeter! Your wit is just as dry as the earth lying quite fallow in your care! Perhaps you should go tend to that again, though let's we go ahead and help our young man first!

text.Demeter: Ah, little sprout. I was just notifying Lord Poseidon here that all of his domain exists because it pleases me; remember, my good foster-brother, I could freeze your oceans solid if I chose.

text.Poseidon: Ah, hahahah! Excellently stated, venerable Goddess Demeter! I'm reminded once more of your vast experience, though, I think we all prefer our oceans liquidy, isn't that right, Nephew?!

text.Demeter: To think, young sprout, our strategist Athena, warrior-goddess, sprang from Zeus' head! I would expect that no high intellect could come from there.

text.Athena: Please do not mind the Lady Demeter's good-natured sense of humor, Zagreus. She and my father often like to jest with one another, even in the most difficult times.

text.Demeter: Young Zagreus, once you arrive, do tell Lord Ares here that his great power's not worth anything without my own. Wars have their causes, among which, many I control.

text.Ares: I do not question that your influence can stir a mortal's impulses toward war, O Goddess Demeter. At least we can agree that our domains are quite compatible!

text.Demeter: Remember something for us, Zagreus. A frozen heart holds no sway over anyone at all. Isn't that right, oh Aphrodite, dear?

text.Aphrodite: Oh, I don't know, my dearest Demeter! The frozen heart has tendency to thaw, and then begin to beat with renewed vigor after that. I trust your time shall come! It can never be too late, except for mortals, the poor things.

text.Demeter: Why, Zagreus, my gentle Artemis here was just saying how concerned she was for your predicament! I'm sure she'd like it if we both could help you in this case.

text.Artemis: Concerned? I don't see anyone concerned, you have this, Zagreus! You don't need anybody's help, and you can get through this all on your own, though just in case, and I mean just in case! Um, here.

text.Demeter: The crops shall wither and decay so long as I may please, young Zagreus. Although we do have those upon Olympus who take issue with my reasoning...

text.Dionysus: Erm, yeah, milady, I take issue here! I mean how are the grapes supposed to grow and wine supposed to flow when you are so uptight, now, just ease up a little there, let's see what we can do!

text.Demeter: I see the noble King of the Olympians has reached you prior to me, Zagreus. I wonder which of all his many lies he's told you last.

My foster-brother's wayward son appears! I, too, once lost a child, Zagreus. I was quite foolish with her from the start. Her father was a baseborn farm-boy; worshiped me! He's gone as well, of course. Only the cold remains.

My daughter to a baseborn farm-boy, she... why, little sprout, I wasn't very kind to her, I think. Certainly not once her father passed. It was her mortal blood that made her weak! Born to mortals, taken by mortals, I suspect. So now, they pay.

I don't suppose... no, it is nothing, little sprout, it's just... I hear such wicked rumors now and then, about my daughter, lost to me, and what became of her. Kore, we called her, then. Persephone is what she called herself. Before she vanished utterly, leaving no trace....
After my daughter Kore disappeared, I left this mountaintop. Wandered the earth, in search. For naught, of course. It was a necessary journey, I suppose. May yours fare better.

text.Zagreus: Hope Mother knows what she's doing, in the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Lady Demeter, this is for you.

text.Demeter: What's all of this, young Zagreus, a message of some sort, for me, indeed? I... can't decipher it, although... it bears the marks of my two foster-brothers here, and... well! It seems we'd better compare notes!

Why, little sprout, young Zagreus... my grandson! I can scarce believe it, still! To think that, Kore, or... Persephone, my daughter... she had been with Foster-Brother Hades, all this time! A match I wouldn't have expected... or approved. That's why she left! Our blasted hearts do what they want.

My little grandson, little sprout, I've thought... if my Persephone's alive, why then... this winter, hasn't it endured for long enough...? It's grown to have a certain stubbornness, but I... I am the goddess of the seasons, Zagreus. Perhaps it's time I changed them once again.

I've lifted the cold from the earth, much as I said I would, grandson. But, near your father's realm... I have decided it shall stay the way it is. Bereft of warmth. As a reminder to us all, about all this.
You bear the blessing of Poseidon, Zagreus? Someday I shall remind him of his place, and freeze his watery domain entirely.
Athena has imparted you her wisdom, Zagreus? A simulacrum of the real thing, at any rate. True wisdom only comes with age, I think.
All of the love and beauty in the world can wither in a season, Zagreus. Remember that when next the goddess Aphrodite makes her promises.
Lord Ares already got hold of you, has he? He's good at making mortals kill each other, yes. But he has utterly no knack for subtlety.
The gentle Artemis already found you, Zagreus? She takes my orders well; one cannot blame her, for she'd have nothing to hunt if not for me.
You stumbled into Dionysus, Zagreus? One of these days I shall prevent his vineyards all from ripening; put to the test his carefree attitude.
The mark of Chaos is upon you, isn't it? A force older than I! Yet one which you ought not trust so readily. No rhyme or reason to that one at all.
Is that the bloodlike stain of pomegranate on you, Zagreus? A hardy fruit resistant to a winter's chill. How fascinating they survive, down there.
I don't often divulge such blessings as I am about to, Zagreus. Don't thank me for it, but make certain that you use my power well.
I have affection for you, little sprout. No need for reciprocity, but now I'll offer you the fiercest of my capabilities.
I must admit I have grown fond of you, young sprout; nevertheless, I shall not spoil you like some ill-mannered child.
My, but you're as determined as my foster-brothers were, when my sisters and I stood with them 'gainst the Titans way back when.

Our family, why, I think we understand something of loss, now, don't we, Zagreus? Unlike the mortals on the surface. Always begging me for plenty. They'll get none. But as for you, I have a plethora to offer!
You are entirely too young to have had meaningful experience with loss, young Zagreus. Pray to me that you never have to learn.
You live within the bosom of the earth, and know its warmth. But there is no such warmth up here, young Zagreus. You truly wish to feel the bitter cold of the outside? Then, here.
Someday, you'll gain the surface, Zagreus; and you shall see firsthand what mortalkind has wrought. You'll find it has some commonality with your domain.

Motherhood's a curse, young Zagreus. Be thankful you're immune. You sprang from Nyx herself, or so I hear? I sprang from Theia, whoever she was. And I once bore a child, too. Long gone. A mother's work... isn't it such a waste?
Your father Hades and I share a common fate, each having lost a child fully grown; except that he's a hollow fool, whose child left! Whereas my daughter never would have. Ever!
Your father always had a sternness to him that his brothers lacked. Thought him a decent sort, comparatively anyway; though evidently he is no such thing.

Should you achieve your goal, and see this surface-world, Zagreus, I've but one bit of knowledge to impart: Don't ever fall for mortals. Use them if you must, but do not waste your love on those who waste away.

I have a brother, Helios, the Sun. A nonsense-talker with a flaming chariot. Why, he once told me that my Kore, that she went into that Underworld of yours! Preposterous. The clouds now blot him out entirely.

This land is not unlike your own in certain ways. For, Helios the Sun has not shone down upon it for some time. How long, I really couldn't tell you, little sprout! Long enough for mortals to take notice, certainly.

My sisters Hestia and Hera surely would assist as well, young sprout. Except they and our foster-brothers haven't been getting along of late. Though as for me? I'll never leave this mountaintop of mine.

We all are willful children, are we not? I'm daughter to Hyperion, you know; a Titan so obscure and hated that Lord Zeus, he started calling me his birth-sister, so much did he dislike this bit of truth! And to get a rise out of me, too.

As seasons give to one another, so do generations, I suppose. Hyperion, my father? He'd not a one redeeming quality. My sisters and my foster-brothers and myself; this world owes us a debt for ridding it of him and his kind.
I ought to warn you that my foster-brother Zeus, he has just a disgusting sense of humor, little sprout. He'd have you think he sired half the countryside! I have to shudder at the very thought.

There's so much nonsense that the mortals say to one another of our family, Zagreus. How viciously the rumors spread! Whether from that oaf, Zeus, or likely from the mortal drunkard-poets with no better use of their limited time!
I warn you, Zagreus, best not to make attempts to grow much closer with me, thus. I'm much your elder, after all, and you're my little sprout. What say we keep it that way, hm?
I... I am so very moved, I... have a daughter once again. And... I've a grandson, too! I thought, I felt something when first I met you, but... I brushed it off. Just like a fleck of snow...
Someday, my little sprout, you'll gain the surface of your father's realm, and see my handiwork. Until such time, I'll come to your aid as I can. It's quite the entertaining pastime, honestly!

By the way, we had entirely a lovely time within your father's house, Grandson. And, to see Kore once again, it... warmed my heart. I'm beyond grateful that your mother's safe. And that you've an important job to do. Here, I shall help.

I meant to tell you something, Grandson... you needn't have deceived the rest of us. You could have sent word that my daughter was with you down there, all along! Ah, but families are a complicated thing. Just swear that you'll be candid with us, next time.

You must visit us sometime up here, Grandson! I understand the surface hasn't been agreeable with you... though perhaps if not in this age, then the next, we shall have you over. It's brisk up here... but nice enough, I think.

Young sprout, I cannot fully understand my daughter's choices, such as what she saw in your gloom-filled father to have eloped with him. But if you are the result, then she is clearly wiser than I estimated.

I made mistakes raising your mother, sprout. When she was my Kore. I was blind to the possibility that she could have left me, but... I see it now. If you become a parent yourself, someday... may you listen more than I.
You tell my Kore... erm, Persephone, that is... the Queen! You tell her that her mother sends her warm regards. You tell her that. And you take care of her.

Grandson, my daughter Queen Persephone, she sent me the most precious message, courtesy of Hermes, as of late. I'm pleased to hear that you are getting on all right. Though, I know you're at work, so here!
The Frostbitten Horn which you bear once overflowed. It holds a certain power still, of course. But never again shall mortalkind take it for granted.
The heat has risen quite considerably there, is that not so? Then if my foster-brother's tampered with the temperature, I'll have to cool things off.
The heat of your surroundings must be difficult to bear, my little sprout. It's fortunate I've just the thing for that.
That chill sensation I detect must indicate that you are near the surface, Zagreus. If you can overcome the final challenges ahead, you soon shall see the long winter yourself.
That's Sister Hera's Heart-Seeker you have! The very weapon which she used to put our predecessors down. It hasn't lost its potency I see. Fear not, I shall not mention this to her, if I see her.

Why, isn't that there Sister Hestia's oddly constructed armament you bear? She always was so predisposed to flame; I thought she'd never give it up! If it's to be in any hands, then may as well be yours.

I scarcely can see... are those the Twin Fists that you bear, young sprout? I once made ample use of them myself, if you'll imagine it. Wielding the cold since has been adequate for me, but you? May you put them to work as I once did.
Why, you've the look of one who has endured a terribly long winter, Zagreus! I trust you'll cling to life a little longer, now.
I sense your grip on life is coming loose, young Zagreus. Now turn that cold you feel against your enemies.
You seem to be in dire need of some assistance, Zagreus. I think perhaps I have a bit to spare.
You're in the winter of your current stretch of life, aren't you, Zagreus? Do try and live a little longer for me, hm?
You waste away just like a common mortal, Zagreus. How rather unbecoming of a god.
The flame of life is easily extinguished by the cold, young Zagreus. Surely you feel the warmth within you giving way?
Cold comfort for your terrible predicament, young Zagreus, but I am here.

text.Zagreus: Last time I felt a chill like this was... on the surface, but, who...? Well, one way to find out. Then, in the name of Hades! Olympus, I accept this message!

text.Demeter: I understand, young Zagreus, that you would seek to leave that bitter darkness for this bitter cold? Quite honestly I fail to see why. But I'll aid your plight, why not? For I can offer plenty of assistance, and you soon shall grow fond of it, I think.
I once had plentitudes of blessings I would offer readily, young Zagreus; but I am feeling not as generous of late.
Did you detect perhaps a certain spirit-shaking chill within the air, young Zagreus?
Plenty of blessings left to go around; although, only for you, young Zagreus.
Your enemies shall have no shelter from the cold whilst I am at your side, young Zagreus.
There's something to the barrenness, where you reside; perhaps someday it shall be more like that up here.
Your realm there is much like the wind-swept surface here. Mostly devoid of life, such as it's been of late.
Olympus must seem like a distant paradise to you, young Zagreus; it is a frozen waste to me. But still, it's home.
Your foes shall more than catch cold by the time we're through, don't you agree, young sprout?
All those who stand opposed to you, why, we shall shatter more than their resolve, I think, young Zagreus.
One of these seasons I suppose I ought to double-check the mortals haven't gone extinct without my intervention at each step.
None can endure an everlasting winter's chill, young Zagreus; not even your father's lifeless servants there beneath the earth.
The seasons have a certain beauty to them, I suppose. Though struggle onward, and you needn't take my word for it.
I've known your father and his brothers here for many seasons now; they bicker endlessly with me and one another.
I have to tell you something, little sprout. I take cold comfort knowing that my foster-brother Hades is no better at his parenting than I.
I'd gladly scour all your father's realm if doing so would free you from his clutches, Zagreus.
I'll have you know something, young Zagreus: The bitter cold and frost is just as inescapable as death itself.
The seasons turn relentlessly, without regard, and thusly should you doggedly push forward on your path.
I shall bring desolation upon those who wrong you, little sprout.
I hope that you're aware how seldomly I give my blessing as of late, young Zagreus.
There's no escaping from the bitter cold, you know.
Your adversaries soon shall know something of loss, I think.
Let us see to it your foes are left with nothing.
There shall be only souls for harvesting this day, I think, young Zagreus.
My warm regards, and all my blessings to you, little sprout.
The bitterness of cold and death go hand in hand, I do suppose.
When all is taken away, the cold yet remains, young Zagreus.
I am not feeling quite so generous of late, young Zagreus, but nevertheless: Choose.
Your lifeless foes must foolishly believe they've nothing left to lose.
Go with my blessings, Zagreus; though you may take but one.
Decay is the inevitable state of things; we are merely helping it along.
The cold of Mount Olympus shall bring utter ruin on your enemies.
Death and cold, they are irrevocably bound together, Zagreus.
The climate in those depths needs cooling, then, I take it, Zagreus?
You bring with you the season of decay, young Zagreus.
Your foes shall all wither before you like unwatered crops.
The frost eventually shall cover everything, young Zagreus.
You'll find that life gives way quite easily to cold, young sprout.
Look carefully upon my blessings, Zagreus, and take no more than one.
I trust that harvesting dead souls is not unlike the harvest we have on the surface, Zagreus.
You're like a little flame there in your father's realm; easy enough to spot.
It seems to me your foes are ripe for harvesting, young Zagreus.
Any who stand against you soon shall wither from the cold, young sprout.
I seldom feel too generous of late, and yet for you, young Zagreus? Why not.
I once offered the mortals generosities as this in much more copious supply.
It soon shall be exceptionally cold down in the Underworld, I think.
I'd never give out blessings such as this to merely anyone, I hope you know.
I've quite the harvest here from which to choose, my little sprout.
Soon, the season there shall turn exceptionally cold, young Zagreus.
It is particularly cold outside, today; and soon it shall be so in there for you.
Well, my little sprout, we shall have to get you through this winter's cold.
A crisp and pleasant winter's evening to you, Zagreus; now, here.
My finest winter blessings to you, little sprout.
Well, Grandson, it's growing rather cold, don't you agree?
I'm here to ease some of your burdens, my young sprout. That's what we grandmothers are for.
I trust you're keeping yourself warm enough in all of this, Grandson?
When all this is over, please do come and visit us sometime, Grandson.
I'd tell you not to work too hard, Grandson, although your family is in need of more hard-working sorts.
Foul weather's on the forecast for your foes, Grandson.
Don't let my foster-brother bully you about, you hear, Grandson?
Let's cool down that hot head of yours a bit, why don't we, Grandson?
My best regards to Queen Persephone and your lord father, little sprout. You keep it up.
I trust your mother Queen Persephone is faring well if she has as fine a son as you, young Zagreus.
Your mother sends you all her love from Mount Olympus, Grandson.
All the best from Queen Persephone, young sprout. She misses you, you know.
Persephone is doing well here on Olympus, Zagreus. You ought to visit, too, sometime.
Be thankful that the rivers to your realm have not yet frozen over, Zagreus.
I trust your ferry-boatman Charon has no qualms about the freezing temperatures up here?
My message comes to you by river-boat this time, young Zagreus. At least that Charon is amenable to our attempts to contact you.
My blessing's seldom given and ought not be so readily refused, young Zagreus.
I am accustomed to such disrespect from all those blasted mortals, Zagreus, but you?
If you are so disinterested in my generosity, young Zagreus, then you shall have my wrath.
I don't recall if I yet warned against this type of attitude, although it doesn't matter either way.
Do you believe I give my blessings liberally, Zagreus? Well then I've news for you.
Offend me, and I'll drain the last traces of color from those cheeks of yours.
That was an ill-advised decision, Zagreus. I'm past quickly forgiving such mistakes.
You truly think you can withstand the ravages of winter, Zagreus? That I would like to see.
A harsh winter is coming for you, Zagreus. And I'm afraid you've brought it on yourself.
For that decision, Zagreus, it is about to be a very cold day down there in your Underworld.

CHOICE.Demeter: A careless choice you've made, there, Zagreus. As you grow long in years, perhaps you shall learn better judgment as to whom to trust, and whom to never, ever disrespect.

text.Demeter: Perhaps you'll exercise more wisdom in such interactions moving forward, hm?
It ultimately isn't my intent to leave you in the cold like this, young Zagreus.
The freezing cold ought to have drained the life from you; but I've allowed it to relent, for now.
Next time, young Zagreus, perhaps I'll take every last bit of warmth you've left down there.
I am the eldest of Olympus, Zagreus. And I expect for you to treat me suitably.
The harsh of winter's gone for now, young Zagreus; and so take heart, but also you take heed.
So you survived a little winter's chill, didn't you, there? Be careful, though; next season could be worse.
Remember, next time, Zagreus, that on my whim I can take everything from you.
I am quite capable of making your life plenty difficult, you do now realize, young Zagreus?
Perhaps a few more winter seasons such as that might teach you more of how this world works.
Enough; I do not hold to grudges, Zagreus. You've my good graces, and my temper's cooled, for now.

text.Zagreus: Good Lady Demeter, you've shown me warmth and generosity, and I am very grateful for it. Please, accept this as a small token of my appreciation.

text.Demeter: An offering well suited for the season, there, young Zagreus! In turn, as you are honorable and obedient, you'll have from me what the mortals have not.

text.Zagreus: A little offering for you, good Lady Demeter. I'm deeply grateful for your willingness to aid me in all this.

text.Demeter: I must acknowledge and accept your thoughtful gift of Nectar, Zagreus; would that the mortals showed deference thus.

text.Zagreus: May this small offering bring you some joy there on Olympus, Lady Demeter. Thank you for all your help.

text.Demeter: A conscientious gift, my little sprout; and I am grateful for your generosity. A bit of Nectar cuts straight through the cold, I say.

text.Zagreus: Your power and your wisdom has been of such help, good Lady Demeter. I'm honored, and this is the least I can do in exchange.

text.Demeter: I was quite certain that the youth today was lacking any sort of tactfulness, young Zagreus. For once I'm thankful to be proven wrong.

text.Zagreus: Lady Demeter, I am forever in your debt for the affection that you've shown to me, and for the power you've bestowed.

text.Demeter: The everlasting winter means that Nectar's been in rather short supply; that you would think of me for such an offering is duly noted, then.

text.Zagreus: I often remember that there's sweetness in this world only by your grace, Lady Demeter. I'm thankful that we've grown closer through all this.

text.Demeter: You would make further offerings to me? Even though I have made quite clear I've lately not been at my charitable best, young Zagreus? You're either naive or you're much too kind, or both.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Erm, Grandmother? If you don't mind I call you that. Knowing we're related like this fills me with pride. Your power over life... I think I've some of it in me! And I could not have come this far without your help. Please, for everything... this is for you.

CHOICE.Demeter: Why, Grandson, how you honor me, with this... I am so very grateful that we've met, and that... you're you, if that makes any sense at all. I have my sisters, but... I'd no one else, for very long, indeed.

CHOICE.Zagreus: I'm in your debt, great Goddess Demeter.

CHOICE.Demeter: No comfort from the bitter cold!
Shiver and rot, for all I care!

CHOICE.Zagreus: I can't refuse this, Lady Demeter.
Good Lady Demeter, I must accept.

CHOICE.Demeter: I have no tolerance for disrespect.
I warned you not to side against me, little sprout.
Respect your elders next time, Zagreus.
My greetings to you, little sprout.
A winter's greeting to you, Zagreus.

text.Hermes: What's going on, there, Coz? Can I call you Coz? Got something here for you should make your battles to the death end that much quicker!
Sorry, boss, my pop had pressing matters to attend to. But I'm here! Relaying you that message, and relaying this.
Here to tell you that Poseidon's on his way, boss. Sometimes he is a little slow. But you'll meet up with him again eventually!
Expecting someone else, there, boss? A certain half-sister of mine perchance? Well, tough break, I got here first. Want one of these, or not?
Soon as I heard you were looking to see Ares, boss, I got here as fast as I could! He's never going to beat me. Much less in all that armor.
Aphrodite said she's running just a little late, Coz, though I'm sure you understand. Besides, I'm here! In spirit anyhow.
Wanted to let you know my sister Artemis is out looking for you. You should be running into her in any chamber, now!
Afraid that Dionysus couldn't be here for you, boss. Though punctuality has never been one of his stronger suits.
That chill you were expecting in the air, that wasn't Demeter this time, here, boss! No, that was just me whisking to you in a flash. Makes for a little pleasant breeze I think!

You did it, Coz! And by it I'm referring to the act of beating down my seemingly invincible boatman associate, who fancies himself pretty tough as Underworld deities go! He wasn't sure you had it in you, and if I may be so bold, neither was I!
Hey looking like you're getting some good use out of that fancy plume of yours! Keep going like that, maybe someday you'll be half as quick as me!

I got a keen eye, boss, so I happened to notice that you've got a certain tooth you're carrying about. Know you're from the land of the dead and all, but don't you think that comes across as just a little odd?

Heard that you finally got out of there, Coz! Big congratulations due for that: Congrats! The secret's safe with me, of course! The others here, they think you're still at it. Though, I guess you are!

I heard a certain someone's back at home with you down there now, Coz! I'd call it wonderful news, except it isn't news, at least not yet! Though if the time comes that you want to spread the word, just give the signal here!

text.Zagreus: I get to be the messenger this time. In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Lord Hermes? Got here as quickly as I could.

text.Hermes: Why, that looks like you've got a message just for me, this time, how special is that, boss? Some sort of invite from the looks of things. You sure that I'm supposed to have this, seeing as I'm not officially involved?

Got to tell you, Coz, that was a real something of a feast back your place! A little awkward, having to pretend we just met, but hey, I'm an Olympian! Means I can posture with the best of them. Good times, Coz! Glad it all worked out.
Afraid your regularly scheduled Olympian could not be here right now, because I'm that much faster, boss!
You might have been expecting someone else, here, boss. But I just couldn't help beating them to the punch this time!
Got here just as quickly as I could, Coz. Which turns out to be quite a bit faster than my relatives!
I'm sure that keepsake that you brought will come in handy soon enough, there, boss!
My relatives are normally quite quick to heed the call of anybody bearing one of their keepsakes! Huh!
I may not be the god you're looking for right at the moment, boss, but I will get you on your way to them in no time here!
You heard already from my pop, haven't you, Coz? Wonderful guy. Don't get to spend a lot of time together, though! You know how that is. Well, see you!
You know, Coz, my pop never gives his lightning blessings to me! He's quite invested in what happens to you, isn't he?
Want to bring you in on something, boss. Reason that Uncle Poseidon got to you before I did is, I let him. He's under the impression he's as spry as ever! Hah!
So then Athena's looking out for you, that's good, that's good! She likes to put a lot of thought and stuff in everything, it's all a little much, if you ask me!
You know who keeps me awful busy, Coz? Ares. Nothing like a good old war amongst the mortals to create demand for lots and lots of messages to go around!
Did Artemis manage to locate you already, boss? She's pretty good at that, I have to say. I'm faster! But she's fast, she's pretty fast, all right.
Aphrodite's really something, don't you think so, Coz? Normally I'd stop for no one here. But when it comes to her, exceptions must be made!
You ever get the feeling life's been moving all too quickly for you, boss? Well Dionysus doesn't, as you're probably aware. Throws quite a feast, though!

Been downright chilly up here lately, Coz! We've Demeter to thank for that! Me, I try to stay out of her way, she doesn't think I'm of much help to her. Although I'm sure she's warmed to you at least!
Say, isn't that your father's blessing on you, Coz?! I almost can't believe it, but you've done such a good job of things, how could he not approve?
Whoa, what's good, there, Coz? Though, who am I kidding, we can cut the small talk. I don't mind. I interrupt my brothers and my sisters all the time!

Boss, you've probably caught yourself thinking: Hermes sure is quick! So how come it took so long for him to show up in the first place? Well, I'm afraid that's not for you to know. But! It's not because I was late. Not late for anything.

Hey, uh, could you do a little favor for me, Coz? My brothers, sisters, family, and whatnot, they're unaware I'm working with you, here. It's no big deal, but let's keep it that way for now. All right?
Happened to be in the area, boss! Seeing as the mortal folk up here keep dying off, and someone's got to bring their souls to your domain, now, don't they.
Know that saying 'don't be hasty', boss? That comes from me. I swear! A little way to stave off competition, masquerading as the wisdom of a sage. Those stupid mortals will buy anything!
Not that I really know exactly what you're up to, Coz, but! If I did, I don't think anybody on Olympus is aware of it. Or, if they are, they're keeping their mouths shut. The same as me!
You ever wonder how I got this fast, Coz? Lots of practicing, I'll tell you that! And being born unnaturally quick, I guess!

Once took a skinny little chap down to the Underworld, got the business end of a sharp spear, he did! He had it coming, though, a lot of lying, cheating, and the like. Last that I heard, he's still making his amends down there. Eh!

Boss, I know you've heard a certain rumor from a very skinny individual who's uninclined to move. You best keep that one to yourself, all right? Or else our jig is up, and your father wouldn't like that, nor would you. So, cheers!
Say, you're in good with what's-his-name, the one who gave you his lucky tooth? So he's an all-right sort, then. Has to be, if you put up with him!

So, now you've found me out, haven't you, Coz? Heard from the big boat-man himself. Well, good! We're pleased to be of service. And we've got a lot of dirt on you, so you be sure to keep our secrets, too. All right?

So my professional associate, the fearsome boatman on the River Styx? You got to know him pretty well in all of this, right, Coz? Hard getting through to him, I know, but his heart's in the right place! It's why I'm working with him, after all this time!
Heard you've been seeing the Fury, Megaera, Coz? Got the impression she was quite a handful, though I guess the same can probably be said of you, there, huh? You two have fun!

I can't believe you got into a fight with my professional associate, you daft or something, Coz? Just about everybody that I know, they're all at least a little bit afraid of that one and his boat, yet you think you can take him, huh?

So you took on my good professional associate, is that right, Coz? And you beat the big boatman himself! I knew you were pretty tough, but not that tough! Impressive work! He's impressed, too. He isn't even mad!

Hey, uh, so I kind of placed a bet with the old boatman, my associate that is, that you could beat him in a fight, twice in a row! No pressure, or anything, but just in case you prove me right one of these days, I would appreciate it, Coz!
Message from Olympus for you, boss! It says, 'It sure is nice up here upon this mountain, not having to escape the Underworld! Come join us soon, won't you?'
Message for you, boss. It says, 'You're rather slow. If only somebody could help you out with that.' Huh, fancy that, what a coincidence!
Got you a message, Coz. Says here, ahem: 'Hurry up and get out of there already.' It's from the surface of the earth, says so right here.

Another message here! It says, 'One small spoon dried oregano, two spoons extra virgin olive oil, one large onion, minced, a dash of salt to taste,' wait, this isn't for you. Though you should try it sometime if you ever make it out!

Message for you, Coz, it says, 'On behalf of all Olympus, we would like for you to know that was a right good bottle of Ambrosia that you offered to the god of travel, Hermes, who appreciated every drop.' Sincerely, me!

Another message for you, Coz, this one says, 'Hey, mate! If you ever do make it up here up on this mountaintop for whatever reason, we should hang out, all right? I can show you around.'  Your friend, Hermes.
You know, boss, just between us? Out of all special delivery recipients I've had over the ages, here, I've got to say, you're the most interesting one!
You know, Coz, all this time that I've been bussing souls across the borders of your father's land, it's good to have the chance to help somebody out the other way!

Hey, Coz, you're now well accustomed to our little chats, but I want you to level with me here. You're the boss, if you prefer, I would be happy to shut up, no harm no foul. Just give the signal, hey?

text.Zagreus: Perish the thought, Lord Hermes. It's been great hearing from you from time to time.

text.Hermes: Well, all right, boss. Just making sure that I'm not interrupting anything!

text.Zagreus: Now that you mention it, Lord Hermes, yes, let's keep our interactions nice and quick.

text.Hermes: I hear you, boss, we'll cut straight to the chase next time, all right?
Ahem! Pardon the interruption, boss. You let me know if you prefer that I pipe up again next time, more like I used to!

text.Zagreus: I miss hearing from you, Hermes. Let's carry on like we did before.

text.Hermes: Hah, sure thing, boss. It's good to have a chat from time to time!

text.Zagreus: Appreciate you checking in, Lord Hermes. I think we should keep at it like we have been, nice and quiet.

text.Hermes: No problem whatsoever, boss. Just checking in.
Thought I'd check in again real quick, there, boss. You want my witty conversation next time, or straight to the Boons?

text.Zagreus: You know, yes, let's go back to having witty conversation from you, Hermes. That sounds great.

text.Hermes: Hah, good! I like these little chats! Take care, now, boss.

text.Zagreus: Straight to the Boons, Lord Hermes. We both appreciate cutting straight to the chase.

text.Hermes: I get it, boss. Words are too slow, aren't they. Won't bother you again word-wise, but I'll be seeing you!
Thought I'd check in again real quick, there, boss. You want my witty conversation next time, or straight to the Boons?

text.Zagreus: Definitely witty conversation, Lord Hermes. Boons are more than welcome after that.

text.Hermes: Hah! Good, I like these little chats! Take care, now, boss.

text.Zagreus: Straight to the Boons, Lord Hermes. We both appreciate cutting straight to the chase.

text.Hermes: I get it, boss. Words are too slow, aren't they. Won't bother you again word-wise, but I'll be seeing you!

Met your father face to face only the one time, Coz. Despite rendering services to him for quite a while. Memorable experience, I'll give it that! Seems like he's not done anything with all the messages my side keeps sending him.
You're pretty close with Thanatos, aren't you, boss? We don't often run in the same lanes, though our duties sometimes intersect a bit. Odd chap. Seems good at what he does, though!
Saw Thanatos again lately, here, boss, and want to tell you, almost looked as though he cracked a smile when he mentioned you! Never seen anything like that with him!
I hear you're close with Orpheus down there, you get the chance, you tell him I said hey! He's pretty decent with that lyre of his, last time I checked.
Hey boss, in all your travels there, you happen to run into a lass by name Eurydice? Hope she's all right! I feel bad because we didn't get a proper send-off last we met.
I caught wind you found Eurydice down there, that's great! Long as she's on the up and up, I can eject her from the tiny worry center of my mind.
That's quite a nice Bone Hourglass you got, there, boss! So you're in good with my professional associate, as well. A real gentleman!
Why, look at you, there, boss! I recognize that fancy plume you got! Just an iota of my speediness in there, but still! Much more than most can do.
Whoa, what's gotten into all those lifeless wretches that you're always fighting with down there? They're really moving lately! Whatever's made them go all out, it wasn't me!

Got all your father's lifeless wretches hot and bothered, going all out all because of that Forced Overtime condition of his, isn't that right, Coz? Well, if they're interested in getting things done quickly, I am sure you can oblige them in a bit!
Looks like those lifeless wretches you're contending with down there are really on the move this time around, aren't they, boss? Oh, well, you're faster still, I'm sure!
Somebody's on a tight deadline, I take it, Coz? Courtesy of your father's Pact, well, you believe me, I know how that is, so I won't keep you, just keep moving, right?
I realize you're on a tight deadline, there, boss, so let's dispense with all unnecessary chit-chat here and get you on your merry way, posthaste!
You racing against time to keep things interesting, or what, there, boss? Turns out that time goes pretty quick. I like racing against it, too!
Hah! Can't help but notice you've been timing yourself, boss! Good habit that. Keep an eye on the time, you'll get faster and faster! Not as fast as me, mind.
You know, Coz, since you're timing yourself, case you haven't noticed, doesn't count against you when we stop to have these chats! Insisted on that little rule myself.
Hey, you stopped timing yourself, boss, everything all right? If that's not a cry for help, well, I don't know what is. Um, here!
Good, boss, I can see you're clocking yourself once again. Little term I like to use, means beating yourself up whilst keeping time!
Look, Coz, if you aren't always going to time yourself, that is a choice of lifestyle I have to respect. And learn to understand.

Another message from Olympus, boss. This goes, 'Zagreus, take absolutely all the time you need making your way to us; we know the going must be treacherous, and we assure you our support, however long it takes.' Well, how about that!
Heard you got through pretty quick last time! Not bad, not bad!

You'd think that once you break free to the surface we could see you from Olympus a bit more than usual, but no! It's like you're shrouded in eternal night up here, hm? Something like that. Odd, right?
Hey, you beat your fastest time fighting through all of that! Not that I'm keeping track! I'm keeping track.
Hey Coz, that last run-through that you did, I almost can't believe how quick you pulled that off! You're really pretty good!
Hey, you got out of there in practically no time at all before! Let's see if you can have another go like that!
You're getting faster, Coz, keep at it, just like that! Can always go a little faster than before is what I always say!
Hey, Coz, looks to me you beat your fastest time climbing up out of there! That's nicely done! Can you go faster still?
What do you know, you beat your personal best time escaping recently! I hope my blessing helped a bit with that!
Well look at you, Coz! Rushing to victory after successive victory. Caught wind of your accomplishments down there! Well then, let's keep the streak alive!
Heard the news you broke your streak of victories of late, boss. Happens, right? You seem the sort to bounce right back, though. Let me help with that!
So you get to keep breaking out of there, time after time, so that your father can keep finding ways to make it even harder to escape? Something like that? Sounds like an interesting assignment, Coz!

Everybody on Olympus, they're still going on about Persephone, Queen of the Underworld! They had no idea she was down there all along, none whatsoever, Coz! And as for me, now I can deliver you my blessings more officially, I think!

Even though everything's out in the open, now, and all my brothers, sisters, and whatnot are going to keep helping you fight your way out of there, I've still been keeping to myself, of late! That way nobody slows me down.

Some members of the family up here, I know they haven't helped at all, but just don't take it personal or anything, all right? Think of it this way: You've got more of us getting along and talking properly than I have ever seen!
Your mother got from there just fine, don't worry, Coz! She had me looking after her, and such. Seemed real nice! Told me to tell you hi.
You know, I never knew the pomegranate seeds down in the Underworld held such power if not for your mother mentioning it, Coz! And here I thought they were just tasty, that was it!
Thought I'd check up on you, there, boss. You doing well, everything good and all? Can't hear you one iota, mind, so then, don't answer that!
Come quickly, boss! You need to hurry up and get out of there, you're running out of time!! You're not, really, but it's a bit of motivation, hey?
Oh, you ready for this, boss? Got you the Premium Express this time. Absolute cream of the crop right here! You're going to go real far.
Guess what, Coz? It's the Premium Express, delivered straight to you, fresh from the richest mountaintop up here! You're going to like this.
Express-delivered message for you, Coz. It says: 'Congratulations! You're my hundredth customer today.' And here is what you get!
Eugh, I have to tell you, you look awful, Coz. You're barely holding on! Let's see if we can't perk you right back up.
Whew! Looks like times hit you hard since last we had a run-in, Coz. Well, when life is tough, just hurry through the rubbish bits, I say!
Whoa you're a hot mess, there, Coz, what happened getting here? Ah well, I hope your travels run a little smoother here on out.
There's a fine line between being quick and being hasty, boss. And if you're hurt as bad as I think, I think you might be on the hasty side!
Well, good news is you got to me, but I can tell you hit a lot of bad news on the way! You stay alive, all right?
Oof! What happened getting here, boss? Let me guess, you got whipped, burned, beat up with spectral clubs... something like that?
You're looking worse for wear, I hate to tell you, boss. But, we can pick you up and get you going here, I think!

text.Zagreus: This mark, almost like a bat wing. In the name of Hades! Olympus! I accept this message.

text.Hermes: Hey boss, found you, good. Hermes, at your service. Pleasure! You are the talk of Olympus! Normally I wouldn't get mixed up, but for you, I will be making an exception. Now, come on, we both got places to be!
All right, Coz, here's the goods, fresh from our mountaintop. Take all the time you need deciding! If you want to be a slowpoke.
Won't need but a moment of your time, here, boss! And you'll more than make up for it right quick, you got my guarantee!
All right, Coz, express delivery to where-in-blazes are you at right now? Anyway take one of these, and go about your business!
I know you're kind of in a hurry, boss. But let me show you what a real hurry's all about in just a moment here!
Package for you, boss! And I think you know what's inside. Well, maybe not exactly, but... just pick something, will you?
Come on, Coz, you can do this! And furthermore, I think you can do this rather quick! Now go!
It's you, boss, that's good! But you're standing still! That's bad. Let's get you up and moving about again, all right?
Hey, boss! Not much to report up here. But I've not exactly come this far to bring you news, have I?
Afraid there's no one faster than myself, here, Coz. But good news is, you are about to close the gap a little bit!
Slow day so far, there, boss? Well all of that's about to change, you got my guarantee!
How 'bout we pick the pace up just a little, Coz? Or maybe by a lot! Whatever you've the mood and stomach for right now.
Last thing I ever want to do is slow you down, boss. So, enough chit-chat. Now pick and go. Go!
You've got a ways to go yet, boss. Good news is, the slowest part of this particular trip is hereby over... now!
All's well enough here on the surface, Coz. Though, sooner you can make it out of there, the better it'll be!
Another go up to the surface, boss? Might suggest that you be very quick about it. And might give you this!
Let's hustle, shall we, boss? Honestly, I don't know how the rest of you can stand it, trudging about like you don't have someplace to be!
Hiya, boss! I'd ask what's new, but I already know! I have my ways. And you have to get right on out of there.
Wish I could just fly in and haul you out of there, Coz, but there's some rules even I can't break. Though nice to see you have a go of it!
I come with urgent tidings, boss! Unfortunately not addressed to you. But someone got you these!
Sorry, Coz, no messages this time. Guess that's what happens when your whole existence is kept secret from the world!
There's not much new worth mentioning up here, though looks like you have got your hands full down there, boss!
You've got a tough climb up ahead, Coz, so you just pace yourself, all right? Just kidding, go as quickly as you can. It works for me!
Come on, now, boss, let's get you moving here!
Got here in practically no time at all, boss. Ready now?
Hey Coz, package for you here. Knock yourself out!
Got a customary care package for you, Coz.
Hey, what's it going to be this time, boss?
Come on, Coz, let's pick up the pace a bit!
Go get yourself out of there in a hurry, Coz.
No rush, but go on and pick one of these, boss.
Message for you, Coz: It says 'Take one, it's free, enjoy!'
What's going on, there, boss? Are things all right?
You want the usual, or what, there, boss?
Special delivery and all that, boss! Here, take your pick.
Hey boss! You take one of these, and go for it.
Just so happened to be in the area, here, boss!
Making sure you got this, Coz. You got this, Coz!
Here comes a little boost to get you up and out of there in no time, boss!
Now, don't just stand there, Coz, pick one of these and go!
Your quickness is my number one priority, here, boss.
No time to waste and so on, Coz. Now, choose!
Caught wind you need my services here, boss?
Thought I'd check in, Coz. See how things are going. Slow, right? Not for long.
Ready to hustle? Good! I'll take that as a yes.
Let's get you quickly on your way, there, Coz!
Message for you, boss. It says: 'Here, choose one of these, and go!'
Another message for you! This one says: 'Hey boss! Take this!'
Just thought I'd check up on you, boss, and bring you this!
Hope you enjoyed the life of being slow, because all that's about to change, right here!
All right, boss, here, let's get you on your way!
Past time we got you out of there, right, boss?
Just thought I'd drop by, give you this, and go!
We'll have you racing out of here in no time, Coz!
How goes it underground of late, there, boss?
Nice day we're having on the surface! You should see it, boss!
Another day, another race up to the top! You ready, boss?
Well, here we go again! Let's go, then, boss!
Got here as quickly as I could, boss. Now what say we get you promptly the hell out of there!
Hey Coz, gathered you were just about to make another go of breaking out of there! Thought I'd stop by and give you a boost.
You're raring for your next trek out of there, right, boss? Well then I guess I got here just in time.
Heard you were heading out again, boss. Changed my schedule around a bit, not a big deal, and figured I'd drop in!
You're off again, are you? All right well then safe travels! Or swift travels, failing that!
You ready for another go at this, Coz? Well then think I can speed you on your journey there.
Why, hello, Coz! Odd that we're running into one another here! Among the wares of my professional associate, I mean. Must be some sort of clerical mistake!
Why, hello, boss! Odd that we're running into one another here! Among the wares of my professional associate, I mean. Must be some sort of clerical mistake!

You're well familiar with my professional associate, there, with the boat? Souls of the recently departed got to make it over to the Underworld somehow. Part of my job! I bring them in, he takes them down.
I guess I'm used to these one-sided chats here, boss, thanks to my work experience with my professional associate down there! You tell him I said hi, all right?
A word of caution, Coz. Don't ask too many questions about me, or my professional associate down there. I hand souls over to him, and that's it, you understand?
Wouldn't you know it, boss! I was just minding my own business, handing off a few dearly departed souls to my professional associate, and who shows up, but you?
My heavy-breathing professional associate was gracious enough to drop me off here with his other stuff, and for quite an affordable price, at that!
All right, then, let's go make that spend of hard-earned coin well worth your while! What do you think, Coz?
I'd tell you not to ask too many questions of my good professional associate nearby, but then, who are we kidding, boss? Not like he'd answer you those questions anyhow!
Message for you, boss, from my professional associate, who wanted you to know, and I quote, 'Hhhrrrrnnnngggggghhhhhh.'
Been working with my good professional associate, the boatman there, since I-don't-know-how-long. Though, let me tell you, Coz, we haven't had a job quite like this yet!
Among the many ways in which you could parlay your earnings into better chances of survival here, I'm flattered you would think of me this time!
How strange of a coincidence that you keep running into me along the riverside like this, don't you agree, there, Coz?
Don't normally go selling off my blessings to the highest bidder, boss, but your bid there is good enough for me!

text.Zagreus: Lord Hermes, please accept this gift as a small token of my appreciation. Thank you for always keeping me on my toes.

text.Hermes: Oh! Mighty keen of you to leave a tip, there, boss. And I've a tip for you: Don't be slow! Maybe this will help with that.

text.Zagreus: Lord Hermes, please accept this gift as a small token of my appreciation. Thank you for always keeping me on my toes.
Lord Hermes sir, you've asked for nothing in return, and so, please take this humble offering, because... it's nothing, really!

text.Hermes: Well now, that's awful kind, there, Coz! No need to thank me, though. Not so profusely anyhow!

text.Zagreus: Lord Hermes sir, you've asked for nothing in return, and so, please take this humble offering, because... it's nothing, really!
Hermes, my friend? May I call you my friend? I hope this modest offering will lift your spirits but won't slow you down.

text.Hermes: I look like I got the sort of time to sip Nectar, Coz? Well, guess what, I do! So, cheers!

text.Zagreus: Hermes, my friend? May I call you my friend? I hope this modest offering will lift your spirits but won't slow you down.
Ever since we met, Lord Hermes, life here in the Underworld has been much faster-paced, and I am ever grateful. This is for you.

text.Hermes: Hey, boss, I appreciate the tip. But just as a reminder, all my services are paid in full already! No need for special thanks. Though... cheers.

text.Zagreus: Ever since we met, Lord Hermes, life here in the Underworld has been much faster-paced, and I am ever grateful. This is for you.
I never could have come this far this quickly had it not been for your tireless support, Lord Hermes, sir. I'm in your debt.

text.Hermes: You know, Coz, I got to say I had a few concerns when we first met, your father being who he is and all. But you're all right!

text.Zagreus: I never could have come this far this quickly had it not been for your tireless support, Lord Hermes, sir. I'm in your debt.
This one's for you, swift and sure-footed messenger of the gods! You make what you do look easy. But I know you're going out of your way. Thank you so much, Hermes.

text.Hermes: My rule is not to let things get too personal as far as work-related matters are concerned, Coz. But you're family! And, well, you're a right decent chap, I think. Offering up a bit of Nectar to me in the middle of all this!

text.Zagreus: This one's for you, swift and sure-footed messenger of the gods! You make what you do look easy. But I know you're going out of your way. Thank you so much, Hermes.
I salute you, Lord Hermes, with this rarest of delicacies! Pretty rare here, anyway. You never show it, but I can only imagine how hard you must be working to back me up. Cheers, mate!

text.Hermes: You know, the last time anybody offered me Ambrosia from the Underworld was never, before now! That's quite a gesture on your part. You could have just as well taken my services for granted and I'd not have minded in the least! But, thank you, Coz.

text.Zagreus: I salute you, Lord Hermes, with this rarest of delicacies! Pretty rare here, anyway. You never show it, but I can only imagine how hard you must be working to back me up. Cheers, mate!

Message for you, Lord Hermes! It says, 'This offering is dedicated to the incomparable god of swiftness, from whom the news is always good, because he's bringing it. You are a real mate, you know that? I really owe you one.' Zagreus.

text.Hermes: Look, Coz, I am going to accept this choice Ambrosia from you one last time, all right? But from this point, I am doubling down on all professional responsibilities, here. Strictly business between us! Although, secretly, you're one of my best mates. Want you to know.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Message for you, Lord Hermes! It says, This offering is dedicated to the incomparable god of swiftness, from whom the news is always good, because he's bringing it. You are a real mate, you know that? I really owe you one. Zagreus.
Lord Hermes, I am in your debt.

text.Zagreus: I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame...
Um... yes? Was I supposed to respond there?

text.Chaos: I sense that you have not yet spoken with the all-seeing artifact you call Aegis. Tamper with the Fates' design, then, all you like. But if you change your mind, do speak the words to it: I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame.

You have not yet used the waking-phrase that I imparted? Or perhaps you merely chose not to present me the result. I would quite like to see it, at some point. Remember, Son of Hades: Say to the all-seeing artifact, I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame.

Out of the infinitely spanning possibilities, here before me stands the Son of Hades, bearing my all-seeing artifact, appearing in the aspect of a bearer yet unborn, who shall be known throughout the north as Beowulf. How very droll.

I faintly sensed that you were able to confront your father while in possession of my small round catalyst. It seems my asking you, and your success, was in accordance with the Fates' design, as well. The result is more amusing even than expected. Thus, thank you.

I have detected some unusual activity within the reaches of the Underworld, Son of Hades... vast sums of Darkness, collected in an ancient catalyst, which I see now almost like a beacon, shining in the night. This either is the work of Nyx, or you, or both. I am anticipating the result.

It pleases me immensely, Son of Hades, to have seen the goddess Nyx again. The significant amount of time that has elapsed since last this happened dulled sufficiently old pains, I think. Thus, it becomes a basis on which our connection may, in time, take shape again.

As we become acquainted, Son of Hades, I shall make myself quite clear in one respect: I fear I have a lack of patience for discussion. When visiting, please merely listen, then accept my mark, and then depart. Respond only when necessary. Or when prompted. Yes?

text.Zagreus: ...Merely listen, so it's just like when I get those messages from the Olympians. Wait, you did just prompt me, Master Chaos, didn't you? Or should I have remained silent just now?

text.Chaos: I cannot offer you advice. But you were prompted, yes. You may speak freely, then, or anytime, despite my wishes that you not do so. Absolute silence is my general preference. It may not be yours.

I understand that Zeus and all his kin on Mount Olympus think that you are born of Hades and the goddess Nyx? I was amused to learn of this deception. Nyx has mothered many of the Underworld's own, so, why not you?

text.Zagreus: She isn't my birthmother, no, but she is like a mother to me. Do you know her?

text.Chaos: Oh, I know the goddess Nyx quite well, of course. Though, it has been a while since we last communicated, and I fear... well, I was not the charitable sort, back then. It is my hope that Nyx is faring well.

I knew you would arrive. But only in the moments prior to the fact. Thus, I am experiencing residual surprise. Your movements through the Underworld are as though a veil of darkness enshrouds you. The goddess Nyx's influence, perhaps? Respond.

text.Zagreus: I... do not know how to respond to that, exactly, Master Chaos, but, Nyx, yes, she has been aiding me, in my attempts to flee my father's realm.

text.Chaos: You move in darkness, not as infinitely black as hers, but reminiscent to me, nonetheless. I would invite her to try to elude me, and then attempt to locate her. A minor amusement for the both of us. Now, I have you for this, I see.
Lately, Son of Hades, I have sensed what I would call a sort of shift within your father's residence. Did something noteworthy occur, perhaps? Respond.

text.Zagreus: Master Chaos, it's Persephone, my mother. She's returned! She's chosen to return. So... things feel different, certainly, with her around, although... I didn't feel any sort of shift.

text.Chaos: You may not sense these shifts as I. The lightness of this space bends and adjusts with time. What you describe... it must have been the cause. I trust that the occasion is a welcome one. And I am pleased that you returned, nevertheless.
Again I sensed some sort of shifting in your father's residence. You seek to ask something of me about it, do you not? Respond.

text.Zagreus: Oh, I'm glad you asked, it's just... my mother, she's... we're reaching out to the Olympians. Trying to reconnect the family. It's been a while, relatively, since she and Father saw the others, but... in case a gathering occurs, I did wish you to know you're cordially invited, too.

text.Chaos: Cordially invited...? A generous proposal, Son of Hades, though unless your gathering is to occur within my space, please understand it would be difficult for me to bring the full entirety of my presence there. However... I think I can arrange to be with you in some capacity. Thank you.

It pleases me your gathering of the Olympians occurred. I must inform you... I had never once before detected quite so many of my offspring in a single space. At least not without violent intent. I appreciate that you included me, and that you have returned. Shall we continue, then?
It pleases me your gathering of the Olympians occurred. I must inform you... I had never once before detected quite so many of my offspring in a single space. At least not without violent intent.
You bear the blessing of the great Lord Zeus. He still believes he holds dominion over both heaven and earth. I think, perhaps, he has forgotten about me.
Lord Poseidon offered you his blessing, it would seem. He can be rather boastful and belligerent, exhibiting the most unattractive manners of your father and Lord Zeus alike.
This wise goddess Athena has imbued you with her charms, I see, O Son of Hades. Perhaps to her you are a tool with which her broken family may as yet be mended.
It is not unexpected that you consorted with the violent Ares, and now bear his Boon. He still worships me, you know; yet, I would say he does not know me very well.
The charms of goddess Aphrodite are upon you unmistakably, although I shall be curious to see if her command over one's sense of love shall have any effect beneath the earth.
I understand the hunting-goddess Artemis recently has turned her gaze towards you. It is unexpected she would offer her assistance, even to a relative in need.
The drunkard Dionysus offered you his services, I see? He can be rather unpredictable, and therefore offers me a source of some amusement.
Swift Hermes spurs you on, I see, O Son of Hades. Beware the narrow distance between hastiness and swiftness; a distinction I am not so sure the god of travel fully understands.
Embittered Demeter has reached you, hasn't she? She once was full of warmth, you know; but lately, as I understand, she is more prone to taking it away.

You have met many of the Olympians by now, each spurring you toward their mountaintop. They place such value on familial bonds, yet none of them remember who I am. Do not place too much faith in them, O Son of Hades.

I ask you listen but not speak, O Son of Hades, whilst the Olympians? They do not ask at all. They merely send their messages to you, unprompted, providing a choice of blessing, but no say. I seek to understand their point of view. But it is difficult.

When you extend an offering to the Olympians, for a fleeting instant, it appears as though they are able to hear your prayer. Or so I have observed. How interesting that your thoughts are capable of breaking free, yet you cannot.

Your father and his brothers, when they sealed the Titans in the darkest reaches of this world, that was the last they saw of me, as well. You are dissimilar from them, and I feel safe communicating thus with you.
