Always am I grateful for your company, my child.
You are most generous to visit with me, child.
You look rather well on this occasion, child.
It pleases me having these brief exchanges, child.
My faith in you has never faltered, child.
I sense your worry for me, child, yet would seek to disabuse you of the sentiment.
Though your journeys take you elsewhere, still it pleases me to see you, child.
My focus is on other matters at this time.
Please leave me to my current task at hand.
Let us communicate again some other time.
I shall support you however I can, my child.
Through any setback, you are always welcome here with me, dear child.
The nature of this realm, my child, is not fully known or understood, not by anyone within it or above.
There is no setback which you cannot overcome.
All here is well at present, child.
The House stands strong from all your labors, child.
You bring me pride through your accomplishments.
Go, and serve this House.
May Thanatos assist you should you cross his path.
Remain unseen, my child.
The Queen Persephone must be so proud of you.
Go, in honor of your birthmother, the Queen.
This House is stronger with the Queen returned.
Honor the Queen, my child.
Your father's spirits have been better as of late.
Your birthmother awaits. Go find her, child.
Seek out your birthmother again, my child.
Persephone awaits above.
I know for certain your birthmother waits for you.
Go. You know precisely where to find her now.
I am afraid I cannot help you now.
You shall discover what you seek when it is time.

text.Zagreus: Erm, Nyx? You've done so much for me, I.. thought you might like this.

text.Nyx: You know your father does not like it when Nectar is doled out on the premises, dear child. However, I am not he... and I wished, regardless, to provide to you a token of my affection.
How can I possibly accept such generosity, my child? Surely others whom you know are more deserving of such offerings.

text.Zagreus: Nonsense, Nyx. I want you to have it. You've always cared for me. I can't ever repay you for that.

text.Nyx: Your kindness toward me is unnecessary, child. You know I have no expectation of such gifts, from you or anyone.

text.Zagreus: I think of you always, Nyx. You raised me as your own, and I am grateful for it.

text.Nyx: You honor me, my child; although I dread that I am not deserving of such generosity. There is no need to flatter me like this.

text.Zagreus: Be that as it may, Nyx! I would still like for you to have it, with my compliments.

text.Nyx: I am grateful.
No gift which you could bring me can exceed the value of our kinship, child. Though, it moves me to receive this offering.

text.Zagreus: It's nothing, Nyx, really. I know you've always believed in me, and it's not something I ever take for granted.

text.Nyx: Among my many children, both those born to me and surrogate to me, you are one of the most thoughtful and most generous of all.

text.Zagreus: You have always cared for me and protected me. And given me someone to look up to. This is nothing, Nyx.

Nyx, if you'll forgive me this transgression for a moment, I would like for you to have this vintage bottle of Ambrosia, please. You can hand it off to Megaera as contraband, but... just in case, I wanted you to have it, first.

text.Nyx: Ah. A crystal bottle come all the way from the highest peaks of Mount Olympus to these depths within the earth. Your father always said he hated it.

text.Zagreus: Though, Father does have questionable taste.

text.Nyx: Ah, hahahaha. I accept this gift, with gratitude. This is a delicacy I have not experienced myself. Perhaps I may yet save it for appropriate occasions still to come. Thank you, my child.

By the way, I meant to tell you, child. The Ambrosia that you gave me? Rather than hold onto it indefinitely, I decided recently to sample it. Your father's claims about its flavor are quite false. I have never tasted anything like it.

text.Zagreus: So glad you liked it, Nyx! And, good timing, too, because... I have for you another bottle, here. They say each one is different in its own respect! And besides, the pleasures of Olympus should be shared. Please, take it, won't you?

text.Nyx: You are persuasive like your mother, and determined like your father, child. But if you so insist, then I shall not deny myself the simple pleasures of this drink. Though rare is the occasion for it here.

CHOICE.Nyx: I love you, too, my child.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Nyx, along with giving you this bottle of Ambrosia here, there's something I have meant to say to you. The Three Fates have been very kind to me. Because, in denying me my birthmother... they gave me you. Without your steady presence here, I... can't imagine what it would be like.

CHOICE.Nyx: Oh. Then, the Three Fates are whimsical, indeed. When you were born, and I was filled with fear for what it meant for you to be alive, to be responsible for you... I must admit I did not guess that, one evening, you would provide for me both such a gift, and such a sentiment.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Well, I mean every word. I love you, Nyx.

CHOICE.Nyx: Is there something I can do for you, my child?
It is unwise to thusly anger me.

text.Nyx: My greetings to you, child. How unusual that we should come in contact here. Chaos and I had quite a bit of catching up to do. Please go about your business, and I shall see you back inside the House in time. Provided you return there, of course. And, thank you for this, once again.
Chaos and I have much catching up to do.
How interesting to see you here, my child.
Please go ahead and do not mind me, child.
Thank you for keeping Chaos company.
Go forth, bearing the mark of Chaos.
Chaos and I have so much left to discuss.
It is comforting to be here again, in such darkness.
I shall see you back at the House soon, child.
It is odd to have returned to where I was born.
We are pleased to see you here, however briefly.
As Chaos cannot visit us as easily, now I can visit them.

text.Zagreus: Some of us more than others.

text.Hypnos: Welcome to the House of Hades, where... wait, I know you! Guess that means you died out there, huh? Well don't be sad, though, pretty much everybody dies sometime!
Oh! Hi. I'd ask you how it went, but since you're here again, I guess I know already, huh! Oh well, just come on in!
Ah, good, you're back already, huh? A few of us, we had a bet, about how long you'd last out there, and I just knew you'd be back in no time!
Oh, hi! Um, welcome home! Again! Go right ahead! I think your dad's mad about something or other, though.
Wow, you've died at least five times so far, I think? Dying's good for the whole ecosystem down here, so, uh, thanks! You're helping make the Underworld a better place!

text.Zagreus: Great! Just keep dying over and over and everything will be fine.

text.Hypnos: It's fun watching the Pool of Styx, you know? The ripples in the blood, and everything, and sometimes, somebody pops out of there, like you! House staff and guests of honor, no one else. I sign them in, and help make sure they have a pleasant stay!
Ooh, why you made it all the way to Asphodel that time, that's pretty neat! Still died and everything but not as quickly as you used to, so, that's progress, right?

text.Zagreus: I'm sure you can catch up.

text.Hypnos: Hey, wow, you did it! According to my list it says here you've died, what, fifty times at least! That's more than anybody's died around here, I think!

text.Zagreus: This is a real honor, Hypnos. Thanks?

text.Hypnos: Hey, let me be the first to say: Congratulations! You have died a hundred times since I've been keeping score. Since I've been keeping track. No prize for it or anything, but the journey is its own reward, or something, right?

text.Zagreus: Brilliant!

text.Hypnos: You're not going to believe this, here, you ready? Three.. hundred... times!! That's right! Three hundred times, you've died! That's like... more than an entire village from an earthquake, all on your own!

text.Zagreus: Six hundred?

text.Hypnos: Huh?
Oh, I just can't believe it, although I know my list here never lies! And it says that you have died all of five hundred times! Five hundred!! I can't even think of a number higher than that!

It's usually pretty quiet, keeping watch over the Pool of Styx back there. But it's sure been busy lately! Why, somebody else came through just earlier! You should have seen the look on my face when it wasn't you!
Hey, you keep dying! You happen to run into my brother anywhere out there, by any chance? Haven't seen him in ages, what's with the long assignment?

text.Zagreus: Something about a war. Father sent Thanatos to take stock, but you're right, it's been a while now that you mention it. I guess a lot's occurred down here since then.

text.Hypnos: I'll say! The lounge re-opened, let's see, what else... Anyway! You see my brother out there you tell him we've got everything here under control!
Hey, did you see? My brother, he's come back! He's here! Somewhere, I think! Good old Thanatos. He's so busy all the time, he... never talks to me! Kind of like your dad with you, I guess!
Whaa! Oh, hah, you just startled me there, is all, I was just... um... I...

text.Zagreus: Hey, uh, everything all right, there, Hypnos?

text.Hypnos: Oh, absolutely! Everything definitely is. It's just... it's Thanatos. He said some stuff, and... now I'm not so sure I'm doing the best job I can, you know?

text.Zagreus: I'm sure he wasn't trying to hurt your feelings. Wait, what am I saying, he's always been harsh with you, hasn't he?

text.Hypnos: Hey, what if he doesn't like me anymore? He's got other brothers!

text.Zagreus: Aw, thanks Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Oh hey! Um, this might be a little weird, but I, uh... thanks! I mean, you talked to Thanatos about me, right? At first I thought he was acting funny. But he has definitely been a lot nicer to me, lately!

text.Zagreus: Come on, Hypnos, I didn't have anything to do with that. You seem like you've been working extra hard, and taking some of the feedback you've been getting to heart. I think Thanatos really appreciates that sort of thing. Who doesn't?

text.Hypnos: I don't know! But I really appreciate that you went out of your way, I mean... I just stand here and greet and register the dead! But you? You're a real friend!
Whooooaaa.
Hey, there you are! So is it true?! You know, about you and Thanatos? Because he told me, and I just said, whooooaaa, but then, everything made sense?

text.Zagreus: I'm sure whatever it is he said is completely true, yes, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Hey, did you see? Somebody got me this incredible new sleeper-seat right here! Though, I would never lie down while on the job! I'm perfectly all right sleeping while standing up!

text.Zagreus: Hey, Hypnos? What would it take for you to let me through the locked door down the hall?

text.Hypnos: Oh, hahaha, that's a good one, you know I can't let you enter your dad's private chambers anymore, since you betrayed his trust and tried to run away from home! Sorry, Master's orders!

text.Zagreus: We don't.

text.Hypnos: Hey, did you see?! The Queen's come back! Though, did she ever take her sweet time!

text.Zagreus: Hey watch it, Hypnos, that's my mother you're talking about!

text.Hypnos: What, really? Huh! So then your mom doesn't spend any time with you, either! We've got something in common!
Why else?
Wait, wait, wait, so what's all this about you working here? I thought they fired you, and that was why you left!

text.Zagreus: Hypnos... you think all these times I've died, it's because I was upset I was let go from a miserable job?
Wow.

text.Hypnos: I heard the feast you had here, it was really something else! All the gods, together in one place, eating, drinking, not killing one another! That must have been a sight.

text.Zagreus: You should have been there, Hypnos! Not that I noticed your absence, though, what happened? Other pressing business?

text.Hypnos: Slept through the whole thing!

text.Zagreus: Hey, Hypnos? This is for all the well-meaning advice you've given me. A little something from a certain double-bladed-axe-wielding, bull-headed, oversized monster of a man who you admire?

text.Hypnos: What's this, it's kind of hard to read the hand-writing, it says, no way... To Hypnos, my biggest fan. Stay vigilant. Asterius. There's... even a little picture of a bull. You... I... wow... wow!
Hoh, says here one of the Wretched Thugs got you, too bad! They're slow but they hit pretty hard I guess. Have you tried moving out of the way?
According to my list here, why, you must've just got clobbered all the way back home by one of those Wretched Thugs again! The old moving-out-the-way trick didn't work, huh...?
Looks like one of the Wretched Witches shot you dead last time, sorry to hear that, huh? Have you tried shooting them first?
You must have had a run-in with a Spreader, huh! They're much more talented than the low-grade witches down in Tartarus, so your dad lets them stay warm up in Asphodel, I guess!
Oof, a Splitter zapped you, didn't she! There's lots of witches in your dad's place, huh? Witchcraft must be pretty dangerous for all those mortals up there. Pretty dangerous for you, too!
Aw, looks like you died from one of those nasty booby traps left by a Wretched Pest, little guys who look like urns? Have you tried avoiding them maybe?
Ooh wow, so Megaera herself got you last time, that must have been intense! She's fast, and strong, and beautiful, and... um... anyway, I hope the Fates are nicer to you next time!
Hah! Megaera the Fury got you again! She is unstoppable, isn't she? One time, I tried to stop her on the way to have a chat with your dad, and she didn't even turn her head! <Sigh...>

You got whipped by Megaera the Fury! Eh?! I always wanted to say that. Whipped, you know? Referring both to how badly you lost, and to that glowy purple whip she's always threatening me with whenever I try to talk to her?
So you got skewered by a Spike Trap out there, huh? Well, that's too bad! Have you tried not standing there, like, when the spikes come out?
Ooh looks like one of those Dart Traps killed you last time, bet that must have hurt! Have you tried getting behind something?
Ow looks like you got blasted to bits by an explosive urn last time! We keep some really nasty shades all bottled up in those, but... you so much as touch them, BOOM! Hah!
Whoaaa, you just got killed by one of those Bloodless Inferno Bomber skeleton type guys, nice! I always wondered what would happen if you just kind of stood around while all their bombs went off!
Owie, looks like the Bone Hydra of Asphodel just stomped you that time, huh? I hear each of its heads has its own nasty tricks. That must be tough!

Bone Hydra got you again, huh? Real sorry about that. Though, you know what? I want you to get back out there, you know, all through Tartarus, and Asphodel, again, and knock some sense into it for me, OK? OK!

Wait let me guess, don't tell me... you got slaughtered by the Bone Hydra, again! How many times was that? But you will get 'em next time, I just know it! Maybe the time after that. Eventually, no doubt about it!
Daw, one of those Wretched Louts just killed you dead that time, those mean old slappy guys? Maybe try killing them beforehand, I don't know!
Ooh, says here a Wretched Lout slapped you to death again, that's a tough break! Have you tried talking it out, or something, I... I don't know?
Hey you got turned to ashes by those floating Brimstone crystally type things! Next time one's turning you to charcoal with those beams of theirs, how about you step on over to the side?
Ooh, ow, so you got burned down to a crisp out there, standing in magma, right? I know you've got your burning feet and all, but standing in magma, why, I'm not so sure that's a good idea!
Huh, so you walked straight into a burning magma spout, is that what got you this time? Bet if you waited long enough it'd cool off, instead of killing you!

Hooh, looks like one of those little Numbskulls took a big old bite right out of you back there, I guess they got you, huh? Maybe if you weren't quite so tasty, they'd leave you alone! And so would I!
Did you just get chomped by one of those little Numbskulls, again?! Oh, that is definitely rough. I guess you must have done something to make the Fates real mad!

Oh, hohoh, you got blown up by a Slam-Dancer, I can see it on your face! It also says it on my list! Got everybody's cause of death, right here. Some real morbid stuff from time to time! So anyway, take care!

Why you look like someone who just got beaten silly by a dirty skeleton! Beaten well beyond the brink of death, I ought to say! And, sure enough, according to my list, you did! Those Bloodless sure are tough!

My list here says that you got petrified to death that time by some sort of nasty floating gorgon head? No offense to Dusa! Sounds like a pretty painful way to go, though hey! At least you got to be a statue for a little while! I like statues.
Pff, can I just say ouch? Because according to the list here, you got flattened like a pancake by a Skull-Crusher, out in Asphodel somewhere! Keep that up and you're going to get even shorter, haha!

Mmm, you look like someone who just got turned to stone then crushed to a bloody pulp by the Megagorgon of Asphodel, am I right? Well, look, I'm sorry to hear that, and before you ask, I won't tell Dusa, don't you worry about that!

Oh, I recognize that look! That is the look of someone who just got here after having met a most unfortunate demise, courtesy of the notorious Bloodless Wave-Makers!! How do they make those waves, and why do they hurt so, so much? Plenty of time to think it over, now!

Looks like you really took the heat from one of those Bloodless Burn-Flingers back there, didn't you? I know how tempting it can be to try and catch those fiery explosive bombs they throw, but... if I might offer you a bit of personal advice? You really shouldn't do that.

Oh, wow, Alecto's got it out for you...? Normally she doesn't kill anyone, she likes keeping them alive... for quite a while, really. Hurts them still, but doesn't kill them off! I guess she really doesn't like you, huh!

If you got killed by Tisiphone the Fury, why, then it must mean you've been accused of murder! A most heinous crime, as I'm to understand! Well, I hope you clear your name. Or whatever those mortals do about that stuff!

So, you lost a duel to the death with an Exalted Brightsword, did you? They're pretty much the best of the best, so don't feel bad! It had to happen! But if it's any consolation, it'll probably happen again!

Says here that you got stuck like a piece of meat on a spit by an Exalted Longspear, wow, I'll bet that really hurt! Too bad you don't have a thick, leathery hide or something that could help protect you in that type of situation. Oh well!
Looks like you just got pounded down by an Exalted Greatshield, huh? Did you try attacking while their guard was down? Or, did they just not let down their guard at any point... Oh...
Let me guess, you got caught out by one of those Exalted Strongbows, did you there? Next time, if you don't stand around like you're doing here right now, maybe you won't make such an easy target!
My understanding is you had a little run-in with a Nemean Chariot, just kind of plowed right into you, there, didn't it? You got to watch where you're going crossing the streets of Elysium next time!
Those Archer Statues in Elysium have got to be a real sight, no doubt about it. But, you can't just stand there and admire them, or else they'll shoot you dead like they did just now!

Sounds to me like you got stuck in more ways than one gawking at a Phalanx Statue in Elysium back there! I got to hand it to your dad. He made sure those look just as good as they stab any intruders like yourself!
Says here that you got flash-fried to a crisp within a Phoenix Urn's destructive blast back there, I mean, you really ought to stay away from those, if you ask me!

Woow, I can't believe you took on the Minotaur, no way! No wonder you're back here! Everyone knows that he's unstoppable. Especially me! Hey, next you run into him, could you... get his autograph, for me?
The Minotaur killed you again, that must have been exciting, huh? So, any chance you got that autograph for me, before you got destroyed?
Slain by the Minotaur once more, now he's a real beast, there, isn't he! But, tell me something, any progress on that autograph request of mine?

Oh, I just knew that you'd be back, soon as I heard you faced the Champion of Elysium, himself! You know, I've heard that, among mortals, it's an honor to be killed by somebody like Theseus! Keep it up, and maybe you'll be famous, too!

Look, I have to say, I just don't think you have a real chance against both Theseus and the Minotaur, together! But, you might just have a chance to get the Minotaur's autograph for me, if maybe you ask nice or something?
Good, you're back! So, prior to when Theseus killed you again back there, did you, by any chance, happen to ask his big bull buddy for an autograph for me, this time?

Looks like somebody just found out that some types of butterflies are incredibly dangerous! Especially the ones that come swarming out of those Soul Catchers! If only you could just... not have a soul, or something? Then they'd bother somebody else!

So, one of those Flame Wheels drove right into you, and burst into a fiery explosion, killing both of you, is that what happened there? Well if it makes you feel any better, technically, I think this means you got your revenge!
You had a run-in with those nasty Satyrs all the way up in the Temple of Styx, huh. I can't even imagine the sheer agony, having their lethal poison coursing through my body!
You know, I've only heard the tales of the gigantic, vicious, flesh-eating vermin up there near the surface. Now I guess we both know that those tales are definitely true!
Eugh, it says here you got chewed up by an angry swarm of Crawlers somewhere just a stone's throw from the exit to your dad's domain? Talk about adding insult to injury, huh?
Oh, I heard the pests of Tartarus had bigger, meaner counterparts up near the surface, but... I guess you just found out the hard way, huh? When you tripped one of their explosive things?

I know that look, why, that's the look of someone just incinerated by a Snakestone, am I right? They spit a whole bunch of those white-hot, flesh-burning beams right at the same time, there, don't they?

text.Zagreus: Don't want to talk about it.

text.Hypnos: Hey, you're back! Wait, wait, what happened? My list says you got killed by a Redacted, what's that even mean? I've never seen anything like this!

text.Zagreus: Why don't you ask Father when he's back.

text.Hypnos: Redacteds got you again, huh. Here's the thing, I keep asking around about them and no one seems to know what I'm talking about! Could you maybe describe them for me, please?

text.Zagreus: I guess so!

text.Hypnos: Huh, that's funny. Nothing on my list at all this time, except... I could have sworn I saw you walk right out of the Pool back there. I'll have to have this thing looked at.

text.Zagreus: Cheers.

text.Hypnos: The list is telling me you caught one of those gigantic Temple saw blades square in the chest, huh? Eugh... At least you're back in one piece!

text.Zagreus: Yeah.

text.Hypnos: What's the matter, there, you got a splitting headache from those giant falling axes in the Temple of Styx? Well I have just the cure, which is: Don't get hit by them!

text.Zagreus: Sure!

text.Hypnos: Well somebody just walked into a cloud of noxious gas, there, huh! Must have lost all your vital functions pretty quickly after that! Next time, you'll know it's seriously deadly stuff, because it killed you! And because it's green!

text.Zagreus: Hahahaha.

text.Hypnos: So, you just plain ran out of time and died, all according to the Pact of Punishment, there, huh? Now that is what I call a deadline, hahahaha!
Why, says here you just blew yourself right up that time, with that weird infernal shooty thing you stole? Remember, next time, shoot the other guys!

text.Zagreus: No, keep them.

text.Hypnos: Whoa, wait wait wait, this just can't be right, it says, it says... hahahahah, you got beaten by a tiny little rodent? Oh, haha, sorry I just, I, you have my sympathies.

text.Zagreus: I just wanted to see you again, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Wait, what, you're back already? Hey, my list says that you barely made it out of here before you died! Were you even trying? Because if you were, why, maybe you need to try a whole lot harder than that next time!
Oh, you got throttled by a Wringer, must have grabbed and crushed you like a grape! You know what grapes are, right? They're like big, squishy pomegranate seeds.
Ah, looks like you ran smack into the Doomstone out in Tartarus, thing gives me the creeps! Next time, try standing perfectly still. That way, it'll all be over that much faster!

Hey, you're the latest victim of a Wretched Sneak, that's something, right? They like to get you when you least expect it, so next time, why not keep spinning around and around? Then you'll catch them trying to sneak up!

So, let me guess, one minute you were minding your own business out in Asphodel, and then the next, one of those Dracons pops up right in front of you and pfeh! Just kills you dead with noxious acid breath. Ah, well! It happens, right?
Going toe-to-toe with one of those Bloodless Bone-Rakers didn't go so well, huh? Next time they're ripping you to shreds, remember: That's your signal to be someplace else, instead!

Wow, you just barged into the Witches Circle out in Asphodel, and they just filled you full of all those stinging purple orbs and killed you, huh? You can't just show up expecting to join their club! You have to study witchcraft for years!

Hey, my brother Charon killed you, am I seeing this right? He's never been particularly nice to me! Whacked me with his oar a couple times, but it never got that bad. Must be some misunderstanding, have you talked to him?

You had it out with Charon again, huh? And turned out like it did before! The thing you have to understand is he's got lots of upper body strength. You seen the definition in his arms? Maybe try some rowing for yourself!

So you met a violent end aboard the infamous Barge of Death sailing the river of flame! Surrounded by skeletons bleeding you dry, Voidstones making all of them invincible...! Have you thought about taking a different barge?

text.Zagreus: Probably!

text.Hypnos: Whoa, what happened to you, you just... died? You just plain died, like... nothing stabbed you, bludgeoned you, poisoned you, burned you, crushed you, blew you to bits, turned you to stone, but... you're back here! Must have been those Natural Causes mortals talk about!

text.Zagreus: Hahaha, no.

text.Hypnos: Natural Causes got you again, huh? That's a real shame, I mean, imagine one day you're just going about your business, and then ack!! You're dead! Although I guess you don't have to imagine it like I do!

text.Zagreus: Sure!

text.Hypnos: Darned Natural Causes got you once again, there, didn't they? Well, you show them next time! Would you do that for me, huh?

text.Zagreus: You've done it now, Hypnos.

text.Hades: ...You're late with your report, Hypnos. Again. Again! The dead of course can wait, but I'm less patient. Now, explain yourself to me.

text.Hypnos: Oh! Well, let's see, I woke up, I don't know what time it was, and I made sure that every shade had been accounted for, just like I always do, except I couldn't find my list at first, can you believe it? I thought maybe my brother played a little prank, and so...

text.Hades: Get to the blasted point already, I don't have all day! Or night. Urgh! Your report, where is it?

text.Hypnos: Sure I was just getting to it, Master! My list, I found it over by the lounge, it was inside, but I am not the one who put it there, no sir! So I've been making positively sure it's not been tampered with, that it has everybody's name, cause of death, place of birth, former body weight, any previous allergies or medications...

text.Hades: Enough!! Blood and darkness, that's enough from you, just... see to it the ledger of the dead is accurate, and get back to your post. Ugh, would that you could be more like your brother.

text.Hypnos: OK!

text.Hades: ...Your reports have been much more punctual of late, Hypnos. That is to be expected. However... the illustrated edges... a clever detail. Ensures certain reports are easily procured from a stack of parchment.

text.Hypnos: Oh, thanks, Master, glad you like those! Ever since Thanatos made pretty clear to me I was about to lose my job, I started keeping a list of my own tasks, which I sort through each day, deciding on priority, estimating time to completion, cost-benefit analysis...

text.Hades: Yes, well. Certainly, then, you have a number of such tasks requiring your attention. Continue working diligently, then.
No.

text.Hypnos: Master, I just can't thank you enough for putting my picture on the board there in the lounge! I heard it's a good picture! I haven't had time to see it yet, but I am going to, it's on the list!

text.Hades: Hypnos... that shall be all. Lest I rescind your commendation and cast you out of here.

text.Hypnos: ....Um, could you say all that again with smaller words, Master, because I thought it maybe sounded kind of bad?
Yes, Mom. I mean...Mother!
...I just get sleepy, sometimes, Mom, I mean, I've been working so much, lately, just over there? You've probably seen me, greeting shades, making my list, creating a welcoming environment...

text.Nyx: Remember what we previously spoke of, Hypnos. Do not address me thus whilst we are here. Conduct yourself as befitting a servant of the House of Hades... and, continue practicing your independence, please.

text.Hypnos: Great! I will!

text.Zagreus: Good work, Hypnos!

text.Nyx: You have demonstrated sustained competence in your duties, Hypnos. It gladdens me to see measurable progress. Your efforts are to be commended.

text.Hypnos: Aw, wow, thanks! Commended by whom, exactly? Megaera? Thanatos? Dusa, maybe! Not the Master himself?!

text.Nyx: Commended by me. I cannot always look after all of my children, as you know. It falls upon them to take care of themselves, as well as their obligations to our domain. As your mother... it is reassuring to see that you are capable.

text.Hypnos: Capable? Me? Aw, Mom... I mean, um, Mother Nyx! Nobody's ever called me that before!

text.Nyx: You are my son. It is to be expected. However... I know it is not effortless, to be of use. Continue to do well. I shall be watching.

text.Persephone: I truly appreciate it.

text.Hypnos: ...And if you ever need anything at all, Your Royalness, you can always find me wide awake, right over there! Though I really shouldn't leave my post like this! Not even for you!
Welcome to the House of Hades! Glory in Death!
Welcome to the House of Hades, where death is our life!
Welcome to the House of Hades, where death is our business!
Welcome to the House of Hades, and thanks for dying!
Just keeping watch over the Pool of Styx, there, same as always!
They won't catch me sleeping on the job again!
Oh, hey, I didn't see you come in, um... welcome back!
Whoa, I guess you must have died out there again, huh.
Oh, whoa, you're back already, that's too bad!
Oh, hi, um, you're welcome! Just, go right ahead, I guess!
Um, I was just resting my eyes... you won't tell anybody, right?
Well, you know what they say: There is no escape!
Hey, you look like you could use some sleep!
Oh, it's you, just, come on in, you're on the list!
You're back, huh? That was pretty soon I guess!
You must be pretty used to dying like this, huh?
The Fates are pretty mean to keep on doing this to you!
Thanks for dying, nice to see you here again!
Go right ahead, I'll get you all signed in!
Good thing you're basically immortal, huh?
Guess you're here to stay, hah-ha!
There's always next time, isn't there?

text.Zagreus: Fine.

text.Hypnos: How's my best friend doing, huh?
You'll get them next time, right?
Don't let me keep you, huh?
Signed you in, you're good to go!
I like having a best friend!
Glad you died so I could talk to you!
Nice to have a heart-to-heart like this, you know?
See you next time you die, OK?
Hope you enjoy your stay!

text.Zagreus: No.

text.Hypnos: I've got a survey here if you'd like to fill it out?
Welcome to the House of Hades! Just come on in!
Welcome to the House of... oh, you know!
Welcome back to our most frequent guest!
I want you to go out there, and die some other way!
There's no escape, in case you hadn't heard!
You can do this! Whatever it is you're doing!

text.Zagreus: Surprise, Hypnos! I got you this.

text.Hypnos: Whoa whoa whoa you can't bring that in here! Hah, just kidding, thanks! But wait, I'll trade you, look!
Oh! Wow! Thanks! This is real nice of you, hah! I sure am glad you died out there just now!

text.Zagreus: I'm glad I died, as well, Hypnos! I'm glad I died, as well.

text.Hypnos: Ah, neat! Huh, thanks!! It's not so bad that you keep coming back like this, is it? At least for me it isn't!

text.Zagreus: I'm getting used to it. Though I don't think I'd feel particularly welcome anymore if not for you, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Whoaaa you must've really gotten pretty far out there if you could get me one of these, so, wow! And thanks for stopping by!

text.Zagreus: You lighten up my numerous untimely deaths, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Hah, well this is like a dream come true! I mean, how come you're always being so darn nice to me? But anyway, um, thanks!

text.Zagreus: Sure thing, Hypnos! Knock yourself out.

text.Hypnos: Oh you are just the best, I bet you died on purpose just to get this back to me, didn't you! Didn't you?

text.Zagreus: I have a secret, Hypnos. I've died on purpose every single time, just to see you.

text.Hypnos: Oh you bet!

text.Zagreus: Hypnos, wanted to say you have really helped the thought of my coming back here time after time, painful death by death, not be inherently abhorrent. Your greetings really help! So I wanted you to have this.

text.Hypnos: But, but, but, wait, this, it's Ambrosia! You are not supposed to have this here! We could both get in a lot of trouble, and I mean a lot, if they catch us in the middle of this totally forbidden exchange!

text.Zagreus: I notice that you haven't yet returned the bottle to me, which I'm going to take as an indication that you're going to hang onto it.

CHOICE.Zagreus: I'll have to give that a shot.

One more forbidden exchange, Hypnos. Sometimes when I'm out there and about to die, I catch myself thinking... well, at least Hypnos will share one of his deep insights about why it is I utterly failed. So here! For all your generous advice.

CHOICE.Hypnos: Aww, I... feel like I am going to cry, I mean, all my advice is free! You really didn't have to do this. But I sure am glad you did! Even if it is highly illegal! I... I... I...!
...I think you could be my best friend! Have you... tried being my best friend?

text.Thanatos: Go about your business, Zag. What if Lord Hades saw us chatting like this, now...? I risked everything by helping you out there, and still you failed.

text.Zagreus: Turns out there's quite a lot of dead to fight down in the Underworld. Though I probably got farther than I would have, thanks to you.

text.Thanatos: Always happy to oblige. Especially when it causes me to risk my station. To risk everything I've worked for.
What are you doing back here, Zagreus? I risked everything by helping you out there. So that was all for nothing, then?

text.Zagreus: Far from it, Than. I got where I needed to go, and if not for your help, maybe I wouldn't have. As for why I'm back... as Father would say, I have some business to attend to, here.

text.Thanatos: Well! Don't let me stop you, then. Always happy to risk my station for your sake. To risk everything I've worked for.
Be on your way, Zagreus. I have an audience with Lord Hades in a moment. An inquiry into my recent absences.

text.Zagreus: What are you worried about, Than? You've never given him a reason not to trust you.

text.Thanatos: Recently, I'm not so sure. Whatever you're doing, it had better be worth it.

text.Zagreus: Don't be ridiculous, Than.

text.Thanatos: I still cannot entirely believe you really think there's any way you're getting out of here.

text.Zagreus: Why? You've been out. It's thanks to you the mortals end up down here maybe half the time.

text.Thanatos: That's different, that's my job. I can't stay there, and frankly I can barely stand it. Do you have any idea how bright it gets, up there?

text.Zagreus: No. But I look forward to finding out for myself.

text.Thanatos: Tsch, well. We'll see what the Fates have to say about that. Maybe the shade of Daedalus can make you some protective eyewear or something.

text.Zagreus: Couldn't if I tried!

Thanatos, the world outside... didn't you say that it would make you sick, being out there for very long at all? I understand now what you meant by that. Beautiful place and all, but... it's good to be back.

text.Thanatos: See what I mean, now, Zag? Nice place to visit on occasion, sure. But I definitely wouldn't want to live there.
I met her, you know. Persephone, I mean. You look more like your father, but... you have her eyes. One of them, anyway.

text.Zagreus: You never spoke of her to me. You must have known... you kept the truth from me, the same as Nyx?

text.Thanatos: It's not like that. I didn't know any more than you. Besides, Lord Hades ordered all of us to never speak of her again. I thought it just a bad relationship. I didn't realize she left her son.

text.Zagreus: Something tells me Father wouldn't let her take me even if she wanted.

text.Thanatos: Maybe so. But even still, she did abandon you. Your family's here, if you ask me. But I can understand that... you need answers.
Hm.
I met her, you know. Persephone, I mean. You look more like your father, but, you have her eyes. One of them, anyway.

text.Zagreus: You never spoke of her to me. You must have known... you kept the truth from me, the same as Nyx?

text.Thanatos: It's not like that. I didn't know any more than you. Besides, Lord Hades ordered all of us to never speak of her again. I thought it just a bad relationship. I didn't realize she left her son.

text.Zagreus: Something tells me Father wouldn't let her take me even if she wanted.
Hey, Than. Come join me in the lounge for old time's sake. The coast is clear. The work can wait.

text.Thanatos: You're really asking me to join you for a drink...? I mean... you know what, sure. The work can wait.

...I somehow knew, you know. I always knew you weren't going to stay. You were... so restless here. You just needed a reason to leave! And I hoped you wouldn't find one this quickly. Eugh. What am I saying? You have no idea.

text.Zagreus: No, I know exactly what you're saying, Than. I'm sorry that I'm putting you through all of this, it's just... it's something that I have to do. But, I'm glad we know the truth about me, now. Maybe we can move on from there.

text.Thanatos: Tsk... I've always lacked your optimism, Zag. Anyway... the work has waited long enough, I need to get back to it. Thanks for the drink.
...Watch yourself out there, Zagreus. I have to go.

text.Zagreus: Yeah, seriously.
Thanatos, I've meant to ask... is it really the case that many mortals have a crippling fear of death?

text.Thanatos: It is, I'm quite feared, up there. Most of them cannot distinguish between me, and, say, Lord Ares, or your father, even. We fill them with despair. No helping it.

text.Zagreus: Why not? I mean, isn't it kind of a big problem that they have such negative associations, here? Can't we... I don't know, do something to educate them all?

text.Thanatos: We've all the time to educate them, here. Their ignorance of death is solved almost as soon as they experience their first. Though I suppose they might be better off knowing before the fact.

text.Zagreus: Didn't know you saw it that way.
Than? I had another question about death. So... why is it mortals grieve so much about the thing, I mean... it definitely hurts there for a little while, but... it's not that bad.

text.Thanatos: They see it as their one and only chance. Imagine if, after you perished, that was it. Back to the infinite Chaos. Everything about you. Returned to how it was before you were even there.

text.Zagreus: But that's absurd. One life? Though... eugh. That's horrible, even to think about.

text.Thanatos: I know, right? Some of them know that isn't how it is, and try to tell their kind about what it is we do here, but... it's slow going, getting the information out. Either way! I get to be the bearer of good news.

text.Zagreus: It really is.

Hey Than? Something's been troubling me still, with what you said, about how mortals look at death. If most of them believe their life is all they have... how do they live? I mean, I can't even imagine what that's like. I'd be a lot more careful, at the very least!

text.Thanatos: They live with all their hearts, or at least try. I think there's something to it, truthfully. Though, some of them, they fall apart. They get here without me. On their own, gripped with despair. If only they knew what your father always says about all this.

text.Zagreus: What, you mean that 'there is no escape'? From what? The mortals are up there, not here. Not while they're technically alive in their sense, anyway.

text.Thanatos: I mean, you can't escape your problems, Zagreus. You can run from your family, but you can't run from everything. You have no choice but to confront it, and work through it, sooner or later, one way or another. You, and all of us.

text.Zagreus: ...I'm starting to notice that, yes. Though, to a mortal who has yet to die... don't they think of death as some sort of release? You come to end their misery, something like that?

text.Thanatos: I can release them from their decaying bodies. Sometimes, the Fates demand I bring them in sooner. That's about as much as I can do. Some of them get it early on, how to live. It's quite impressive, really, that they learn so quick.

text.Zagreus: I can see that.
Hey, just how far are you able to shift, anyway, Than? I never could go more than a blade's length in front of me, while you're out there skipping across the entire world probably.

text.Thanatos: Most of it, yes. Don't beat yourself up, though, Zagreus. It's a practiced skill but I've apparently been able to do it since birth. Mother Nyx says I was a real handful.

text.Zagreus: Go get them.
Hey, what is it you're always staring at out there, anyway, Than? I don't see anything.

text.Thanatos: The River Styx is right in front of you, and you don't see anything, Zag? I can watch it endlessly. Studying the competition, you might say. Most mortals expect to get here by river, with Charon. Not with me.

text.Zagreus: So you're locked in ruthless battle with a river, searching it for any signs of weakness, that sort of thing? That sounds stressful.

text.Thanatos: I find it rather soothing as a matter of fact. A break from having to deal constantly with mortal souls. Speaking of which... I have to pick somebody up right now.

text.Zagreus: I'm sure she's lovely, then.
Than, my blade, the one I'm borrowing from Father anyway, it... revealed to me an older aspect of itself, of Nemesis. Nyx never mentions her. Have you two ever met?

text.Thanatos: In case you haven't noticed, most of us who sprang from Nyx, we're not exactly close. Nemesis is fully occupied meting out justice on the surface. Our paths are not designed to cross. And based on everything I know, that's fine with me.

text.Zagreus: All right, then!

text.Thanatos: How's that Rail of Adamant been working out for you lately? Always figured the direct approach was more your style. Though, I happened to have a look at your permanent record lately, and turns out you're doing a lot of work with that thing.

text.Zagreus: Why, Thanatos, you're learning to pry in others' business! The Rail's been working out just fine, thanks. Though, now that you mention it, how well do you know Eris, one of Nyx's daughters, right? Seems she wielded the Rail before me.

text.Thanatos: The mortals call her Strife. She and her children... it's thanks partly to their dedicated efforts I'm so busy all the time. Though, it is best we didn't speak of her, I think.

text.Zagreus: Huh. Maybe. I hope.
Thanatos, I ought have asked by now, but... what's it like? Up there I mean, outside. You never talk about it, I... almost forget that's where you go, for work.

text.Thanatos: What can I say? It's... different. I never stay up there for very long, don't think I could, starts making me feel ill. Too many sensations all at once. And when the chariot of Helios is in the sky, it gets so bright that I can barely see.

text.Zagreus: That sounds awful. If it's that bad, why would all the Olympians chat it up so much?

text.Thanatos: There's no accounting for their taste, I guess. But, I'm discounting certain aspects that are not so bad. You know what? I'll not spoil the surprise. I have a feeling you're going to see for yourself soon enough.

text.Zagreus: Thanatos, I ought have asked by now, but... what's it like? Up there I mean, outside. You never talk about it, I... almost forget that's where you go, for work.

text.Thanatos: What can I say? It's... different. I never stay up there for very long, don't think I could, starts making me feel ill. Too many sensations all at once. And when the chariot of Helios is in the sky, it gets so bright that I can barely see.

text.Zagreus: That sounds awful. If it's that bad, why would all the Olympians chat it up so much?

text.Thanatos: There's no accounting for their taste, I guess.

text.Zagreus: What's going on with Charon, by the way, if you can tell me, Than? He's... never been particularly talkative, but he really seems to know the inner workings of this place.

text.Thanatos: I correspond with Charon all the time, but even I don't know the full extent of his responsibilities. He's an independent contractor of sorts, been here forever. Your father gives him plenty of space to work.

text.Zagreus: He must be compensated pretty well for having done this for so long. Tending the influx of new souls and all of that.

text.Thanatos: I doubt he's in it for the compensation, Zagreus. There is no Underworld without Charon. I think he knows that, and your father knows it, too.

text.Zagreus: Hey, were you ever close with Charon, Than? Seems like no matter how much I try, I can't quite get through to him.

text.Thanatos: Wouldn't be surprised if you were closer to him than I am. Not all of Nyx's sons and daughters keep in steady touch. Though at least we're not always at each others' throats, like the other side of your family.

text.Zagreus: Did he really think that far ahead...?

Than, you're not going to believe this, but... Charon's been helping me. All on his own, apparently! I was so sure that Nyx or someone put him up to it. That Skelly character I mentioned, Charon hired him!

text.Thanatos: What are you talking about, Zagreus? Just because Charon's selling you things doesn't mean he's helping you. Wait, are you sure?

text.Zagreus: I'm sure! His helper, Skelly, he's a lot more talkative, and finally let on. Although, he couldn't tell me how come Charon did a thing like this, I mean... we weren't ever close...

text.Thanatos: Hmm. All I can think of is... Charon's very dedicated to this House. Like some of us. Maybe he thought... he could help settle things, between you and your father. One way or another.

text.Zagreus: Don't think you will.

Hey, Than, now hypothetically, if I were to have vanquished Charon in single combat after having, I don't know, say, helped myself to one of his wares at no charge, how long would you say he'd hold it over me?

text.Thanatos: Everything is an exchange with Charon, Zag. If there was something you refused to pay for, then I'm going to assume that's why you're back here, now. The debt is paid in obols, or in blood. Or their closest counterparts, I guess.

text.Zagreus: Than, level with me on this. You didn't happen to hire a shifty character called Skelly to assist me here and there, did you?

text.Thanatos: Who, what? No. Why would you even ask?

text.Zagreus: Radiance, huh... doesn't sound like Father at all.
Do you remember anything else about my mother, Than? Just, anything. You weren't close, I guess?

text.Thanatos: We weren't. She kept to herself as I recall, and I would do the same. Unlike my present company, I do not ask too many questions. It was quite clear to me she wasn't from this place.

text.Zagreus: Father isn't from this place, either. How was she any different?

text.Thanatos: Sometimes I have to be reminded that Lord Hades wasn't born here, like the rest of us. But Persephone, she... she had a radiance about her, I suppose. Reminded me of the outside, but... I don't mean that in a negative respect.

text.Zagreus: Than, you don't hold a grudge against old Sisyphus, do you? He seems rather apprehensive about you. I understand you met not on the best of terms.

text.Thanatos: He is a brazen one, I have to give him that. I hadn't realized that you were close. Despite some questionable choices on your part, I don't think you're the poorest judge of character, and so... maybe I have him wrong.

text.Zagreus: I only have a faint impression of the man he used to be, although it seems he's changed a lot, since then. Thank you for understanding, anyway.
Don't think you will.

text.Thanatos: I heard you stayed the knave-king's sentence. I should be angry with you. Sisyphus must be the only mortal ever to have humiliated me. But Mother Nyx, she... must have backed you, didn't she...

text.Zagreus: We did what needed to be done. As much as Father likes making examples out of wretched shades, an eternal sentence felt a little excessive in this case. Besides... Sisyphus isn't leaving, anyway. Seems to have found his niche.

text.Thanatos: Oh? Well, he's an odd one through and through, I guess. As long as I don't have to deal with him again.

text.Zagreus: You and Achilles ever get to talk much, Than?

text.Thanatos: I have my orders, he has his. What do you think? Even back when he was still alive, there was no real chance I was going to be the one to take him here, given his line of work.

text.Zagreus: Because he was a warrior. When mortals die a violent death, they're no longer your case, are they?

text.Thanatos: No. I tend to those in less of a hurry to come here.

text.Zagreus: It is. I think it is.

text.Thanatos: Your trainer's been absent from his post, more so than usual. You voided his pact with Lord Hades, didn't you? I don't know how you did it.

text.Zagreus: You know he's more than my trainer, Than. As for how I did it, turns out being the first and only son of Hades has its privileges. Now Achilles gets to be with someone he loves. Who loves him back.

text.Thanatos: Love is common among mortals. Is theirs really so special as to be worth the trouble? Not just on your part, but theirs?
You've seen a lot of Megaera lately, haven't you, Zag?

text.Zagreus: It's not like that, Than. She's there to slow me down. Get in my way.

text.Thanatos: If you insist. Although I think it's much more complicated than you say.

text.Zagreus: Yeah... her sisters are back. They're... hard to deal with. I don't think Meg is on good terms with either one.

text.Thanatos: That's not what I meant. But fine, you've told me all I need to know, for now.

text.Zagreus: I know what you mean.
You and Meg go back a long way, don't you? I forget sometimes you two are pretty close.

text.Thanatos: Our responsibilities must have us cross paths often, yes. But I didn't really get to know her until after the whole humiliating affair with Sisyphus.

text.Zagreus: Oh, right. He got stuck in Tartarus after that, under Meg's personal supervision. So you bonded over your shared disdain for Sisyphus?

text.Thanatos: We each had to blow off some steam, yes. That was some of the hardest I ever worked, back then, and her, too, I think. When you go through something like that with someone, it brings you closer, I suppose.

text.Zagreus: ...Sure. Sounds good.
Than, there's something that I meant to tell you. Ask you, rather. You're close with Megaera, so, what I mean is... you know about us, right?

text.Thanatos: Yes, of course. Why do you ask?

text.Zagreus: Well, it's just... I figured since you deal with mortals all the time, I know that some of them, they choose a single suitor. It's a valid custom, if it's yours...!

text.Thanatos: The mortals have their customs, yes, indeed. Quite a variety, in point of fact. However, none as yet have stuck with me, I think. So don't concern yourself with things like that.

text.Zagreus: You're saying you're not angry with me? Or Meg, for that matter?

text.Thanatos: Not any more than usual. Tell her that I said hello when next you meet.

text.Zagreus: ...Yeah, well... thanks, Than.
Than, you don't take issue with me being close with Dusa, do you? She brings such warmth to this place... I really appreciate having her here.

text.Thanatos: You don't need to ask me such things, Zagreus. They're your feelings.

text.Zagreus: Than, what's your relationship with Ares on Olympus? I know he deals in death himself, but... his approach seems rather different from your own.

text.Thanatos: I do not care for his approach at all. But he has been professionally courteous with me. More than I can say for most of your Olympian relatives, I suppose.

text.Zagreus: You mean the rest of the Olympians don't treat you well?

text.Thanatos: Discounting Hermes, I should say, the rest of them have nothing much to do with me at all. I can imagine why, I know it's complicated with your father here. But as for Ares... I think he's all right.

text.Zagreus: ...Eh, you're probably right...
Than? I thought you ought to know that Ares, he... I think he's taken quite an interest in Nyx. Keeps asking me to talk to her on his behalf.

text.Thanatos: Finally. It's about time Olympus took notice of Mother and all her accomplishments.

text.Zagreus: Finally? You don't think Ares has untoward intentions or anything like that?

text.Thanatos: He'd be a hollow fool if he did. Why do you think they fear us on Olympus, Zagreus? Because of Hypnos? I don't think Mother Nyx requires your concern. Though, by all means, talk to her about it, if you like.

text.Zagreus: Least I could do for all she's done for me.

text.Thanatos: Mother Nyx told me you restored the Eldest Sigil, Zagreus. I couldn't believe that was your doing. What you did... it meant a lot to her.

text.Zagreus: It was my pleasure. Say, did Nyx ever let on to you of her relationship with Chaos, at any point?

text.Thanatos: No, not everyone is quite as sharing as you are, Zag. Nor as inclined to pry. But still... in this case, sounds like it worked out. So, thank you. If she hasn't said as much.

text.Zagreus: ...Tsch.

text.Thanatos: I can tell when Mother Nyx is upset, Zagreus. And I know better than to ask her, so I'm going to ask you. What happened?

text.Zagreus: Probably because Nyx took issue with me chatting with Dusa from time to time. Is that really so unbecoming of me? Not even Father seems to care.

text.Thanatos: Well, Mother cares! And I, for one, know better than to question it. None of us would be here were it not for her. If she has a request for you, you honor it.

text.Zagreus: You're telling me I should just start ignoring Dusa from now on, like you do?

text.Thanatos: You're a god. I'm telling you to learn to act like one.

text.Zagreus: Thanks...
I'm sorry I raised my voice with you last time, Than. I know Nyx puts so much into this place, and has nurtured so many of us here.

text.Thanatos: It's not me you should be apologizing to, Zag. Although, with Mother Nyx, sometimes it's best to leave her be. As for Dusa... I didn't mean to suggest you should abandon your friend.

text.Zagreus: Maybe you should.
Nyx let her go, Than. Dusa, I mean, she's gone. What do I do?

text.Thanatos: If I were you, I would start getting over it as soon as possible. But, I don't see you doing that. Just remember... maybe this isn't about you. Dusa's job may have been far too much for her. Mother Nyx is strict, but she is fair.

text.Zagreus: Then she should give Dusa another chance. Has Meg heard? She'll be furious.

text.Thanatos: Megaera will be no such thing. Some of us don't default to questioning every decision from our superiors.

text.Zagreus: I don't think we have to worry about that.

text.Thanatos: I saw that Dusa's back. You must have worked your ways on Mother Nyx. Don't know how you do it. Can't remember the last time I saw her budge on anything.

text.Zagreus: Nyx genuinely cares about this House and all of us. She had to come around on something like this. Dusa's one of the hardest workers here. Even if she has room to improve.

text.Thanatos: Incessant hard work can lead to trouble, Zagreus. I think maybe that's why Mother was concerned. We all know how your father can get. She doesn't need someone like Dusa taking after him.

text.Zagreus: He's like an annoying little brother to me.
Than, you know, Hypnos, he adores you. Besides just driving you to madness, now and then.

text.Thanatos: I'm rather used to the relationship, thanks, Zagreus. Seems like you got to know him pretty well.

text.Zagreus: Well, dying repeatedly can end up bringing people closer, I suppose.

text.Thanatos: I don't know what's worse, dying repeatedly or Hypnos. Although, I guess I'm grateful for your patience with him, Zag.

text.Zagreus: Probably!
Got to tell you something, Than. You can be pretty mean to Hypnos! And that's coming from someone who's mean to Hypnos a lot. Believe me, I completely understand, but... still.

text.Thanatos: He's utterly incompetent, Zag. He wouldn't even be here if Mother Nyx wasn't trying to whip him into some sort of shape.

text.Zagreus: Yeah, but... pretty much none of this would be here, were it not for Nyx, right? Anyway my point is not that you should go easy on him, but... there must be some way not to get as frustrated. You'll both be better off.

text.Thanatos: I know, it's just...! You're right. I catch myself feeling particularly horrid after talking to him. He can be very frustrating, and self-absorbed... though, I know he means well. Probably.

text.Zagreus: ...Who doesn't have room for improvement, though, right?
I can hardly believe it. Hypnos finally came out on top, huh? Even Father seemed pleased with him. That's more than I get.

text.Thanatos: I can hardly believe it either, Zagreus. But then again, he's one of Mother Nyx's offspring, so we shouldn't be so surprised. Though, I have to thank you for talking to me about him a while back...

text.Zagreus: Oh, that? I noticed you two getting along better recently. So what's your secret?

text.Thanatos: He loves lists. Doesn't do well with subtlety, so much, but spell things out for him, and he will get right on it. Long as he's awake, at least. He's still working on that part.

text.Zagreus: ...Than, wait...!

text.Thanatos: I saw you voided the old pact between Orpheus and your father. So now he gets to see his wife from time to time?

text.Zagreus: He does, and I did, Than. I think we can stand to see a little less of him if it means he can be happier for the remainder of eternity.

text.Thanatos: You really need to learn to stop meddling in others' affairs. Did either of them even ask your help? I can't imagine Orpheus did, and I'm guessing his wife's feelings were complicated, too, from what I know of the circumstances of their final meeting.

text.Zagreus: What? Orpheus is my mate, Than. And I came to know his muse, Eurydice, as well. They still had feelings for each other, but with no way to communicate.

text.Thanatos: So you decided to step in. Tsch. I think my instincts on the subject are just not the same as yours. I know your intentions were in the right place, but... you know what, forget it.

text.Zagreus: I can hazard a guess...

text.Thanatos: I saw the Fated List of Minor Prophecies was requisitioned through the House Contractor, Zagreus. Didn't take you for an agent of the Fates.

text.Zagreus: Turns out I'm full of surprises, Thanatos. Though, the Three Fates are your sisters, aren't they? Surprised you didn't requisition the List yourself.

text.Thanatos: Guess it just wasn't meant to be. Though, I don't know them at all. Keep only to themselves, somewhere. Sometimes I wonder whether everything really is preordained, or whether they're making all this up as they go.
You took Lord Hades down... you really did. I've never seen him quite like this before. I could scarce believe it when he came up through the Pool of Styx, himself...

text.Zagreus: Seemed only fair in the grand scheme of things. He slew his own parents at some point, right? I think the Fates enjoy this sort of thing.

text.Thanatos: Come on, Zag, take some credit where it's due. Though... you'll forgive me if I keep my distance for a little while, as I think you have some issues to resolve. You watch yourself.

text.Zagreus: I'll hold you to that.

text.Thanatos: ...You're really staying, Zagreus? I mean... between the generally ill-conceived attempts to reach the surface every so often.

text.Zagreus: I am. I figured it's the only way I could continue interrupting you while you try to do your job. You work too hard, Than, live a little, right?

text.Thanatos: Heh. Well then, I'll see what I can do about that. You'll have to show me what you mean by 'live a little', though.

text.Zagreus: Yeah.
Have to tell you something, Than. My birthmother... she didn't abandon me. Or at least... she didn't think she did.

text.Thanatos: She didn't think she did? What are you talking about, Zag? She left when you were born. Was never seen or spoken of again, until all this with you.

text.Zagreus: Well, it turns out... she never knew I was alive, at all. Complications when I was born. She had been struggling already here, and it was all too much, I guess. By the time Nyx brought me back... my mother was long gone.

text.Thanatos: What? But, Mother Nyx, and your father, they... could have sent for her, let her know... they must have known where she went!

text.Zagreus: Nyx knew. But, Father must have convinced her that my mother... that it would be for the best if she never found out. About me. So she could live in peace. Away from all of this. And away from Olympus.

text.Thanatos: That's... a lot to take in.
...Answer me something, Zagreus. What am I to you, exactly, as of late? Because, sometimes, with you, I...

text.Zagreus: I'm sometimes at a loss myself, Thanatos. Though one thing I know is it's always really good running into you out there, it's... well, exciting. Sparring with you and all that! And then, I know it means that I might get to see you here.

text.Thanatos: Well, here I am. But you didn't answer my question. Though, you know something? Forget I asked. I've got to go.

text.Zagreus: Hey, Than, tell me something, and forgive the awkward question here, but... are we good? I mean... between us. Any infuriating habits I should know about, that sort of thing?

text.Thanatos: You know I don't have time to list all your infuriating habits, Zagreus. Though... if any of them were outside my usual tolerance threshold, I promise to let you know, all right?

text.Zagreus: So then, we're good. Because I think we're good, but I just wanted to make sure.

text.Thanatos: We're good. See you, all right?

text.Zagreus: Definitely.

text.Thanatos: ...It just struck me how much you've changed, Zag. I still remember when you kept trying to singe Cerberus' tail with your feet. Haven't seen you do that in a while.

text.Zagreus: Oh, I definitely learned my lesson there. But, thanks, I guess. You've opened up a lot, yourself, by the way. Talking to you lately, it's a world apart from the first time. You looked like you were going to slice my head off.

text.Thanatos: It sure must have taken a lot of courage for you to come right up and tell me you thought I looked better before I cut my hair. I still ask myself how come I didn't keep ignoring you after that. Or slice your head off.

text.Zagreus: Well, the option is always available, I guess. Hey, you ever think of growing it out again?

text.Thanatos: No. It kept getting in my way. Sliced it right off and never looked back. So... plenty of personal growth all around, then?

text.Zagreus: I hope so.

text.Thanatos: How's everything been going with your mother, Zagreus? You've been pretty quiet about the whole thing, is everything all right? You can tell me.

text.Zagreus: Thank you for asking, Than. I don't know how much more I can say right now, given everything. I'm still figuring it out myself. I'm thankful you've been there to help me get to see her from time to time.

text.Thanatos: Well, if there's something more that I can do to support you in this, let me know, all right? Sounds like you're making progress, at least.

text.Zagreus: Bye, Than.

text.Thanatos: So, between us... all your attempting to break out of here, over and over... you're now authorized to keep that up? Exposing weaknesses in Underworld security, huh.

text.Zagreus: Something like that. I guess I've gotten pretty decent about escaping from a place that's known for being inescapable. Lets me keep in touch with the other side of the family. Work with you from time to time.

text.Thanatos: I have to say I never thought I'd hear you talking about looking forward to working, Zag. You feeling all right? Spending too much time on the surface, maybe?

text.Zagreus: Oh I'm feeling fine. I never thought I was much good at anything, but... if my fated purpose is to be a master of frustrating Father's efforts to make everything strictly perfect, I think I'm OK with that.

text.Thanatos: Well, then, I'll be looking forward to working with you in a more official capacity. Even if we're still supposed to keep it all under wraps, for sake of appearances. See you out there.

text.Zagreus: Oh I entirely agree with that.

text.Thanatos: Have to tell you, Zag. It's different, with your mother around here. Don't mean to be so obvious, but... it's something about your father, I suppose.

text.Zagreus: I think they have a lot of work ahead of them. As long as they're trying... he's trying... I think I'm good with that, for now. Though, I am glad she's here.

text.Thanatos: I'm beginning to think we all are. And, please don't take this the wrong way, but... I think you and your father have a lot of work ahead of you, as well.

text.Zagreus: Bye, Than.

text.Thanatos: Your mother's very clever, Zagreus. I always thought you got that from your father, now I'm not so sure. So all is well with the Olympians, again?

text.Zagreus: For now, I think it is. But, you know how they are. How we all are, I guess.

text.Thanatos: Hah! Yes, indeed. Well, then! I guess enjoy it while it lasts, as mortals sometimes say. I'll see you out there.

text.Zagreus: <Sigh>

text.Hades: Such tardiness is oft to be expected from your brother, but from you, Thanatos? You're practically the god of punctuality.

text.Thanatos: My lord, I apologize sincerely for the lapse in my performance as of late. I think my duties following the recent war above took more of a toll from me than I expected.

text.Hades: Thanatos, even we gods require rest from time to time. Someday we might get it around here, once this accursed House is well in order, finally. Until then, I appreciate your diligence. Do not overextend yourself.

text.Thanatos: Thank you, my lord. I am at your service. I'll be getting back to my assignment now.

text.Hades: ...You have been rather slow about your duties, lately, Thanatos. And I'm receiving incident reports from Tartarus involving you. Remember your responsibilities. And, remember, I am watching you. Now, get out of my sight.
You've been abetting him, Thanatos. Behind my back! Betrayal. I would ask you why. Well?

text.Thanatos: My lord, he and I... please. Go lock me up in Tartarus, or deal whichever justice you see fit, but... my loyalty is not subject to change. And I cannot stand by and watch you fight. The matter between you and Zagreus... there has to be some resolution, here.

text.Hades: You dare to lecture me? Tsch. My loyal subjects are too few of late, I think. This is your realm, not mine; I'll not cast you into that wretched pit. It's not like I have someone to replace you here, besides. Now then, begone.

text.Thanatos: I'm deeply sorry, lord...
You wished to see me once again, my lord? It's been... a while since I had an audience with you.

text.Hades: It has. The last time, what was it you said? That there must be some resolution to the matter, as you called it, with my son? Well it is settled, now. Isn't it, boy?

text.Zagreus: I mean, you're still trying just as hard as ever to prevent me from escaping past the threshold of your realm, so, I don't know if I'd exactly call the matter settled. But... it does feel different, now.

text.Hades: And so you see... I would continue in our mutual good graces, if you please. This House can only function if the upper management is in accord. What do you say?

text.Thanatos: I say, you honor me, my lord. I appreciate you telling me, yourself. And I concur that, for the good of all the Underworld, it is imperative that each of us continue to perform at our full strength.

text.Hades: Then, as you were. Dismissed.

text.Zagreus: Oh...

text.Thanatos: Hypnos, really, that is the worst idea I think I've ever heard. Do you understand how little sense that makes?

text.Hypnos: I'm just saying, maybe if you just, I don't know, had all the mortals die at the same time, it'd save you a bunch of trips, and then we'd have more time to spend together, huh?

text.Thanatos: I don't know why I bother with you, honestly. Get back to work, and let me do the same.

text.Zagreus: Oof.

text.Thanatos: You cannot keep falling asleep on the job like this, Hypnos. This is completely unacceptable.

text.Hypnos: Oh I just nodded off a little while, Thanatos! I rest easy knowing that you're here! But if I goofed, why, I guess you could kill me dead, or something, huh?

text.Thanatos: Don't give me any ideas. Pull yourself together, and quit slacking off. The House needs help, and you've got a job to do. Now get to it!

text.Zagreus: Oof, sorry Hypnos.

text.Thanatos: ...Hypnos, this list has a bunch of tasks from I don't know how long ago, I mean... I took several of these last year! And you've already submitted this week's registrations, why isn't that marked complete?

text.Hypnos: Don't you know it, I was just about to get to that! Then you showed up, and I got so distracted, it just kind of slipped my mind! It happens, right?

text.Thanatos: You need to focus, Brother. Or it'll be Lord Hades reprimanding you again, and that is not something you want.

text.Hypnos: Oh, I don't know about that, last time I talked to Master he made pretty clear he never wanted to speak to me again!
Don't worry, I won't!

text.Thanatos: Hypnos, you're not irreplaceable, you understand? If you don't shape up, quickly, someone else is going to have your job.

text.Hypnos: Oh I hear you loud and clear, Thanatos! And, let me tell you, they will have the greatest job in all the Underworld!

text.Thanatos: I feel like I'm not getting through to you, Brother. Well, after the inevitable happens, don't come telling me I didn't try.
If that'll be all?
...Well, how often do you consult these lists you make? If you're spending too much time just making lists, you're not leaving time to get anything done.

text.Hypnos: Oh, I love making my lists... I always illustrate the edges, each one is unique! That way anyone who gets to review the work, it's a whole experience, you know? But... I guess it does take up a lot of time.

text.Thanatos: You'll have to work around the constraints of your responsibilities. You do take breaks, don't you? Before and after each break, maybe that's a time to make sure your own list of priorities is up-to-date.

text.Hypnos: Wait, my own list of priorities...? But, you're saying I can just go and make a list... for me? Huh. Whoa. Whoa....
Aww, thanks!

text.Zagreus: Good work, Hypnos!

text.Thanatos: I've heard that your reports have been immaculate of late, Hypnos. I have to know, who's helping you with them? It can't be Zagreus.

text.Hypnos: Oh, haha, no, he doesn't help. It's just I took to listing only the important stuff up top, and spending just a bit more time on the priority reports, and... guess it's working out!

text.Thanatos: Look, whatever the case... the work's improved. It's been observed. You ought to keep it up.

text.Hypnos: Huh, that is right!

text.Thanatos: ...Though, what I mean to say is, that... I'm sorry, Hypnos. You're my brother, but I haven't always treated you that way. Would you be willing to forgive me?

text.Hypnos: Aww, come on, Thanatos, are you kidding me, right here? We're like two skeletons in a crypt! You're the best, and you're always looking out for me. Even when you're not around for what can seem like aeons at a time!

text.Thanatos: Well let's not get ahead of ourselves, here. We each have got important jobs to do. Isn't that right, Brother?

text.Hypnos: Will do!

text.Zagreus: Hey, he did it.

text.Thanatos: ...Congratulations, Brother! I saw you finally made the board. You made us proud.

text.Hypnos: Sure did! That's something, huh? Though, sorry Thanatos, can't really chat right now, the shades are stacking up, there's greetings to be done, and sign-ins... lots of work to do, you know?

text.Thanatos: I definitely know the feeling. Well then, let's keep it up, the both of us, all right?

text.Nyx: Farewell.

text.Thanatos: Mother, is there something I can do to help, with all of this? I spend too much time away from the House. Please, let me know.

text.Nyx: You are already doing what you can to help, my son. Continue doing so. Matters are at stake here concerning you and all of us. Your support and choices in this shape the outcome that shall come to pass.

text.Thanatos: I understand, and I will do my best. Thank you for taking care of everything. I've every faith in you, Mother. And in this House. Farewell.

text.Nyx: Thank you, my son.

text.Zagreus: Heh.

text.Thanatos: Am I imagining it, Mother, or has this House been running relatively smoothly as of late? Although I know I must be tempting the Three Fates by putting it like this.

text.Nyx: It is through a concerted effort that the House thus thrives, for now. Though, it shall do so only through continued diligence on your behalf, and that of many others here. It is a good occasion to take brief reprieve. But we need you working to the best of your ability, here, Thanatos.

text.Thanatos: Well... know that I am ever-grateful, Mother. And I love you very much. Where would we be right now if not for you? I don't take what you've done for us for granted, nor does anybody here. You rest assured.

text.Megaera: ...But that was then and this is now, and we have work to do.... Uh, anyway, Than, I think we'd best continue this discussion at some other time.

text.Thanatos: You're interrupting private conversation, Zagreus. Leave us.

text.Megaera: No, let him stay, if that's what he wants. What does it matter? He's technically allowed within these halls, but he must know he isn't welcome anymore.

text.Persephone: I know how mortals hate waiting around!

text.Thanatos: Queen Persephone. All of us, we are most pleased you're back. If there is anything that I can do to ease your acclimation to this House, you need but ask.

text.Persephone: Why, thank you, Thanatos! I'll take you up on that if I can think of anything anytime soon. But my, you've grown! I understand you've been looking after my son, in the meantime?

text.Thanatos: Your son, he... is very capable of looking after himself, it turns out. Although I try to be there, just in case. Though, I must beg your pardon, Queen. Someone awaits me on the surface now.

text.Persephone: All right!

text.Thanatos: ...I thank you for your blessings, Queen Persephone. Your son and I... we always were quite close, but through all this ordeal, we've become rather inseparable, I think.

text.Persephone: Well, I can see that he has better taste than I do, Thanatos! I have a sense of how industrious you are. You just take care of yourself, please. And take care of each other, too, all right?

text.Thanatos: As you will, Queen. I mean, all right.
Sorry, Zagreus, I have to go. Lots of assignments as of late. Too bad I can't be everywhere at once.
No use in making idle chat, right, Zagreus?
I have a job to do, and you've no interest in remaining here. See you around out there.
Don't bother, Zagreus. I was just leaving.
I hope you've thought through all of this. For both our sakes.
I can't keep bailing you out each time you get in over your head.
I have to say it's quite a mess you've gotten yourself into, Zagreus.
You better know what you're doing.
You're wasting your time. Just go.
Shouldn't you be back out there by now, getting yourself killed?
You know how much trouble I am getting myself into here?
There's nothing left for us to talk about.
Don't talk to me. Just go.
Excuse me, I've got work to do.
Not now, I have to go.
I don't know what you want from me.
I have to get back to my responsibilities.
You are in so much trouble.
You watch yourself out there.
Take care of yourself.
I'll see you out there, I guess.
I hope all this is worth it.
We'll meet again out there.
I hope you know what you're doing.
Can't talk right now, I have to get to work.
I need to get to work. I'll see you later.
Your father's going to have my hide.
I am in so much trouble, you have no idea...
What have I gotten myself into, Zag...
Much as I would like to stay and chat, I'd better go.
Zag, I've got so many mortals on my plate right now...
See you out there soon enough, all right?
If you stay out too long, I'm going to track you down.
Sounds like we've both been keeping plenty busy as of late.
Now that you're here, I can finally head out.
We'll have to catch up more some other time.
Sorry Zag, I'm due to get a bunch of mortals now.
Excuse me, Zag, just got word that I'm needed back up top.
Hope your father's going to be all right with all of this.
We showed those wretches last time, didn't we.
Good running into you out there, and glad you made it out.
Impressive that you went the distance once again.
Was good having an opportunity to back you up out there.
I heard you did good work out there last time.
The shades are murmuring about your latest exploits, Zag.
Don't have a lot of time for catching up right now, here, Zag.
You're not in too much of a hurry, are you, Zag?
Well then... some mortal up there's lived a good, long life.
Mind if I practice my ability to shift short distances with someone else?
Well... I'd say that test was a success, wouldn't you?
I have to shift away from here, though if you'd care to join me...
Too bad I can't just shift you to the top, though this wasn't so bad.
Hey let's get out of here for just a bit, all right?
Whew. Thanks for the break, now back to it, I guess.
Was just about to go on break, if you would care to join me.
Good catching up. Take care of yourself, Zag.
I think you'd better head back to your quarters, Zagreus.
Mm. I'd best get back to my responsibilities for now.

text.Megaera: This is a private chat, if you'll excuse us, Zag.

text.Thanatos: We'll see you later out there, Zagreus.
