Just catching up on things with Megaera here, Zag.

text.Megaera: We were just talking about you, Zagreus.
Well if it isn't our mutual friend.

text.Thanatos: Enjoy the peace and quiet with us, Zag.

text.Megaera: Just catching up with Thanatos, if you don't mind.

text.Thanatos: Discussing work-related matters, Zagreus.

text.Megaera: Look who it is, Than. Zagreus.

text.Thanatos: We've been comparing notes about our latest tasks.

text.Megaera: We're in the middle of a conversation, Zag.

text.Thanatos: Catch up with you some other time, all right?

text.Hypnos: Bye!!

text.Thanatos: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Bye now!

text.Thanatos: ...Plenty of time for sleeping once your shift is over, right, Brother?

text.Hypnos: See you!

text.Thanatos: ...Heard your latest reports were looking good, Hypnos. You keep it up.

text.Hypnos: So long!

text.Thanatos: ...Anyway, good catching up, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: OK!

text.Thanatos: ...That's the last of the new registrations, but I should have more soon.

text.Hypnos: Great!!

text.Thanatos: ...All right, I'd better get going. Take care, Brother.

text.Hypnos: Yep!

text.Thanatos: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.

text.Hypnos: Haha, yeah!

text.Thanatos: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.

text.Nyx: Farewell.
...We have another task for you.

text.Thanatos: As you will, Mother. It will be done immediately, then.

text.Nyx: Very well.

text.Thanatos: ...Understood, Mother. Commencing the assignment now.

text.Nyx: ...Your expertise is needed once again.

text.Thanatos: Then, very well, Mother. I'll begin right away, and be back soon.

text.Nyx: Indeed.

text.Thanatos: ...I hear you, Mother, and obey. I will return when the task is complete.

text.Nyx: Then, go.

text.Thanatos: Thank you for thinking of me for this task. I'll make it happen shortly.

text.Nyx: Thank you, my son.

text.Thanatos: ...The task is clear to me, Mother. I go. Your will be done.
...It shall be as you say, my lord. I will report back soon.
...Yes, my lord. I will begin, and not return until the deed is done.
...If that is all, my lord, then I will make way for the surface now.
...I understand, my lord. I know where they are and soon shall bring them here.
...I do appreciate your faith in me, my lord. Begging your pardon, please.
...This matter will be dealt with promptly, lord. I expect to return shortly.

text.Zagreus: It isn't much, Than, but I got you something.

text.Thanatos: You want me to take that off your hands, fine. But you are taking this from me, and if anybody asks, we're even. Or, scratch that, don't tell anyone about this, understand?
What, really...? Come on, what is this, Zagreus. You think handing this to me makes up for everything you've put us through?

text.Zagreus: It's just something I found out there that I thought you might like, Than. Don't think anything of it.

text.Thanatos: Why bother with such empty gestures, Zag. You've said you're getting out of here; best focus on that and leave me be.

text.Zagreus: It's not an empty gesture, Than. Besides, if I wasn't trying to stay focused, I'd be drinking it myself.

text.Thanatos: You shouldn't be doing this, Zag. You picked sides, and things are not the same. A momentary stab at thoughtfulness can't fix something like that.

text.Zagreus: We've been through a lot, Than, and I think we'll be going through a lot more yet. Consider it a token of our kinship.

text.Thanatos: Don't know what you're expecting, giving this to me. If there's a catch here, I don't want to know.

text.Zagreus: We've been through a lot, Than, and I think we'll be going through a lot more yet. Consider it a token of our kinship.

text.Thanatos: What is it with the generosity lately...? Look I'll just stash this with the rest if you really don't have a better thing to do with it than dump it off on me.

text.Zagreus: Hey, that's an idea. One of these days or nights, we'll have enough of this stuff to throw a feast to make all of Olympus jealous.

text.Thanatos: You can't be serious. You're serious...? Eh, you know what, fine. I'll take this and we'll go about our business. Though I don't see why you bother.

text.Zagreus: Why I bother? Why, how else can I show you how I feel except by handing you these bottles from time to time?
Hey Than. For all the times you've bailed me out, and just, all the times you've been around for me... I thought I'd get you this. The real thing.

text.Thanatos: Ambrosia...! Zagreus, where did you even... don't you think this is a bit excessive?

text.Zagreus: You say that like it's a bad thing. Little bit of excess from time to time never hurt anyone I'm sure.

text.Thanatos: Oh, you would be surprised. Though if you're going to embarrass me, you know what, I am going to reciprocate. Behold!

text.Zagreus: Yeah, but I wanted to!
For you, Thanatos. The Olympians might be accustomed to this stuff but I think we should have our share of it down here. At least you should.

text.Thanatos: You know... the Olympians do have good taste in certain things. The last bottle you gave me... it was... better than expected. Though, I almost decided not to try it at all.

text.Zagreus: But try it you did! And now, you'll get to try this one for comparison's sake. Each one's supposed to be different you know.

text.Thanatos: Different, huh. Well, then, I guess I'll have to see what you mean by that. Thank you, Zag. You didn't have to do this.

text.Zagreus: Than, wait...!
I hope you're ready for some more of the real thing, there, Than, because I got you some, and I won't be taking 'Tsch, what is this, Zag' for an answer.

text.Thanatos: Ugh, what is this? Come on, already, Zagreus, are you just messing with me, now? How did you even manage to get more of this, much less decide to hand it off to me?

text.Zagreus: In order: no, I'm not; by ransacking my father's realm repeatedly; and it's because I like you, Thanatos. In case you still have some misgivings about that.

text.Thanatos: You like me, Zagreus...? I never thought, I... don't know why that sounds so strange, coming from you. Given everything that's happened as of late.

text.Zagreus: Yeah. Look, if you don't feel the same way about me at this point, I would rather know. Cease all these coy gift exchanges, and all that.

text.Thanatos: I never said anything like that! You know what, there's... a bunch of mortals I have to go fetch. Good-bye.

text.Zagreus: You too.
Thanatos, I wanted to apologize for the last time I approached you with a bottle of the real thing, and give the whole exchange another shot. Would that be all right?

text.Thanatos: Hmph! You're asking my consent to give me yet another lavish gift? Sure! Permission granted. Though, what makes you think that your approach this time is going to be any more successful than the last?

text.Zagreus: I don't know that it will. I never really know exactly where I stand with you. But I know how I feel. And I'd rather be up front with you, even if it means risking our relationship, such as it is.

text.Thanatos: Our relationship? It wasn't long ago you were prepared to throw it all away while making for the surface, if you don't recall. But now you're saying that you care for me, and... what, exactly, Zagreus?

text.Zagreus: Yes, that's what I'm saying, Than. I should not have left the way I did, without letting you know. But when you found me, I... think that's when... that's when I knew. Or started to realize, you know?

text.Thanatos: I... yes. I know, I think, because... when I heard you took off, the anger that I felt, it was... it wasn't something I expected. So... ungh. What do we do now?

text.Zagreus: Maybe we ought to take our time? Unlike the real thing there, that's a commodity we have in good supply. Just know that, if you feel the way I do... you know where to find me. And if not... I'm grateful, anyway.

text.Thanatos: ...I see. Well, then. The best that I can say for now is that... I'm grateful, too, for this. Take care of yourself, Zag.

CHOICE.Thanatos: I have to hand it to you, Zag, you're really putting in the work to get me to forgive you after all you've done. I'm honestly surprised.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Don't be. That feast of ours is really going to be something, Than.
Guess Than must be at work.
What, Thanatos, is this... you're really giving Mort to me? I... I'm deeply honored!

text.Nyx: Farewell.

text.Thanatos: Mother, is there something I can do to help, with all of this? I spend too much time away from the House. Please, let me know.

text.Nyx: You are already doing what you can to help, my son. Continue doing so. Matters are at stake here concerning you and all of us. Your support and choices in this shape the outcome that shall come to pass.

text.Thanatos: I understand, and I will do my best. Thank you for taking care of everything. I've every faith in you, Mother. And in this House. Farewell.

CHOICE.Thanatos: Life and death, one and the same.
Quite a mess you've made here, Zagreus.
Looks like I got here just in time.
I thought I'd find you here.
It's been a little while, hasn't it?
I happened to be in the area.
You wretches are coming with me.
You might want to stand back, there, Zag.
Think you can beat me, Zag?
Can you deal death faster than I?
What say we get things started.
I'll send you to the lowest depths.
All of you, prepare to die again.
You brazen wretches ought to have turned back!
Come, wretches, and be returned to dust!
Who wants to be the first to die again?
You so-called champions could use a lesson in humility.
All in Elysium should know of us by now.
Let's see how quickly we can wrap this up.
I doubt this will take very long at all.
They're coming, Zagreus. Be on your guard.
Think you can beat me again, Zag?
What do you say we end this quickly, Zag?
Scared I'll take more of them than you this time?
All of you, prepare to die again.
Here they come, fresh for the taking, Zag.
Don't be too reckless to outpace me, Zagreus.
You wretches never seem to learn, do you.

CHOICE.Zagreus: Or I'll slay you instead if you prefer!
Lesson one: Don't mess with either one of us!
No doubt at all from me.
I'll get right on it, Than!
I say: Sure, Than, sounds good to me.
I'll be as reckless as I want!

CHOICE.Thanatos: Not if I can help it.
One of your friends, there, Zag?
Why ask for help from him?
I told you to get out!
Get out while you still can.
That was the last of them.
This won't go on the record.
You're clear of them for now.
We'll leave no trace of this.
And that's the end of that.
Let's call this one a draw.
You got as many as I did.
All right, all right, you got me.
Here, since you did all the work.
Guess you had this well in hand.
How did you get so fast?
That was embarrassing for me I have to say.
Save some for me next time.
You took more down than I did.
Got more of them than I did, huh.
You held your own out there.
You held your own I guess.
You're not too bad at this.
You're fast, I'll give you that.
You earned this fair and square.
You got a lot of them.
I'll take more down next time.
Hang on to this for me.

text.Thanatos: ...Thought you could just get away from me, did you?

text.Zagreus: Thanatos. I figured it was only a matter of time before Father sent you after me to do his dirty work.

text.Thanatos: Zagreus. Is that really why you think I'm here? Let's see how many of these exalted champions you can send back to their dooms, unless you'd rather I would send you back to yours.
Barely caught up with you, here, Zag. You must have had a little help from Hermes, I suppose.
You have the butterfly I gave to you. Stay back, then, and it'll make you stronger once I'm finished here.
Got little Mort with you, there, huh. Well, there's no need to summon me this time.
You're back. I thought you made it out. No matter.
Good to be working with you in a more official capacity, Zag. Shall we get started?
Thought I might find you all the way out here. Although, quite frankly, I'm surprised you're still alive.

text.Zagreus: I can hold my own in case you haven't noticed, Than.

text.Thanatos: I haven't, Zag! Now, stand back, and let me show you how it's done.
Still at it, I see. You're stubborn. And you are going to get me in a heap of trouble before all is said and done.
How about another of our little contests, Zagreus?
We'll have to catch up at some other time. Though good to see you anyway.
I have a feeling this is not going to take much time at all.
I only have a little time until my next assignment, but this shouldn't take too long.
Thought I might stop by and check up on this corner of the Underworld, Zag.
You've come this far, now let's make sure you go the distance, Zag.
I heard there was a matter that required my attention here.
Had a feeling I would find you all alone out here.
Want to stand back and watch me work, here, Zag?
This one is off the record, Zagreus. Come on!
Looks like we've got an urgent work-related matter to attend to.
Your father's forces making trouble for you, Zag?
Not a word of this to anyone back home, you hear me, Zagreus?
I heard you got yourself into another mess that needed cleaning up.
We'll catch up later, now let's deal with these wretches and be done.
Hope you don't mind if I cut in, here, Zagreus.
What say we go take care of business here just like we used to, Zag?
I can't stay long, so how about we get this business over with.
Figured you'd be up to have another of our little contests. Now let's go.
What do you say we deal some death together, Zagreus?
Don't have much time, but let me see if I can pitch in.
Remember, not a word of this, to anyone. Let's go.
You look like you could use a hand.
Let's see who's better at this, Zagreus.
I got the feeling you could use some backup here.
Let's get this done.
Good, I'm not too late. Got here as quickly as I could.
I got the message that you need assistance, Zagreus?

text.Zagreus: <Sigh>

text.Thanatos: You left, without so much as telling me good-bye. I suppose you knew I'd catch up with you sooner or later, is that it? No escaping death, and all?

text.Zagreus: I left when it was necessary, Than. I thought of you and hoped you'd understand. I have to do this.

text.Thanatos: That's more motivation than I've ever heard from you. Well, if you won't say it, I'll say it. Good-bye, Zagreus.
I've got to hand it to you, Zag. You're easy to track down. The shades of Tartarus are beginning to fear you even more than your Lord Father.

text.Zagreus: Oh they won't fear me once they get to know me.

text.Thanatos: I'm not so sure about that. Even I'm beginning to fear you, I think. Seems I don't know you as well as I thought.

text.Zagreus: I don't know what I'm supposed to say when he gets like this...

text.Thanatos: What's with the look? You had your hands full, now you don't thanks to me... Tsch, seems I'm left to thanking myself, since you're too proud to do it.
You seemed a little winded, there, no? Not even close to the surface, yet, either.

text.Zagreus: Thanks for the vote of confidence there, Than.

text.Thanatos: You're very welcome. Now, I'd better get back, before Lord Hades catches on to this.

text.Zagreus: I told you I don't need your help here, Thanatos.

text.Thanatos: It wasn't being offered. Just happened to be in the area is all. Carry on, Zagreus.
Still running from yourself, I see. How's that been working out for you thus far?

text.Zagreus: I'm searching for my mother. You still live at home with yours. You don't know what it's like.

text.Thanatos: Mother Nyx was like a mother to you, too. And this is how you repay her. You should be ashamed of yourself, and learn your place.

Listen to me. I don't know how else to put this, but, I want you to come home. Voluntarily. It's not just you swept up in all this nonsense now. And, I know you didn't ask for me to get involved, but, what did you expect?

text.Zagreus: ...Than. Home is never going to be the same for me. There's no use trying to pretend. I have to go.

text.Thanatos: You don't have to do anything of the sort. You have no idea how good you've had it here. Maybe someday you'll come to understand.

text.Zagreus: It is all right. Thanks, Than.

text.Thanatos: Outdid me once again, there, huh. Tsch. I have to admit, you're not as bad at all of this as I expected. First I found you, I was certain that you had no chance at all.

text.Zagreus: I seem to have this whole easy-to-underestimate thing about me, based on a decent sum of my relationships. In any case, I always welcome your appearances out here. I know it's not been easy for you, Than.

text.Thanatos: That's fair as an assessment, I would say. But then again, it's never been an easy time for me. I know I have to do my job. But I don't have to keep on helping you, like this.

text.Zagreus: ...What, you're telling me this is it? You're just going to leave me to my own devices, then, I've proved myself to you, something like that?

text.Thanatos: No, you deadbeat, I am telling you the opposite! Why do you think I keep on showing up? You may not really need me, Zagreus, but I will take these opportunities to help. I take it that's all right.

text.Zagreus: Accurate.

text.Thanatos: Good to see you taking little Mort there on one of your strolls. Means I can better keep an eye on you out there.

text.Zagreus: He's been great to have around, for sure. Still can't believe you found him after all this time! You used to always carry him around, I was so sad for you when he got lost.

text.Thanatos: And I cannot believe you still remember that. Regardless, he will not be getting lost again under your supervision, accurate?

text.Zagreus: You too.
About when we last spoke. I care about you, Thanatos. A lot. Though, you asked what you are to me... how am I supposed to even answer that?

text.Thanatos: Ugh, I don't know. Sometimes I miss not feeling anything. Can't always trust what feelings say. I get to thinking, are we only friends, or... look, this is embarrassing.

text.Zagreus: To think discussing feelings would be even harder than annihilating Father's forces. But... I've been asking myself the same thing, Than. If it's any reassurance.

text.Thanatos: Well, if you come up with any answers, I guess let me know. Good running into you.

text.Zagreus: I'm glad you did, though, Than.

text.Thanatos: Hey. I didn't mean to lay the guilt on you for what you did for Orpheus, Zag. I just worry when we get involved... we can make matters worse.

text.Zagreus: You haven't ever made anything worse, Than. But as for me, I realized what you meant. I was so eager to do something for Orpheus when I first met Eurydice, I... never asked them if it was OK.

text.Thanatos: At least things turned out well for them. But that was fortunate. Family troubles, personal relations, and the like... it's sensitive business. Though, who am I to talk. You didn't ask me to show up, like this.

text.Zagreus: All right.
Hey, Than, are you OK? I mean, with everything, lately?

text.Thanatos: I am. Though, thanks for asking, Zag. The risk of being close with anyone is sometimes things get complicated, fast. Admittedly it's not a risk I often take, but... in your case, it's been worth it, all in all. We're good, all right?

text.Zagreus: I know what you mean.

text.Thanatos: What are you doing back here, Zag? You made it out.

text.Zagreus: I did... but I had to come back. And, not exactly voluntarily. I'll be visiting up there from time to time, though... it looks like I'll be staying here.

text.Thanatos: Visiting from time to time...? I don't understand.

text.Zagreus: It's my mother. She's alive and well! It's just that I can't stay with her up there for very long! So we'll have to catch up... one visit at a time.

text.Thanatos: I see. Well then... that's good. That's good, because... it means that I won't have to track you down up top. Because, between us, I can only take so much of it up there.

CHOICE.Thanatos: You going to help or what?
I'm not your foe here, Zag.
Not going to fight you, Zag.
Give me some room to work!
Let me take care of this.
Don't waste this chance you have!

text.Dusa: Oh! The Prince himself, you, want to talk to me...? Me?! Oh, wow, oh wow!!

text.Zagreus: I, uh, just wanted to say, the lounge looks wonderful, as good as new. Better! Hope it's not been too much trouble patching up.

text.Dusa: I, I, I, aah, I have to clean the rafters, I...!
Oh! The Prince himself, you, want to talk to me...? Me?! Oh, wow, oh wow!!

text.Zagreus: I, uh, just wanted to say, don't bother picking up my room today. I'm headed out for a while.

text.Dusa: I, I, I, aah, I have to clean the rafters, I...!
I, ah, hope you're having a nice stay! Even though you don't want to live here anymore, Your Highness!

text.Zagreus: Erm... good-bye.
Erm, Dusa? Turns out that I may be stopping back from time to time, like this. But, please don't bother picking up my room. I won't be staying long.

text.Dusa: Oh, hahaha, sure! But I'll just keep an eye on things in there, from time to time, in case you change your mind, um, so, good-bye!
Um, Prince? Your father, I, I think he's pretty steamed right now, about something, so, maybe you could stay away from him? Or... I could tell him you're not here?

text.Zagreus: That's quite all right, Dusa. I'm not afraid of him, and neither should you be. You're the best help he's ever found.

text.Dusa: Just, ah, just doing my job, here, Prince...!
Oh, um, so, hi Prince! So, is there anything I can get you, or maybe tidy up some more, or... I just thought maybe you'd like something to drink? Sometime?

text.Zagreus: Oh! A drink sometime sounds wonderful, Dusa, maybe tomorrow assuming I'm not getting out of here by then...?

text.Dusa: Whaa, I mean, it's no big deal, I mean, forget I asked, or anything, I'm sorry, bye!

Uh, um, I just, wanted to apologize, because, I think maybe I didn't act very appropriately last time you spoke to me? But I just really, really like this job, and promise I will always do my very best, so, I just hope I'll have another chance?

text.Zagreus: Dusa, please, there's no need to apologize! You've been doing a wonderful job, really!

text.Dusa: I... what? You really mean it, Prince, I... thank you, thanks so much!!

text.Zagreus: Bye for now.

text.Dusa: Oh, um, hi, Your Highness? I, just wanted you to know, that if you do get out, I, we are going to miss you. Around here. OK? So, bye...!

text.Zagreus: Bye for now.
Erm, Ms. Dusa, I wanted to, uh, cordially invite you to an outing in the lounge? Remember when you asked me about a drink?

text.Dusa: Aaah! Oh, oh, oh, really, what you mean, right now, you're... I... I guess I'm overdue to take a break...

...And, well, since I don't exactly fit the mold of your traditional gorgon, I mean, I have no body for example, I had trouble finding work! That is until Lord Hades took me in, and then, I met you, and, well, I just love this job!!

text.Zagreus: Oh! I can definitely relate at least to some of that.

text.Dusa: <Sigh> I, I, I, thanks, Your Highness. Prince. Prince Zagreus!
Oh...
Um, P-Prince, the way you look so sad sometimes, when you come back in here, out of the Pool of Styx? Is everything OK? Because if there was something I could do...

text.Zagreus: Oh, it's nothing for you to be concerned about, Dusa. I'm just having a harder time fighting my blasted way out of this place than I anticipated. If you'll excuse my language.

text.Dusa: Oh, I... this is silly, but, I'd no idea anybody could beat you, I mean, the Prince? Greater than the mighty Achilles, more cunning than his father, faster than Hermes! But... you're just struggling, like me?

text.Zagreus: I am. And that stuff you heard about me isn't true.
Isn't there something I can do to help...?

text.Dusa: ...sorted the cutlery, wiped the counters, replaced the candles, did the dishes, swept the floor, inspected the barrels, let's see what else, oh!! The Prince, it's you!

text.Zagreus: It's me! Dusa, I'm impressed you're able to manage this whole lounge all by yourself. How do you do it, what's your secret?

text.Dusa: Hahaha, secret? I'm two weeks behind schedule with this place, at least! Fortunately, no one here seems very good at keeping time, so, no one's gotten on my case just yet, but... oh, you aren't going to tell, are you?

text.Zagreus: Of course not. What's behind schedule, though? This place doesn't seem any worse for wear than usual.

text.Dusa: Well, that's just it! Miss Nyx, she tasked me with a pretty big project a while back, to make this place worthy of the name, which means... there's so much left to do, I need to get everything ready, please, excuse me, Prince!

text.Zagreus: She's running herself ragged.

text.Dusa: ...patch up the seating, update the menu, clean the stove, stock the honor bar, sweep the rug, dust the rafters, mop the flooring, pay the broker, oh!! Um, sorry, Prince, way behind on my assignment, so if you'll excuse me, please...?

text.Zagreus: Dusa, wait, before you fly away... there must be something I can do, to help pitch in with everything? Doesn't matter how good you are at your job, what you're describing, that's more than one individual can handle!

text.Dusa: Your Highness, please! I know you mean well, but I have this! Wish everybody wouldn't doubt me all the time, like that House Contractor, just gets to stand around, waiting for work orders! Unless they come from me, then nooo.

text.Zagreus: The House Contractor isn't cooperating with you, huh. No wonder so many lounge renovations are clogged up in the works. Though maybe I can grease the wheels a bit?

text.Dusa: AAH, I completely forgot!! I need to get more cooking grease for the Head Chef! I have to go!!

text.Zagreus: Just trying to help...?

text.Dusa: ...patch up the seating, update the menu, clean the stove, stock the honor bar, sweep the rug, dust the rafters, mop the flooring, pay the broker, oh!! Um, sorry, Prince, way behind on my assignment, so if you'd excuse me, please...?

text.Zagreus: Dusa, wait, before you fly away... there must be something I can do, to help pitch in with everything? Doesn't matter how good you are at your job, what you're describing, that's more than one individual can handle!

text.Dusa: Your Highness, please! I know you mean well, but I have this! Wish everybody wouldn't doubt me all the time, like that House Contractor, just gets to stand around, waiting for work orders! Unless they come from me, then nooo.

text.Zagreus: Ooh, that might be my fault. I've been giving the Contractor lots of work. Some of those lounge orders must be coming from you, right? This place is really shaping up!

text.Dusa: Wha-wha, wait, then you're the one who's been authorizing all these improvements?! Oh my, oh my, aaaah!

text.Zagreus: I'm looking forward!
The lounge is really starting to look nice lately, Dusa! All your hard work is really paying off!

text.Dusa: Hah! Why, thank you, Prince, it's just that, lately, the House Contractor's been slightly more agreeable I guess, working a little faster, maybe, but there's still a lot we have to do, so, you just wait!

text.Zagreus: Take care now!

text.Dusa: Um, Prince Zagreus...? I just wanted to say something, if you have a little time? I know you're really busy... I can come back.

text.Zagreus: Wait, no, now's fine, of course, what is it, Dusa? I'm not so busy, by the way, and always happy to check in. Wait, is something wrong?

text.Dusa: No, nononono, it is just the opposite, I... can't believe you helped me, with the lounge. I don't think anyone has ever helped me out like you did, cleaning up after Cerberus, and the new rug, and the kitchen, and, just, all of this!

text.Zagreus: It was my pleasure, really. All of us use the lounge, don't we? This House can really be a lot, but in the lounge here, things are easier a bit, I think. I'm so glad we have you watching over it.

text.Dusa: Y, you really mean that, Prince...? But you don't know what this means to me. I'm finally caught up on work! W, what am I going to do? I, I don't know what I'm going to do with all this extra time! I have to go, and plan everything out!!

text.Zagreus: Bye, Dusa.

text.Dusa: Um, Zagreus? I wanted to talk some more, if you're available? I mean, if you're free. I mean! If you have time to right now. Is that OK?

text.Zagreus: Of course, Dusa! Where should we chat? The lounge, or maybe somewhere more private...?

text.Dusa: Somewhere more private, please, if that's OK? Thank you.
...Um, Zagreus... so, ever since you told me you had feelings for me, it's been, like... my whole mind is on fire. I haven't been able to think straight, or get anything done. It's all been so much!

text.Zagreus: I'm sorry, Dusa, I... put a lot on you, and... maybe I shouldn't have, since I'm the Prince and everything, as you point out, and... sometimes, I forget myself. I'd never pressure you, it's just... I thought you had these feelings for me, too.

text.Dusa: I do have feelings for you, silly! That's what I've been trying to tell you, it's just... it's just...

text.Zagreus: It's just what...? Whatever it is, it's OK. You can be yourself with me, Dusa, I promise.

text.Dusa: I'm glad you put it that way. I... I'm not looking for an intimate relationship. You're the kindest soul in this whole House. And I have learned so much from you! But, when I really think about my feelings... I'm just, not attracted to you, in that way. I'm sorry. You're a really nice guy!

text.Zagreus: Oh, hahaha, look, there's nothing to apologize for, not at all. In fact... all this is a relief. I've learned a lot from you, too, and I cherish our friendship for what it is. Do you... do you think that we could still be friends? Or, is it better that you didn't see me anymore...?

text.Dusa: Don't say that! Though, I was going to ask you the same thing. I'd really like it if you'd be my friend! Though, my career comes first, so... I don't want you doing any special favors, promise me? I need to see how far I can get on my own.

text.Zagreus: I respect that so much, and yes, I promise, Dusa. So, well, then... friends? For all eternity?

text.Dusa: Yes. Friends. For all eternity. Now... I had better go. See you, OK?
Hey, Zagreus, I... wanted to talk to you again, I... what I mean is, I just, hope I didn't hurt your feelings, because, if I did, you'd let me know, wouldn't you?

text.Zagreus: Dusa, please! Remember friends for all eternity? That's a long time, so, there's no need for second guessing. I'm glad we had a chance to talk.

text.Dusa: Oh, well, good! That's a relief to hear, but... one last thing, so I can clear my conscience of it, I... I've saved all the Ambrosia that you gave me, and I figured since... I didn't realize, you know, the way you felt? I can be a little dense! I have it here. And I would like to give it back. Is that OK?

text.Zagreus: I... look, if you don't want the Ambrosia anymore, and receiving it made you feel uncomfortable in any way, I'll take it back. It was my gift to you, to do with as you please. Are you sure you don't want it?

text.Dusa: Yes, I'm sure, and thank you for your understanding, Prince. It really was quite sweet of you, but it's important that I learn to stock the lounge myself. So, here you go, and I will see you soon, OK?

text.Zagreus: Hey, now, there's no need to do anything rash like that! That Ambrosia was my gift to you, and it was unconditional. Just try the stuff and see! They say the purer the act of giving, the better it is. Won't you keep it? If not for yourself, then for the lounge?

text.Dusa: Ah, all right, I... had to ask, so, thanks again. Just wanted to make sure! I hope we can enjoy it at the lounge sometime!! I'd better go put it away. Not drink it! Store it for safe keeping, now, OK?

Hey, um, Zagreus? I wanted to say, that was very sweet of you, letting me hang onto all that Ambrosia you gave me before? It's in safe keeping now! Except one bottle... that kind of slipped, and broke. Though that did mean I got to try the stuff!

text.Zagreus: Oh, you got to try it, after all? What did you think, all it's cracked up to be?

text.Dusa: It was amazing. I've never had anything like it! It's so good to have a forked tongue, meant I could taste it twice at the same time! So, um... if one of the other bottles slipped and broke... you wouldn't mind, would you?

text.Zagreus: Ah, thank you, Dusa.

Dusa, I can't shake this feeling, so I wanted to apologize to you, because... I think when we first met, I just... I don't think I took it the right way. I never had a fan before! I wanted to live up to your idea of me.

text.Dusa: Oh, Prince, Zagreus, don't worry about that! Even I didn't know what I was going through. When I first started working here, I was just so impressed with you, I mean... you were the only one who would stand up to your father! I thought about you all the time!

text.Zagreus: But you didn't even know me, yet. We didn't get to talking for what seemed like ages. You can be difficult to find! Since I can't fly up to the rafters like you can.

text.Dusa: Well I'm so glad you kept trying to talk to me! If you hadn't... I'd probably be up in the rafters still, building up this idea of you that's not even as good as the real thing!

text.Zagreus: Hey Dusa, something I was wondering, and it's just curiosity, mind you, but... is there somebody else...? I mean, somebody special, whom you're close with, or would like to be. Romantically, I mean. If it's all right to ask.

text.Dusa: Oh, you can ask me anything! But, um, somebody else romantically, not really, no? It's not really my thing? It doesn't mean I don't have feelings for you, though! You know that, right? I wouldn't drop what I'm doing and throw myself at danger for just anyone, you know!

text.Zagreus: I definitely know. There's seven kinds of love, or so, isn't that right? It isn't something that's taught extensively down here, though, so... there's still a lot for me to learn, I guess.

text.Dusa: Wow, I never thought of it as love until you said it there just now, Prince, but you're right! I love you, Zagreus! Hah, haha, that feels good to come right out and say, you know? OK, well, bye!

text.Zagreus: I hope it's not been too much, having to care for Cerberus, is it, Dusa? He isn't quite as fearsome as he seems. At least, that goes for two heads out of three!

text.Dusa: Oh, Cerberus is a good boy, he's fine! One of the highlights of the job, for sure. We really hit it off after he finally realized I'm not a ball! So, I've been feeding him, grooming him, changing his water dish...

text.Zagreus: ...Cleaning up after him...?

text.Dusa: Most definitely, yes. If you'll excuse me, by the way? He's got to go. I mean! I've got to go! I mean!! You know what I mean, bye!

text.Zagreus: Ungh, Dusa... it's a little much out there sometimes, I have to say. Different stresses than in here, but still.

text.Dusa: Oh don't you lose hope now, Prince Zagreus! There isn't anything you couldn't handle, I just know! You're every bit as tough as your father, except, you're nice! And you never back down from anything. You can do this!

text.Zagreus: ...I don't know that anyone can do this. No escape from the Underworld and all that. Though, thanks for cheering me up.

text.Dusa: I'm not just saying it, I mean it, Prince! Look at how far you've come! Practically everybody in this House believes in you! Even the Wretched Broker and the Head Chef! Oh, I've asked them! Everybody thinks you're going to succeed!

text.Zagreus: Can I ask you a couple of purely figurative questions here, Dusa? First, what have I gotten myself into...? And second, what am I going to do...?

text.Dusa: Believe me, I know the feeling, being in over my head! Though, if I can find my way out of my messes, then I know, I know, you definitely can! I don't know what you ought to do, but I am always here to listen.

text.Zagreus: You know Achilles reasonably well, don't you, Dusa? Seems like he's always stuck there in that hall. At least you get to fly around. Sometimes I think he wishes he was someplace else.

text.Dusa: There has to be a way to help him, Prince! He's been so loyal to this House, and he has to be your truest friend of everybody here. But he's the pity-party type. He needs someone to get him out of this!
Woo-hoo!
Oh, Prince, I heard the news about Master Achilles, that's so great! I'm going to miss him being here as often as he used to, but I'm just so happy for him, and for you!

text.Zagreus: Me too, Dusa. The happy-for-him part, at any rate! He's a good friend, and he deserved much better than to be stuck here.

text.Dusa: Oh, yes, absolutely, thanks for asking, Prince!

text.Zagreus: Erm, Ms. Dusa, I ran into hostile gorgons that resembled you out there in Asphodel. Resembled only in the vaguest sense, I mean, they lacked your charm or social graces, anyway. I just, hope you are not related, since I sort of... you know.

text.Dusa: Oh, hahaha, those old things? They're relatives just in the loosest sense, like... say you had some nasty, almost mindless siblings born entirely from your own blood, something like that? Do you have any idea how hard it was to get a steady job because of them?

text.Zagreus: So I have your permission to continue hacking down such gorgons with impunity?

text.Dusa: Maybe it is!

text.Zagreus: I had another question about your relationship to other gorgons, Dusa. So... I notice you're not much for hissing, snakelike noises when you speak, and so on? Is that some sort of special gorgon language or something?

text.Dusa: No, um, not exactly, Prince! It's what it sounds like, hrrrsssss!! Just, scary hissing, really, takes some practice not to sound like that with a forked tongue! I really wanted to fit in. Hey, how about you? Always wondered how come you have a surface accent. Weren't you born here?

text.Zagreus: Oh, wait, me? I never gave it any thought. I... guess it's from my father. He insisted that he teach me how to speak, himself. Maybe it's in the blood.

Hey, Dusa, this is kind of personal, and you don't have to answer, but I have to know. So... did you... use to have a body, and all that? Because, I've heard of gorgons, well... that you had wings, and such?

text.Dusa: Um, Prince, so, look. That's something very private that you're asking, and... I know you don't mean any harm, but it just isn't something I discuss with anyone, OK? I'm who I am. Besides! As you can see, I don't need wings to fly!

text.Zagreus: Ms. Dusa, I, erm, wanted to apologize for when I pried about your past. I just wanted to get to know you better, but... I was insensitive, and I'm sorry.

text.Dusa: Oh, Your Highness, Zagreus, come on! Don't even worry about it! I'd already forgotten, really no big deal. It's just, the past me, it's as though... it wasn't even me. This is me, now! I'm glad I'm here.

text.Zagreus: You know, it must be pretty handy, being able to turn somebody into stone. Is that something you can just do whenever you please, like... I don't know, sticking out your tongue or something?

text.Dusa: Not quite as easy as all that, but not so hard! You have to get yourself pretty worked up, and picture what you're seeing like a... well, um, like a picture, really, and then, fwoop! Stone statue. It's funny, I used to think everybody could do it!
Yay, you did it!

Hey, Prince, I saw that Orpheus, he got some time away, did you do that? He's visiting his muse, that's what he said! That's so exciting, I mean, they've been separated the whole time they've been dead!

text.Zagreus: They have a lot of catching up to do, for sure. Though I think they're going to be all right.
I'll just keep talking to him so no one else has to.
Do you have to work with Hypnos pretty closely as part of your job, Dusa? Feels like I've been running into him a lot lately.

text.Dusa: Mister Hypnos, I have trouble getting through to him, I think? He gives me plenty of advice, it's just, it isn't really why I talk to him. I... only talk to him when I don't have a lot of other choice, I guess.

Hey, Prince, is-is it really true? About Miss Meg and you, I mean, that you're, you know, um, I? You know!! Because, if so, then I want you to know, I'm just so happy for the two of you! That's wonderful, you two!! I'm so glad!

text.Zagreus: Erm, thank you, Dusa, I know you and Miss Meg are close, so, I am grateful that we have your blessings. Though, we're kind of... not out in the open with it, necessarily, so if you please, just... keep it quiet for us, would you?

text.Dusa: Oh, you better believe it, I will tell nobody whatsoever, no! I'll just be very, very happy to myself! All right, then! Bye!

Hey, I saw you and Thanatos recently, Prince! You two, if you don't mind me saying, you are quite the pair, I mean, you ought to see yourselves! You're, whew...! Makes me a little woozy just remembering it now! Well, up I go, then, bye!

text.Zagreus: Dusa, I don't mean to upset you but, I'm worried you're going to burn yourself out if you keep pushing yourself past your limits... are you sure you don't need a break?

text.Dusa: I, I'm sure, Prince. This is my chance! I'm custodian of the House of Hades! I need to keep doing my best right now. Thanks so much for the Nectar! Bye!

Oh hey, you brought some fish, could smell it all the way from down the hall, that's great!! The Head Chef can take it off your hands, should be right in the back of the lounge like always! Thanks for helping us out, Prince!

text.Zagreus: Say, Dusa, in your work around the House, you wouldn't happen to have run into a Skelly character, out in the courtyard, there, have you?

text.Dusa: Oh! Not really, um, because, my work is in the House itself, and, well, the courtyard, technically, it's kind of right outside, so, I'm supposed to stay inside the walls. But, I think I know who you mean! I've seen him, standing there just past your chamber doors. Why, is he OK?

text.Zagreus: Have to tell you, Dusa, your job seems really stressful, here. It's a big House! You have to tend to the entire thing?

text.Dusa: Oh! Well, most of it isn't so bad at all, but... ever since Cerberus tore up the lounge, I... guess it's been a little hectic, getting everything back to normal like before!

text.Zagreus: I'm not sure it was ever normal around here, but... I'm sorry I created work for you. Cerberus tore the place apart because of me. Though, maybe I can help you patch things up?

text.Dusa: Don't say that, Prince! Cerberus knows better, and besides, you have your job to do, don't you? And I have mine! And I will do my very best at it, just wait and see!

text.Zagreus: Dusa, there is something you should know about me. Me and Nyx, that is. She's not my real mother...! My real mother's called Persephone. She's out there, somewhere. On the surface. That's why I left. Wait, just a moment, are you laughing?

text.Dusa: Haha, oh, uh, no, it's just, uhh... I'm really, really, really sorry, I can't help it, I, um, didn't want to interrupt, because, I kind of knew all that, already? Um, meaning, I had heard about it, everybody talks, you know, from time to time? But I just... really hope you find her soon!

text.Zagreus: Dusa, I just can't, right now.

Dusa, there is something you should know about me. Me and Nyx, that is. She's not my real mother...! My real mother's called Persephone. She's out there, somewhere. On the surface. That's why I left. Wait, just a moment, are you laughing?

text.Dusa: Haha, oh, uh, no, it's just, uhh... I'm really, really, really sorry, I can't help it, I, um, didn't want to interrupt, because, I kind of knew all that, already? Um, meaning, I had heard about it, everybody talks, you know, from time to time? But I just... really hope you find her soon!

text.Zagreus: I trust you not to mention this to everybody in the House, but... I have. Found her, that is! I'm... trying to figure out what happens next. Can't really talk about it yet, so... bear with me?

text.Dusa: Whooa, that is exciting, what's she really like? Is she tall? Does she have your eyes? Where does she live? What does she do? Does she have a job? What color is her hair? Is she, you know, is she with anybody?

text.Zagreus: It is! It's both OK and great.

text.Dusa: Whoa, why, Prince, you're... wait, you're back? I mean, I thought...! I heard that...! How come you're still here?

text.Zagreus: Oh, hah, yes! I made it pretty far! On that account you heard correctly, Dusa, but... turns out I have unfinished business here, so... I should be turning up like this from time to time.

text.Dusa: Oh wow, well, that's great!! I mean, I hope it's great? I mean, if you agree it's great, I also think it's great! If that's OK?

text.Zagreus: Don't worry, you're not missing much.
Dusa, in my father's chambers, he... he has a bedside portrait of somebody. Is... is she someone with whom you are familiar?

text.Dusa: Oh, Prince, I'm not permitted in your father's chambers, are you kidding me? I'd ask you what it's like in there, but... I don't think I'm supposed to know!

text.Zagreus: Dusa, wherever did you get that Fidi Companion you gave me? You know how much that thing is worth? To me at least, I don't know who collects those anymore, but I sure do!

text.Dusa: Oh! I'm so glad you like her, Prince! I could think of no one better to take care of her, and best of all... she'll remind you of me! But as for where I got her, you're not going to believe it... can you guess?

text.Zagreus: What, wait, you don't mean... no, not from Nyx, herself? Did you, wait, Dusa... you didn't, how to put this, borrow her from Nyx, did you?

text.Dusa: Haha, no! Happen to value my job, here, among other aspects of my well-being, but... after the lounge assignment, Nyx herself commended me, and gave me Fidi as a nice reward! Although, she probably knew I'd just end up giving her to you!

text.Zagreus: How's your relationship with Nyx been lately, Dusa? She strikes me as a pretty intense supervisor. You getting on OK?

text.Dusa: Oh, Miss Nyx? I'll do whatever she says! Why, did she say something about me? She did, oh, why would you be asking otherwise, oh no. Am I losing my job?!

text.Zagreus: Hey, no, no no, it's not like that, it's just... a feeling that I've had from glimpses of the interactions that I've seen between you two. I haven't always got along with Nyx, but I know she cares deeply about this House and everyone in it. Including you.

text.Dusa: Hahaha, well, that's nice to know! She cares about my work performance, that's for very sure, and I am doing everything I can to live up to and exceed her expectations, tell her that!
Aah! The Prince! Miss Nyx, she, I, I'm not supposed to talk to you! I have to go!

text.Zagreus: Dusa, hey, hey what's the matter, you seem... something's wrong, what happened? Tell me, please.

text.Dusa: No, Your Highness, you... you're not supposed to talk to me, I mean, I'm not supposed to talk to you, you see, Miss Nyx, she... oh, I will be in so much trouble, now!

text.Zagreus: Wait, Dusa, slow down, what is the matter? Nyx really has forbidden you from even speaking with me? Do you know on what grounds?

text.Dusa: I've no idea, Prince, I, look... I really want to keep my job here, so, I can't, I can't be seen with you right now, like this, please understand, I have to go, OK?

text.Zagreus: This isn't working...

Dusa, I... think that Nyx has some concerns... maybe with me, because it's like you said, she doesn't want us talking here like this. Is she... not satisfied with the work you've been doing, or something?

text.Dusa: Ah, Prince, no, it isn't you, it's definitely me! There's all these things she said I need to work on, calmness, not making so many lists, putting things into perspective, not working myself too hard, not taking blame for things that aren't my fault...!

text.Zagreus: Those sound like reasonable goals, though I just wish that Nyx could find a way to tell you that wasn't so upsetting. Won't you take care of yourself, Dusa, please?

text.Dusa: ...And plus, she said I'm not supposed to talk to you, she said that too, oh, I am going to be in so much trouble, aah!
I, um, Prince, I... wanted to say good-bye, because... it's my last day. Or night? Um, anyway, it's really been a pleasure, knowing you, and working here, and so...!

text.Zagreus: Wait, wait, wait, what exactly happened, your last day or night, what is all this? You're really leaving? Why?

text.Dusa: I lost my job! Miss Nyx, she... it's her final word, and so... I need to go, before I make things any worse. Farewell, Highness! Farewell...!
Prince, I... hi, again, I guess... I guess I'm back? At work, here, once again?

text.Zagreus: Imagine my relief. I'm glad that Nyx has come around. I... understand she was concerned, but... I hope she never looks past all your good qualities like that again.

text.Dusa: I hope so, too. I'm glad to have my job back. It's hard work, and I know there's more to life, such as it is, than this, but... it matters a lot to me, you know? I have to do this, so... I'm glad that all of you are letting me.

text.Zagreus: So, what even happened when you lost your job, Dusa? Did you have someplace else to stay? Was everything all right?

text.Dusa: You know, it's funny, after I was fired... at first, I just couldn't believe it, I... felt lost! But, after a few days or nights, it's like, it opened up my eyes, you know? Suddenly, I had all this time to myself, and... what I realized was, I was... so, so tired. I think I really needed the break.

text.Zagreus: I'm surprised you wanted to come back to work after something like that. Wouldn't you be totally fed up? Burned out on the whole thing?

text.Dusa: I love this work too much to get burned out, Prince. But that's me. I know there's more to being alive or being dead than just your work, but... my work happens to be important to me. And besides... if I don't push myself from time to time, how can I ever know my limits, right?

text.Zagreus: But if you go too far beyond your limits, things can get bad. Believe me. I mean, you almost lost the job you care so much about.

text.Dusa: You're right, I... need to be more careful, not to push myself too hard, too often. Hey, could I ask a favor? Would you tell me if I go too far with work again?

text.Zagreus: How's work lately, Dusa? You seem to have a handle on your new responsibilities, or so I hear from Nyx.

text.Dusa: Oh yes, it's going pretty well, so far, I think! I have some new accounting duties, though I've parceled everything, and got a budget for a little extra help. It's funny, I-I should be busier than ever, but... I have more time to spare, lately, and things are good, I guess?

text.Zagreus: You're doing great.
Dusa, hey, I wanted to congratulate you! Saw you were chosen as the featured servant of the House, getting your portrait there, right in the lounge for all to see! That's quite an honor!

text.Dusa: Oh, haha, it's really nothing, Prince, something that anybody could have done really, as long as they were fired up to do their very, very best, all the time, with a positive attitude, and without worrying too much about the overwhelming amount of work that still needs to be done!

text.Zagreus: I guess we are...

text.Dusa: Oh, Prince! Persephone, your mother, wow, she's, woww...! It's no wonder you wanted to try to find her. She's something else! Although, I guess you didn't know that till you met her, huh? But, still!

text.Zagreus: It's definitely an adjustment, with my mother here. Especially for her! I'm glad the two of you are getting on all right. I guess things will be different, now, but... hopefully, it's for the better, isn't it?

text.Dusa: Are you kidding?! Ah, didn't mean to be so rude, it's just, I think it's definitely better, now! We're like a complete team!

text.Zagreus: Bye...

text.Dusa: Um, Prince, so, is it... really true, then, that you're staying, and... that you'll be working here, officially, I guess?

text.Zagreus: I... well, when you put it that way, yes, I guess it is! We're going to try and make it work like this, for now.

text.Dusa: Well you know what this means, don't you? We're official co-workers now!! Isn't that so exciting? We can share our latest learnings, compare notes about the challenges we're up against, run into one another in the hall...

text.Zagreus: Dusa... we've been doing everything you said this entire time.

text.Dusa: But it is not the same! The entire feel of it's completely different, now! You'll see! So, OK!! Bye!

text.Zagreus: Yeah... thanks, though.
...I think I finally know a little more about how you must feel, Dusa. Working for Father, I mean. I was so intent on running away from here, but... here I am.

text.Dusa: Look, Prince, um... your father's always been a pretty scary god. And, this is something between you and him. Though, if you can forgive him, I guess... it means you'd stay? And I would like that, so... that's where I stand! I know it's really complicated, though.

text.Zagreus: Well, you did amazing here.
Dusa, this whole place, it looks immaculate! That's even after all Olympus came here for that giant feast? How did you get everything clean so fast?

text.Dusa: Oh, ha-hah! Well! I guess I have my ways, Prince. Sometimes you get one of those jobs and you just want to give it everything you've got, you know? I get a lot of jobs like that! Feeding Cerberus, cleaning the rafters! But this one? I just knew it was the perfect job for me!

text.Hypnos: Oh, uh, hey there, Dusa! How's your endless toil treating you?

text.Dusa: Um, Mister Hypnos, do you... maybe think that you could, you know, uh, keep an eye on the procession line before Lord Hades? Like you were supposed to...?

text.Hypnos: Oh! Um, that's no problem, I can definitely do that, I'll just add it to the list!

text.Dusa: Um, good, then! Glad we had a chance to chat. Now, maybe get some sleep or something. You look pretty beat...?

text.Hypnos: Goodbye!!

text.Dusa: Mister Hypnos, I, uh, wanted to check in with you again, regarding the procession line that's... right in front of you, right over there, it's... moving pretty slow.

text.Hypnos: I know! Those shades, they just go on and on, and on and on, forever, blathering about this or that! I mean, Lord Hades, it's a wonder he can stand it, listening to them every day or night!

text.Dusa: Um, well, it's just, I think you were supposed to keep things moving, so, if they're taking too long, I guess that maybe you could say something, or... any bright ideas?

text.Hypnos: It's a toughie, Dusa, because I think it's important that the shades who wait their turn, why, that they get a chance to say their piece! But it's a real tricky situation you bring up, so, let me tell you what I'm going to do: I am going to sleep on it! And then, get back to you!

text.Dusa: OK, well... if you don't, though, I'll check in with you again, later, I guess? Because, I'm under orders, so... um... bye...

text.Hypnos: You bet!
Heya Dusa, let me guess! You're here regarding the procession of these shades, who have been standing here for quite some time, clogging the hall a bit... they've barely moved at all!

text.Dusa: Y, you guessed it, Mister Hypnos, so... have you, um, given any thought to maybe focusing the traffic flow through here a little bit, to keep the hallway clearer, and, oh, I don't know, put some sort of time limit in place?

text.Hypnos: You know, can't say I have! I've got my registration list, and I have had to keep a careful eye on it, with all the shades that have been pouring in? It's really gotten slow around here!

text.Dusa: It definitely has, I... have to go, um, hope you get yourself some rest, OK?

text.Hypnos: Mark it away!

text.Dusa: I can't believe it, Mister Hypnos, how... how did you do it? All the shades that have been lining up, they... they've been moving right along!

text.Hypnos: You know, you're right, they have! They definitely have. It's pretty hard to notice, since they're slow, but I have a keen eye. And so do you! You noticed before I did in this case. What did you say your question was back there?

text.Dusa: I asked you how you did it, got the traffic flow moving a little faster, and... it's the sarcophagus things, isn't it? Right down the hall! The shades, they're scared to stand around! That's brilliant, Mister Hypnos, I'm impressed!

text.Hypnos: Oh, hahaha, that, well, really, it was nothing, Dusa! Though, I'll tell you something! It is good to know that you're impressed with me!

text.Dusa: I, haha, don't know if I'd go that far, um, anyway! I'll mark this as resolved!

text.Nyx: ...And after that, Dusa, you are to clean the rafters once again, and prune the gardens thoroughly. By then it should be time to tend the kitchens, and sweep the lounging area a second time...

text.Dusa: Y, yes, right away!

text.Nyx: ...Lastly, Dusa, you are not permitted to address the Prince, unless first spoken to. You are invisible to him. Now, are we understood?

text.Dusa: Yes, Miss Nyx, we're understood, I mean... I understand. I, I'll be going, then.

text.Nyx: Do your best work.

text.Zagreus: Hooray...!

text.Dusa: Miss Nyx, you're...? Do I want my job again, I... wha, I, more than anything! This job, it, it means everything to me, I mean, working with you? You are the Night Itself! This place, and all of you, all of it, it's so amazing to me, and I just... I, just I want to help! Just, give me one more chance!

text.Nyx: Your one more chance has certain stipulations, Dusa. If you think it is necessary to exceed the allotted time for your responsibilities, I expect you to ask. You are not the sole bearer of this House's fate. Your temperament toward your work is as important as the end result. Now then... I would ask that you return to your post.

text.Dusa: What, I, Miss Nyx, you mean... like, start right now? Now now? I mean, I, I don't have a lot of pressing obligations, so, I'll do it, yes!! I accept! I'm so excited to be back! Where do I even start, I can survey the lounge, sweep the cobwebs, walk Cerberus, check the pantry, ah, OK, I'm off!!
Thank you!

text.Zagreus: Well deserved.

text.Nyx: ...and, therefore, for your diligence and service, and for having demonstrated such improvement... by my authority as Night Itself, I hereby name you Chief Custodian of the House of Hades, and appoint to you the privileges implied. Bear the responsibility with honor, Dusa.

text.Dusa: Miss Nyx, I am truly honored, and, I'm very grateful for this opportunity, and for the trust you've placed in me, in this expanded role. I promise you, I will not let you down. Not you, or anybody here! Thank you so much!!

text.Nyx: You are most welcome. The orderliness of this House is a reflection of the realm as a whole. You have internalized this, and understood that a disciplined approach toward work is far more valuable than mere exertion of effort. Although, you understand the need for exertion, as well.

text.Megaera: ...And then, all seven of those wretches tried cutting to the front of the procession line, can you believe the nerve? As though they'd get an audience that way.

text.Dusa: Ha, hahah, what a bunch of dummies! What were they even thinking, cutting the line, I mean, in front of you?

text.Megaera: Let's just say, if they still have any complaints for our Lord Hades, they'll be waiting for a long, long time before they get the chance to bring them up.
...I swear you're right that one is such an idiot...! Though anyway, I'd best get back to work. Next round's on me, Dusa, and you take care.

text.Dusa: You take care, too, Miss Meg, thanks for the drink! Bye now...!
What are you, kidding me? Of course!

text.Megaera: ...Follow your heart? That's odd advice, especially from you. Though, no offense intended.

text.Dusa: I just mean, if you don't believe in the work you're doing, why keep on doing it, just out of obligation? You have to take care of yourself.

text.Megaera: I don't think there's any rush for that. We won't just shrivel up and die in forty years like mortals do. But, I know what you're saying. I'll think about it, Dusa. Thanks.

text.Dusa: Hey, look, I understand. I really do.

text.Megaera: ...We got off on the wrong foot from the start. Just what happens when you're born of Titan blood, I guess. It's for the best we haven't crossed paths much since.

text.Dusa: But they're your sisters, I mean... they're family! You must have something in common, some way of, I don't know, seeing eye to eye?

text.Megaera: You're more my sister than they are to me, Dusa. I don't always agree with Lord Hades but I am thankful that they're not permitted in this House.
You're right. And same to you.
...You sure that you're all right, with everything? I just... I wouldn't want you to be caught up in the middle of all this. If you so much as said to call it off...

text.Dusa: No, nononono, no, Meg, no! No, Meg! Come on, now, are you kidding me? I mean, I couldn't be happier about it, really! You deserve this! As long as you're happy, yourself, right?

text.Megaera: Well, thank you, Dusa. You've always been so kind. I don't quite know what to say.

text.Dusa: Hey, now, that's my line! Look, though, I better get going, but, I just want to say this is great news, all right? Thank you for telling me!

text.Zagreus: She's got this.

text.Hades: ...Would that all my subjects exhibited such promptness. Your report, then, if you please, Dusa?

text.Dusa: Sir! The office currently is running smoothly, sir! Lounge attendance is up by twenty-eight percent, with customer satisfaction ratings in the eightieth percentile. No issues to report at this time.

text.Hades: See that we achieve thirty percent before the turn of the aeon, Chief Custodian. Other than that... a satisfactory report. Now, carry on.

text.Persephone: Thank you, in turn!

text.Dusa: Um, it's my great pleasure to make your acquaintance. Call me Dusa, please! I, I'm your House custodian? And I am at your service! Anything you need, just call, OK?

text.Persephone: Dusa! Wonderful to know you! This House is immaculate! Night-and-day difference from before. Now I know exactly whom to compliment.

text.Dusa: Thanks so much! I will not let you down!!
I, I, I, oh no, I, just forgot something, I, I have to go!
Oh, um, Your Highness, I was just, making the rounds again!!
Um, everything is spick and span like always, Your Highness!!
Y-you'd tell me if I did anything wrong, wouldn't you, Prince?
...dusted the halls, dusted the library, dusted the sconces, dusted the doorknobs, dusted the chairs...
...let's see, I cleaned the mantle, cleaned the rafters, cleaned the skulls, cleaned the bar-room...
Oh, um, hi! Hello, Your Highness, nice to see you! Thanks!
Working hard, Your Highness! Always working!
I'll make sure everything is taken care of!
Oh, hahaha, thanks for talking to me, Prince, I have to go!
Hi Prince, I fed Cerberus already, all three heads!
Wha, hah-haha, oh, you startled me, Your Highness...!
I'm just keeping busy busy busy here like always, Prince!
I, I, I, I'm sorry that you died again out there, Your Highness...!
Oh, um, hi! Is... everything all right, there, Prince?
Nothing gets dirty around here while I am on the job, Your Highness...!
Don't worry, Prince! I'll keep an eye on things!
You can count on me, Your Highness!
Anything I can do for you right now, or, maybe later...?
...let's see, I did the dishes, fed the heads, cleaned the cupboards, cleared the pool...
Oh, Prince, um, I'm supposed to be at work, so, I can't talk, OK?
Excuse me, sorry, I just have to file this report, it's very late!
I, I, I have everything here well under control, Highness!!
What, is something wrong, Prince? I'll look into it, right now, up there!!
Am I in trouble for something again, or, no...?
I'm always at 110%, hah, hahah!
Um, I, I, I, I'm sorry, I, I better get back to my cleaning...!
Oh, wow! I'm so sorry, Prince, I'm just behind already on my daily chores!
Ah! Haha, got me again, Prince, sneaking up on me like that!
You'll get them next time, Prince, I'm sure of it! I think?
Just making sure the lounge is squeaky clean!
This is going to be the best lounge in all the Underworld!
You let me know if you see any dust around here, won't you, Prince?
You rest assured I'm not even remotely tired, Prince!
Please count on me for all your household needs!
I'll make sure Cerberus has everything he needs while you're out!
Don't tell me I'm in trouble, am I, Prince?!
Just thought I'd mention, I, I really love this job!!
...stocked the store room, checked the locks, cleaned the tiles, watered the trees...
...checked the contracts, cleared the ledgers, set the tables, washed the windows...
...sorted the files, gathered the feedback, updated the schedule, sent the report...
You please take care of yourself, OK, Prince?
I sometimes get so worried for you, Zagreus...!
Don't worry, Prince, I have everything here well under control...!
I hope you have a great whatever time it is out there, Highness!
I will definitely keep an eye on things while you are out!
Just in the middle of a wall-to-wall inspection right now, Prince!
Heard everything's been good lately between you and Miss Meg!
Eternal friends forever, right, Prince Zagreus?
So glad to see you back here, Your Highness!
Made sure the House was nice and tidy for you, Prince!
Your Highness, hi! All's well here, nothing to report!!
Looks like we've both been keeping busy, huh, Your Highness?
Whew, I have been so busy, lately, Prince! The same as you!
Sorry, not much time to chat more right now, Prince!
We'll have to catch up in the lounge sometime, huh, Prince?
Oh, haha, you startled me, there, Prince!
Hold on, Prince! Think I saw some dust I missed up there!
Sorry, got to file this report, now, Prince!
Nice to see you, now I'm off to clean the rafters once again!
I'm on duty right now, but it's really nice to see you like this, Prince!
I know your job gets frustrating sometimes, so please remember to take breaks, all right?
I hope you're always finding joy in work like I do, Prince!
From the reports I've seen it looks like you've been doing such great work out there!
Um, I, I, I, I'm sorry, I, I better get back to my cleaning...!

text.Megaera: Not now, Zag. Private meeting.

text.Dusa: Don't work yourself too hard, OK, Highness?
Please do remember to take breaks, OK?

text.Megaera: We'll have to chat some other time, here, Zag.

text.Dusa: You get rest from time to time, for me, OK?
I hope you get to see Miss Meg out there next time!
I hope you'll get to see Thanatos again soon!

text.Megaera: Can't you see we're in the middle of a conversation, Zagreus?
Excuse us, Zagreus, we're in the middle of a meeting here.
You know you can just let us talk without being interrupted, Zagreus?
This particular discussion doesn't concern you, Zag.
...Sometimes, though, Dusa, he's not the best at taking hints...

text.Dusa: Now, here you go, Cerbie! And, um, don't eat me, please?
Um, here you go, boy! Triple order, just the way you like it!
...Just, please be careful where you go after you eat all this, this time, OK, Cerbie?
Oh, come on, Cerbie, hurry up and eat! This stuff can't be that bad! I mean... can it?

text.Zagreus: Erm, Ms. Dusa? I wanted you to have this. It's nothing really, just... for your hard work.

text.Dusa: P-P-Prince, I'm really grateful for this, really, and I thought, I, kind of got something for you...?
Wh-whaaaa, b-but, there must be some mistake, I, Prince, you're giving this to me...?

text.Zagreus: I want you to know we all appreciate you, Dusa. Don't work yourself too hard on my account, OK?

text.Dusa: Ohh, oh, oh, oh my, Your Highness, are you... are you really sure you want me to have this?

text.Zagreus: I really am, Dusa. I hope you enjoy it.

text.Dusa: B-b-but, Prince, I, don't know what to say, I... are you joking around with me, maybe...?

text.Zagreus: Oh, I am deadly serious, Dusa, honest. It's for you.
OK, bye...!
Dusa, you must work harder than anyone in this House, keeping everything so neat and orderly. I don't think it should be thankless work, so, thank you! And I'd like for you to have this.

text.Dusa: Oh, Prince, wow, thank you! Thanks so much!! You've been so generous, I... I think I'm speechless! No, can't think of anything to say right now!

text.Zagreus: Oh, you said it all! Don't mean to put you on the spot or anything. I'm just glad we've had a chance to get to know each other.

text.Dusa: I... I'm glad we've had a chance to know each other, too. Thanks for the Nectar! I can tell it's really, really good! Um, OK, bye!

text.Zagreus: Well, you enjoy, all right?
Hey Dusa? Here's some more of this really, really good Nectar for you! Please keep up the wonderful work, and more importantly, keep being your wonderful self.

text.Dusa: I, I, I, I'm really very flattered, Prince, but, I've just been so busy, lately, that I haven't even had a chance to try the last bottle you gave me, so... you want this back, maybe for someone else?

text.Zagreus: Please, it's yours! Besides, you must have some time off coming up when you can enjoy it, don't you?

text.Dusa: Oh! I mean, maybe I do? I think maybe I do, except, nobody's told me anything about that, and besides, there's so much work to do around the House still, I just can't leave everything like this!!

text.Zagreus: Hey, Dusa? Congratulations on completing your assignment with the lounge. Look at this place! It's better than ever. All thanks to your effort and dedication. Here, this is for you. Something special for the occasion.

text.Dusa: Whoa, I, this, this is Ambrosia, Prince! But, this is for gods...! This isn't for... someone like me? But, wait, wait wait, no, here, I'm going to do it, I am going to do it, here, take this!! I got it, just for you, so, take it, please! Farewell!!

text.Zagreus: Dusa, wait...!
Ambrosia isn't only for the gods, you know, Dusa. It's for anyone we really care about. So, here. Please, enjoy this, or... just add it to the lounge's stash. Whatever suits you.

text.Dusa: Oh, I, but, you... really mean that, huh...? But, you're the Prince himself, and I'm just... look, we both know I am just a floating monster head. And a custodian. I just don't understand. Why keep on being nice to me, like this? I thought you'd never even talk to me...

text.Zagreus: You're so much more than what you said. I wish you could see that. If only everybody in this House had your spirit.

text.Dusa: Ah. If only everybody in this House had yours, Prince Zagreus. You've been so kind to me, and I'm glad we've had a chance to get to know each other more. It's really nice, sometimes... knowing somebody really cares about me here?

text.Zagreus: It should be more than sometimes that you feel that way, as far as I'm concerned. I just... I've never met anybody like you before. My father always told me not to smile quite as much, but... you're like me.

text.Dusa: What, because I smile, haha? Smiling's just a little something that I like to do to deal with the day! Though, oh, that's what you meant, I... oh, I see. I, look, this is kind of a lot, I, I had better go...! I'll cherish the Ambrosia, though, OK?!

text.Zagreus: See you, Dusa.
I got you more Ambrosia, Dusa, and I hope this is OK. I figure maybe you could use this for the lounge? Special events, guests, that sort of thing?

text.Dusa: ...I'm sorry that I flew away last time you brought me something like this, Prince... I mean, Zagreus. It's really strange for me to call you that, I... when I started here, they told me not to even speak with you, and now, uh... here we are...!

text.Zagreus: Well, look, if I listened to everything I was told, my life would be a lot different and a lot worse off, I think! So... who cares what anybody says? I enjoy your company.

text.Dusa: And I enjoy yours, too! Wasn't long ago that I was just a lonely gorgon head, all by myself in the big Underworld, looking for steady work. And then, I heard about the opening here, in your father's House? Well I got it! It seemed too good to be real. And then, there was you...

text.Zagreus: I remember when we first met. You were carrying three bowls for Cerberus and bumped right into me. It all went flying, but you cleaned up half of it before it hit the ground. Then flew away before I got your name. I thought I'd never see you again.

text.Dusa: I was so embarrassed! Worse... I thought I was done for, here. But, I got another chance! That was your doing, wasn't it? You've been looking out for me, all this time! That's so sweet of you, I... I don't know how to thank you, I... I, I better put this Ambrosia away, for safe keeping, OK?

text.Zagreus: See you soon.

Dusa, I was thinking that this batch of Ambrosia ought to hold the lounge over for quite a while! Keep things livelier for everyone. And, please take a bottle for yourself, won't you? As a token of my affection.

text.Dusa: Oh! Y-you said your affection, huh, I... wow! I... really like you, also, Zagreus. I liked you from the start! You were so different from your father, and Miss Nyx, I could just tell, but... wait, what am I saying, I am such a dummy! You're just being friendly with me, right...?

text.Zagreus: I would be more than that, if it pleased you. You're very wonderful, and... you light up this House. But I would never risk our friendship, so, if this is where we draw the boundary, please, just let me know.

text.Dusa: Um... wait, wait. Wait, wait. Did you just say I'm... wonderful?

text.Zagreus: I did, indeed. And I am glad to get it off my chest, if you must know! Though... what about you? How do you feel?

text.Dusa: I, wow, I, I never thought you'd... have those kinds of feelings, for somebody like me. It's really nice to hear! It makes me feel complete. But, um, Zagreus, I don't know if I can be what you need, I mean? Wait. You weren't, you weren't just being nice to me for all this time, because...?

text.Zagreus: What? No, no, Dusa, of course not, I... ungh, why is it so damn difficult to share one's feelings with somebody else? I don't want to ruin what we have. If only you could see what's in my heart.

text.Dusa: Oh, hahaha, I was just checking, don't feel bad, OK? You don't seem capable of hiding what's in your heart. And I mean that in the best possible way. I'm so happy, it's just... all this is a lot, and, I'm on duty right now, but... see you soon...?

CHOICE.Dusa: Oh no, no no no, Your Highness, are you, really giving this to me?

CHOICE.Zagreus: Yes, yes I am, Ms. Dusa, and I hope you enjoy it. Be seeing you, OK?
A Chthonic Companion!! Dusa, really? You're the best!

text.Zagreus: Ms. Dusa, I, um, wanted to apologize, for when I pried about your past. I just wanted to get to know you better. But I was insensitive, and I'm sorry. Please forgive me.

text.Dusa: Oh, Your Highness, Zagreus, come on! Don't even worry about it! I'd already forgotten, really no big deal. It's just, the past me, it's as though... it wasn't even me. This is me, now! I'm glad I'm here.

text.Zagreus: Why good to see you, Charon mate! Just minding my own business, taking in the sights, and, hey what's that you got, some sort of wares for sale? Then, I'll just have a look around.
Why good to see you, Charon mate! Just minding my own business, taking in the sights, and, sure is awfully convenient to be running into you like this! I'd all this coin I wanted to get rid of.
I had to ask...
Charon mate, now hypothetically, if I provided you with, say, a thousand coins, would you be willing to give me a ride in your beautiful boat? Upriver, I should say, specifically.
I'll take that as a no.
Erm, Charon, mate...? I don't suppose you've given any further thought to my proposal to, just, you know... ferry me up to the surface? Seeing as it's not out of your way.
Brilliant.
Got to say, you are a sight for sore eyes, there, Charon! So, uh... looks like you're selling, is that it? You come to help me out?
Hey good to see you out here, mate! And looks as though you've got some fine wares up for sale, don't you?
Fine day to you as well, there, mate! Now let's have a look at your supply, shall we?
I'll just have a look around.
You must have a lot of stops around these parts, don't you, Charon mate. Most of the dead are here in Asphodel, correct?
Couldn't agree more, mate.
Hey, Charon, I'm in Asphodel now, aren't I? I'd always heard this was some flower-covered meadow type place, not such a... terrifying hellscape.
Great.
Hey, Charon. If there happens to be something really horrible awaiting me beyond that door there, then... give me a sign, won't you?
That bad, huh.
Care to provide me any insight as to just what sort of hideous monstrosity awaits me over on the next infernal island, Charon mate?
Hah, I knew it!
Well, look at you, Charon mate, you're looking well! Something's different about you, can't quite put my finger on it. Have you done something with your hair?
Well, cheers!
Hey, Charon mate, wanted to thank you once again for the fine hourglass you gave to me before! It's been very handy with those Wells of yours.
Well that is a relief!

Hey Charon, you're not angry with me after we had it out last time, are you, I mean... I figured since you gave me one of your Loyalty Cards, must mean everything's fine, but... I'm... just making sure.
Always appreciate your sense of humor, mate.
No hard feelings about that whole battle-to-the-death thing last time, right, Charon? Especially since you absolutely demolished me. I was just messing with you, you know that, right?
You don't say.

Hi Charon! I finally met Hermes, god of swiftness, travel, bringing souls of the departed to your boat. Calls you his professional associate. You and he, you've been working together for a while, haven't you?
Err I'm sorry mate, I meant you no offense.

Charon, I always thought Olympians never consorted with chthonic gods such as yourself. But it sounds like Hermes is a close colleague of yours. You wouldn't... happen to know why he's helping me, would you?
I'll... keep it to myself for now, then. Thanks.
Charon, Hermes told me that the other Olympians are unaware he's lending his support to me. I'm curious to know what's going on. Thinking of asking Nyx. Figured I'd check with you first.
Ah, right, didn't think so. Forget I asked!
Charon mate, I know you meet an awful lot of dead, and it probably gets very difficult to remember them all, but... I don't suppose the name Skelly means anything to you, does it?
Well, I meant every word!

Charon mate? As a longtime customer, I just wanted to take a moment to thank you again for your invaluable service as a part of my repeated attempts at getting out of here. What would I have done without your wares all these many times? Besides dying a lot faster.
It's quite all right, I don't mind the walk.

Charon, mate? Wanted to thank you very, very much for bringing Mother and me home. Your boat's quite comfortable, you know! Though, I suppose you won't be making a habit of giving me a ride, will you?
Appreciate your support!

Charon, as I know you serve the realm, I just wanted to say I look forward to continuing to work with you in a somewhat more official capacity. I'll still be breaking out of here like always, but... well, you've probably heard.
We'll have to do it again sometime.
Hope you enjoyed the feast with the Olympians, Charon! We didn't have much of a chance to chat, though it looked like you and Hermes were having a good time.
Thank you.

Charon? Unrelated to anything whatsoever, I just wanted to say... I'm very grateful to have your support. You've always done your own thing... I never get to see you at the House. But I know you care! An awful lot. So, cheers.
Charon, you've been such a reassuring sight, I thought I'd offer you a token of my gratitude.
Wait, you don't have to give me something in return, it was a gift! Though, you're insisting, aren't you.
